original: 'di ni dang po'o /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o /
translated: This is the first.

original: de la mngon sum dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: de la mngon sum dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: Here, the characteristic of direct perception is explained by the phrase direct perception and so on, which is taught in order.

original: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas bstan pa nyid las rnam pa lngar rnam par dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lngas bstan pa nyid las rnam pa lngar rnam par dbye ste /
translated: This is also classified into five types from the very teaching of the five characteristics.

original: 'di ni dang po mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: This is the first teaching on the characteristic of direct perception.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This is also taught in three ways:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan to //
translated: by brief explanation, by detailed explanation, and by conclusion.

original: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the first brief explanation itself.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'di ni 'jig rten na mngon sum gyi mtshan mas dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid 'di ni 'jig rten na mngon sum gyi mtshan mas dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The impermanence of all conditioned things, the suffering of all conditioned things, and the selflessness of all phenomena are directly perceived by the world through characteristics. This is the second detailed explanation.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sutra is also divided into two parts.

original: dang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is as follows:

original: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po bstan nas yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni dngos po bstan nas yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: All formations are impermanent, etc. Having taught the entities, he explained them correctly.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten na mngon sum gyi tshad mas dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i tshad rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten na mngon sum gyi tshad mas dmigs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i tshad rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: This is perceived by direct valid knowledge in the world is the division of valid knowledge.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated as follows:

original: 'jig rten na btags pa tsam du mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par zad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na btags pa tsam du mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin par zad de /
translated: In the world, what is merely imputed is not direct valid knowledge, but it is direct valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is direct valid knowledge, it is called direct valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa rags pa 'di la brten nas mi rtag pa phra mo la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma la gnas nas @140a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa rags pa 'di la brten nas mi rtag pa phra mo la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma la gnas nas @140a * //
translated: Thus, based on this coarse impermanence, subtle impermanence and so on are inferred. Therefore, based on direct valid knowledge,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the characteristic of the object of observation is taught.

original: dngos po de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is this entity?

original: de la re zhig tshe gcig gi mi rtag pa'i don rags pa la brten nas mi rtag pa nyid du mngon sum mthong ba ni mi rtag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig tshe gcig gi mi rtag pa'i don rags pa la brten nas mi rtag pa nyid du mngon sum mthong ba ni mi rtag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: First, the direct perception of impermanence based on the gross meaning of impermanence in one lifetime is called the valid knowledge of direct perception of impermanence.

original: rang gi lus kyi gnod pa sna tshogs myong ba mthong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i tshad ma la bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus kyi gnod pa sna tshogs myong ba mthong ba'i phyir sdug bsngal mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i tshad ma la bya'o //
translated: The valid knowledge of direct perception of suffering is the direct perception of the various harms experienced in one's own body.

original: smod cing tshol ba rnams la rang dbang med pa'i phyir bdag med par shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smod cing tshol ba rnams la rang dbang med pa'i phyir bdag med par shes pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The valid knowledge of direct perception of selflessness is the knowledge of selflessness that arises from seeing that those who are despised and sought after are not independent.

original: 'di dag ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyis rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems kyis rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: These are not valid knowledge of direct perception because they are conceptual thoughts of the wisdom of hearing and reflection with a distracted mind.

original: 'di nyid la ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid la ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the direct perception of the world.

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na //
translated: In other explanations,

original: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams spyir bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams spyir bsdus pa'o //
translated: The statement all formations are impermanent includes all conditioned things in general.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed dag go //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ces bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed dag go //
translated: The statement all formations are suffering includes all conditioned things that are subject to affliction.

original: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba ni chos thams cad bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba ni chos thams cad bsdu ba'o //
translated: The statement all things are without self includes all things.

original: 'di dag ni chos gsum zhes bya ste /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las nges pa'i don ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid do //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos gsum zhes bya ste / de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las nges pa'i don ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid do // zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: These are called the three doctrines.

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the text of the Levels of Spiritual Practice states, The definitive meaning is that all formations are impermanent, all that is subject to affliction is suffering, and all things are empty and without self-existence.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi rigs pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'di dag gi rigs pa yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: The reasonings for these three doctrines of impermanence and so forth are endowed with two kinds of meaning.

original: dang po ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa ste /
translated: The first is the reasoning of impermanence and so forth in terms of their individual characteristics.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan mas dmigs pa so so dag mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan mas dmigs pa so so dag mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the objects of perception are distinct and have their own characteristics.

original: gnyis pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de dper na skud pas me tog brgyus pa dang 'dra bar 'di ltar mi rtag pa gcig gis phung po la sogs pa la khyab par gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de dper na skud pas me tog brgyus pa dang 'dra bar 'di ltar mi rtag pa gcig gis phung po la sogs pa la khyab par gyur te /
translated: The second is the general characteristic, for example, like a flower strung on a thread, in this way, one impermanence pervades the aggregates and so on.

original: sdug bsngal dang / bdag med pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / bdag med pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Suffering and selflessness are also like that.

original: 'dir mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid phyi ma la brten pa yin pas de'i phyir btags pa tsam du 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: 'dir mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid phyi ma la brten pa yin pas de'i phyir btags pa tsam du 'jig rten pa'i mngon sum zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Here, what is called direct valid knowledge is based on the latter general characteristic, therefore, it is called the worldly direct valid knowledge that is merely imputed.

original: yang dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the correct direct valid knowledge.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni yang dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma la brten nas 'jig rten gyi @140b mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni yang dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma la brten nas 'jig rten gyi @140b mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya ste /
translated: In the treatise Yogācārabhūmi, based on the correct direct valid knowledge, it is called the worldly direct valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise itself, it says:

original: mngon sum de su'i mngon sum du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum de su'i mngon sum du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Whose perception is this perception?

original: smras pa / mjug bsdu na bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mjug bsdu na bzhi ste /
translated: In summary, there are four kinds:

original: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum dang / yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang / dag pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum dang / yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang / dag pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: perception by the physical sense faculties, perception by mental experience, worldly perception, and pure perception.

original: dbang po'i gzugs can gyi mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzugs can gyi mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Perception by the physical sense faculties is as follows:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyis dbang po gzugs can lnga po rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyis dbang po gzugs can lnga po rnams kyi spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is whatever is the domain of the five physical sense faculties, by means of the characteristics of perception as they have been explained.

original: yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Perception by mental experience is as follows:

original: yid kyi spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is whatever is the domain of the mental faculty.

original: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Worldly perception is as follows:

original: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: The combination of both of those is called worldly perception.

original: yang dag pa'i mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mngon sum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Pure perception is as follows:

original: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de ni dag pa'i mngon sum yang de yin no /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang yin pa de ni dag pa'i mngon sum yang de yin no /
translated: Whatever is worldly perception is also pure perception.

original: dag pa'i mngon sum yin la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dag pa'i mngon sum yin la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa yang yin te /
translated: It is pure perception but not mundane perception.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the object of transcendent wisdom.

original: yod pa la yang yod par /
analyzed: yod pa la yang yod par /
translated: It knows existence as existence,

original: med pa la yang med par /
analyzed: med pa la yang med par /
translated: nonexistence as nonexistence,

original: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par /
analyzed: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par /
translated: the surpassable as surpassable,🔽and the unsurpassable as unsurpassable.

original: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes shing 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes shing 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa 'di ni dag pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It is not shared in common with mundane beings. This is called pure perception.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //
translated: This is also taught in the treatise Exposition of Valid Knowledge.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: If it is applied to the teaching of the Yogācāra Levels treatise,

original: zag pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called mundane because it is not uncontaminated.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten gyi zhes bstan to //
translated: It is also taught to be mundane because it is not direct perception.

original: gal te de ltar na mngon sum gang gis ngo bo nyid byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mngon sum gang gis ngo bo nyid byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, what is the nature of direct perception?

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis rnam par shes pa drug pa thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis rnam par shes pa drug pa thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: Master Xuanzang explains: All six consciousnesses are not direct perception.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / dus gcig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang / dus gcig pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: The five consciousnesses that are distracted and the mental consciousness that is simultaneous with them are not direct perception.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems thams cad kyang mngon sum gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems thams cad kyang mngon sum gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: All minds in meditative equipoise are included in direct perception.

original: slob dpon dzi nas bstan bcos tshad ma bsdus pa mdzad pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon dzi nas bstan bcos tshad ma bsdus pa mdzad pa las kyang /
translated: Also, in his Compendium of Valid Knowledge, Master Jinaputra explains:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems thams cad ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems thams cad ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All minds in meditative equipoise are valid direct perception.🔽That which is similar to that is called the definition of direct perception.

original: de ltar bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid zhes bya'o zhes bya ba de ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid zhes bya'o zhes bya ba de ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is the third concluding summary.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is merely a convention.

original: @141a * // gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: @141a * // gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the direct perception of the object is explained in the passage beginning with “The characteristic of the direct perception of the object is as follows.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This is also threefold:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: a brief indication, an extensive explanation, and a summary.

original: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first, the brief indication.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa rags pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa rags pa la brten nas /
translated: Thus, based on the gross impermanence,

original: skad cig ma shin tu phra ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma shin tu phra ba'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: the subtle impermanence of momentariness is taught.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa chud mi zab nyid de zhes bya pa la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid du las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa chud mi zab nyid de zhes bya pa la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The purity and impurity of karma are not wasted, etc. This is the second, the extensive explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This is also threefold:

original: gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum bstan pa dang / de la zhes bya ba man chad kyis dmigs su yod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen des zhes bya ba man chad kyis nges par grub pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum bstan pa dang / de la zhes bya ba man chad kyis dmigs su yod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen des zhes bya ba man chad kyis nges par grub pa nyid du bstan pa ste /
translated: The three natures of the object of direct perception are taught, and the reason why it is an object of perception is taught from “that” on down, and its establishment as a certainty is taught from “by that cause and condition” on down.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa ni rnam pa gsum yod pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa ni rnam pa gsum yod pas 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, there are three kinds of direct perception of the object.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa chud mi za ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid dang / las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa chud mi za ba nyid do //
translated: They are: the momentariness of all conditioned things, the existence of the next world, and the non-wastage of completely pure and impure karma.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: mi rtag par rags pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis ngo bo nyid rnam pa 'di gsum rjes su dpag tu yod par gyur to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag par rags pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis ngo bo nyid rnam pa 'di gsum rjes su dpag tu yod par gyur to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of gross impermanence and so on, these three natures become inferable.

original: de gnas pa'i mi rtag pa'i rigs pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dmigs su yod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas pa'i mi rtag pa'i rigs pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dmigs su yod par gyur pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase because the reasoning of impermanence that is based on endurance is directly perceived and so on indicates the second type of reason, that is, the reason that is based on a perception.

original: 'di yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This reason is also divided into three types, because it is taught that there are three types of reasons.

original: 'di ni dang bo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang bo'o //
translated: This is the first type.

original: 'di ltar des gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar skad cig ma'i skye 'gag dang bcas pa mi rtag pa phra mo'i don yod par rjes su dpag pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar des gnas pa'i mi rtag pa rags pa nyid mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar skad cig ma'i skye 'gag dang bcas pa mi rtag pa phra mo'i don yod par rjes su dpag pa ste ;
translated: Because the gross form of impermanence that is based on endurance is directly perceived, one can infer that the subtle object of impermanence, which is the presence of arising and cessation in an instant, must exist.

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma la brten nas skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: This is a form of inference that is based on the valid knowledge of direct perception and inference.

original: sems can gyi bye brag sna tshogs dang / las sna tshogs dngos su dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sdug bsngal rags pa la brten nas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bye brag sna tshogs dang / las sna tshogs dngos su dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sdug bsngal rags pa la brten nas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of the direct perception of the various kinds of sentient beings and the various kinds of karma. This is the second characteristic of perception based on gross suffering.

original: 'di ltar da @141b ltar gyi dus su sdug bsngal sna tshogs yod pa gang yin pa de ni snga ma'i las sna tshogs la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar da @141b ltar gyi dus su sdug bsngal sna tshogs yod pa gang yin pa de ni snga ma'i las sna tshogs la brten nas /
translated: Thus, the various kinds of suffering that exist in the present time are based on the various kinds of karma in the past.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir des gdon mi za bar ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu yod par rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir des gdon mi za bar ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu yod par rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Because they are directly perceived, it is inferred that they will certainly have the result of suffering in the future as well.

original: sems can bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa la gnas pa na mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bdag med pa rags pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sems can bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa la gnas pa na mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bdag med pa rags pa la brten nas /
translated: Because of the direct perception of sentient beings abiding in pure and impure karma of happiness and suffering. This is the third characteristic of perception based on gross selflessness.

original: bdag med par phra ba rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med par phra ba rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of subtle selflessness.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams da ltar bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang ci myong ba dag ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba la gnas pa nyid du mthong bas las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa dag gis ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu rab tu 'dren cing chud mi za bar rab tu shes pas bdag bde ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams da ltar bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gang ci myong ba dag ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba la gnas pa nyid du mthong bas las yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa dag gis ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu rab tu 'dren cing chud mi za bar rab tu shes pas bdag bde ba dang /
translated: Thus, whatever happiness or suffering sentient beings experience is seen to be due to their engagement in virtuous or nonvirtuous actions. Therefore, it is understood that those whose actions are completely pure and those whose actions are completely impure will definitely experience the results of their actions, without fail.

original: sdug bsngal myong ba ci yang med pa kho na rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong ba ci yang med pa kho na rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is understood that there is no happiness or suffering whatsoever that is not due to one’s own actions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des /
translated: On the basis of these causes and conditions,🔽one can infer what is not directly perceived.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rigs pa'i sgo nas phra ba nyid du rjes su dpag par bstan te /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la rjes su dpag par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rigs pa'i sgo nas phra ba nyid du rjes su dpag par bstan te /
translated: This is the third way in which the subtle nature of impermanence can be inferred, namely, through reasoning.

original: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen rnam pa gsum po des mi rtag pa rags pa de dag gis shin tu phra zhing mthong bar dka' ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa'i rgyu dang / rkyen rnam pa gsum po des mi rtag pa rags pa de dag gis shin tu phra zhing mthong bar dka' ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag par byed pa'o //
translated: On the basis of the three causes and conditions that were explained above, one can infer the extremely subtle and difficult-to-see nature of impermanence on the basis of the more obvious forms of impermanence.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the third general conclusion.

original: rang gi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rang gi rigs kyi dpe'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the example of one's own class is from here on. This is the third, the teaching of the characteristic of the example of one's own class.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the brief teaching, the detailed explanation, and the conclusion.

original: 'di ni dang po chos mtshungs pa'i dpe mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po chos mtshungs pa'i dpe mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief teaching of the example of similarity.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams kyi tshogs la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dag gi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ni gnyis pa yang dag par rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams kyi tshogs la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dag gi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ni gnyis pa yang dag par rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The example of birth and death of internal and external formations, which is commonly known to the world, is the establishment by example. This and so on is the second, the teaching of the correct explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into four parts:

original: mi rtag pa'i dpe bstan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i dpe dang / bdag med pa'i dpe dang / 'byor ba dang / rgud pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dpe bstan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i dpe dang / bdag med pa'i dpe dang / 'byor ba dang / rgud pa'i dpe ste /
translated: the teaching of the example of impermanence, the teaching of the example of suffering, the teaching of the example of selflessness, and the teaching of the example of prosperity and decline.

original: 'di ni dang po mi rtag pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mi rtag pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the example of impermanence.

original: de la nang dang phyi rol ces bya ba @142a * //
analyzed: de la nang dang phyi rol ces bya ba @142a * //
translated: In this regard, “internal and external”

original: ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa las brtsams nas phyi nang gi dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa las brtsams nas phyi nang gi dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: means that the examples of internal and external are taught in terms of sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis la 'jig rten pa dag gi thun mong du skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid du shes pa mi rtag pa phra mo la sogs pa de dag gi dpe bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi tshogs rnam pa gnyis la 'jig rten pa dag gi thun mong du skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid du shes pa mi rtag pa phra mo la sogs pa de dag gi dpe bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world in general knows the two kinds of collections, internal and external, as things that are born and die, etc. The examples are taught in order to show their subtle impermanence, etc.

original: yang na rags pa dang / phra ba mi dbye bar sbyi'i dper bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rags pa dang / phra ba mi dbye bar sbyi'i dper bstan pa'o //
translated: Or, the examples are taught in a general way without distinguishing coarse and subtle.🔽In the Vyakhyayukti

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition states:🔽🔽

original: skye ba dang 'jig bdag gis zhes 'byung gi 'chi 'pho zhes mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig bdag gis zhes 'byung gi 'chi 'pho zhes mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Birth and destruction are mentioned, not death and rebirth.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dper nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sdug bsngal dper bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid dper nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sdug bsngal dper bstan pa ste /
translated: The second, the example of suffering, is called “the example of suffering, such as birth, which is commonly known in the world.”

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad po dag bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'i dper nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal brgyad po dag bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal ba'i dper nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: The eight sufferings, such as existence in the world, are applied as examples of one’s own suffering.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa rang dbang med pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs ba dag gi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bdag med pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa rang dbang med pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs ba dag gi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bdag med pa'i dpe bstan pa ste /
translated: The third, the example of selflessness, is called “the example of the lack of independence, which is commonly known in the world.”

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: It is merely a conventional expression.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol dag la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa'i 'byor pa rgud pa dmigs pa dag gi dper nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'byor pa dang rgud pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol dag la 'jig rten pa rnams kyis thun mong du shes pa'i 'byor pa rgud pa dmigs pa dag gi dper nye bar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa 'byor pa dang rgud pa'i dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the example of the prosperity and decline of the external world, which is commonly known to the world, is called the establishment of the example. This is the fourth, taught by the example of prosperity and decline.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: What is similar to that is called the characteristic of the establishment of the example of one's own type. This is the third, the conclusion.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: It is merely the understanding of the conventional.

original: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ston to ;
analyzed: yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ston to ;
translated: The characteristic of the well-known is taught from here on, which is the fourth.

original: /'di yang rnam pa gsum po mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
analyzed: /'di yang rnam pa gsum po mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the three aspects of brief indication, explanation, and conclusion.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / gnas mngon sum du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / rang gi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni grub par bya ba la gcig tu nges par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of direct perception, the characteristic of the perception of the locus, and the characteristic of the perception of the example of one's own class, are called the ascertainment of the proof.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / dpe de dag gis dam bcas pa'i don @142b nges par grub par byed pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / dpe de dag gis dam bcas pa'i don @142b nges par grub par byed pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because of the direct perception and the example, the meaning of the thesis is ascertained and proven, and therefore it is called the ascertainment.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni yongs su grub pa nyid ces 'byung ngo //🔽yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni yongs su grub pa nyid ces 'byung ngo // yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the Vyakhyayukti, it is called the establishment.

original: gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gsum pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: The ascertainment should be understood as the characteristic of the third member.🔽This is the summary.

original: brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The ascertainment is merely the understanding.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: The characteristic of the extremely pure scripture is as follows.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
translated: This is also threefold: concise demonstration, detailed explanation, and summary.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ji skad du mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ji skad du mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that nirvāṇa is peace. This is the second, the detailed explanation.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mjug bsdu pa'o //
translated: That which is similar to that should be known as the characteristic of the extremely pure scripture. This is the third, the summary.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi phyir shin tu so sor brtags pa yongs su dag pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta bas na mtshan nyid lnga po de dag gi phyir shin tu so sor brtags pa yongs su dag pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, therefore, for the sake of these five characteristics, it is called the reasoning of the extremely pure discrimination of what is well considered.

original: yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o /🔽// / bam po bdun cu gnyis pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o / // / bam po bdun cu gnyis pa /
translated: This is the third general conclusion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Manjushri then said to the Lord:🔽Bhagavat, how many kinds of characteristics of omniscience should be known?

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa du mchis par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rgol ba dag gi rjes su bzlas te rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa du mchis par rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rgol ba dag gi rjes su bzlas te rnam par bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the second repetition of the opponents' explanations, called teaching.

original: 'di ltar gong ma lnga pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid rnam pa du dang ldan pa khong du ma chud
analyzed: 'di ltar gong ma lnga pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsungs pas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba mtshan nyid rnam pa du dang ldan pa khong du ma chud
translated: Thus, from the section on teaching the characteristics of the extremely pure scriptures in the fifth chapter above, by stating the words spoken by the omniscient one, the characteristics of what is called omniscience are not understood to have any kind.

original: pas de'i phyir 'dir yang bzlas te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pas de'i phyir 'dir yang bzlas te bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is repeated and taught here as well.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first question, concerning the characteristics of the Omniscient One.

original: 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes zhus pa dang / gzhan nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes zhus pa dang / gzhan nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: Here, the question is about the Omniscient One, and elsewhere it is said to be about the Omniscient One in all aspects. What is the difference?

original: yul 'di'i slob dpon rnams kyis brgyud de bshad pa las de bzhin yid la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @143a * //🔽pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul 'di'i slob dpon rnams kyis brgyud de bshad pa las de bzhin yid la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @143a * // pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The masters of this land explain it in succession. The wisdom that observes the mind in that way is called the Omniscient One in all aspects.

original: kun rdzob la gnas pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob la gnas pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The wisdom that abides in the conventional is called the Omniscient One in all aspects.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i brjed byang byas pa las ni /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i brjed byang byas pa las ni /
translated: In the notes on the noble Golden Light Sutra by Master Bhūyasatya,

original: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If applied to the Mahayana scriptures, that wisdom which has emptiness as its object is called the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: shes pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which has the knowledge of all aspects as its object is called

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects.

original: theg pa chung ngu bas 'dod pa'i don ni mtshan nyid gong ma las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu bas 'dod pa'i don ni mtshan nyid gong ma las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The meaning that is desired by the Hinayana should be understood as the opposite of the above characteristics.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa gsar 'od dam pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa gsar 'od dam pa'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Arya-Ratna-megha-sutra says,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects

original: rtsa ba dag tu gyur pas na //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag tu gyur pas na //
translated: is the root

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag / rab tu brgyan par gyur pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag / rab tu brgyan par gyur pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: of the adornment of immeasurable good qualities.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i brjed byang las //
translated: The master Bhadanta-satyasiddhi's notes say,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects

original: rtsa bdag tu gyur pas na //
analyzed: rtsa bdag tu gyur pas na //
translated: is the root

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar ye shes skye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar ye shes skye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the arising of wisdom.

original: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag / rab tu brgyan par gyur pa yin //
analyzed: yon tan dpag tu med pa dag / rab tu brgyan par gyur pa yin //
translated: He is well adorned with immeasurable good qualities.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan skye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan skye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the arising of good qualities.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi shes rab yin la /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi shes rab yin la /
translated: Here, “knowledge of all aspects” is the wisdom of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi shes rab kyis ni mkhyen pa bskyed pa'i phyir rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi shes rab kyis ni mkhyen pa bskyed pa'i phyir rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the wisdom of emptiness produces knowledge, it is called “aspect.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni mkhyen pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: “All” means possessing knowledge.

original: mkhyen pa'i bye brag kyang mi mtshungs pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i bye brag kyang mi mtshungs pa'i phyir thams cad ces gsungs so //
translated: And since the particular knowledge is not the same, “all” is stated.

original: theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung gis thams cad stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i gzhung gis thams cad stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained in the scriptures of the Lesser Vehicle that all is known to be emptiness.

original: de la stong pa ni thams cad ces bya ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
analyzed: de la stong pa ni thams cad ces bya ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
translated: Here, emptiness is the root of “all.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni stong pa'i yan lag yin te ;
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni stong pa'i yan lag yin te ;
translated: “All” is a branch of emptiness.

original: rtsa ba las mi thob pa yin pas stong pa la rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba las mi thob pa yin pas stong pa la rnam pa thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is not obtained from the root, emptiness is called “all aspects.”

original: mkhyen pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: and it is endowed with the knowledge of omniscience.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa'i nang na rnam pa sna tshogs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa'i nang na rnam pa sna tshogs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because among those endowed with knowledge, there is no similarity of type.

original: 'dir mkhyen pa rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas be'u'i sde pa rnams ni gang zag gi chos thams cad shes par nus pa la /
analyzed: 'dir mkhyen pa rnam pa gnyis bshad pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas be'u'i sde pa rnams ni gang zag gi chos thams cad shes par nus pa la /
translated: Here, the explanation of the two types of knowledge is also from the teachings, since the explanations in the individual schools are not consistent.🔽The Vṛjiputraka school explains:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: One is called omniscient if one is able to know all phenomena of the person.

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyi nang nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos kyi nang nas /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Abhidharmakośa,🔽in the chapter on the self-destruction of the self,

original: bdag 'jig pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: bdag 'jig pa'i le'u las /
translated: it says:🔽If the self of the person is not posited as truly existing separately,

original: gal te logs shig tu gang zag gi bdag nyid yang dag par yod par rnam par ma @143b bzhag ; bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te logs shig tu gang zag gi bdag nyid yang dag par yod par rnam par ma @143b bzhag ; bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the Bhagavān would not be omniscient,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: because he knows all phenomena of the mind and mental factors.

original: skad cig gcig la tha dad par skye zhing 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la tha dad par skye zhing 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise and disintegrate separately in a single moment.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni rgyun la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes 'dod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung gis ni rgyun la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes 'dod kyi /
translated: The scriptures of the Sarvastivadins assert that omniscience is based on the continuum.

original: bdag ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: bdag ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They do not assert that it is based on the self.

original: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdzod kyi bstan bcos las /
translated: Thus the Abhidharmakosa states:

original: nged kyi bcom ldan 'das thams cad gcig par mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes mi zer te zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: nged kyi bcom ldan 'das thams cad gcig par mkhyen pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes mi zer te zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: We do not say that our Bhagavan is omniscient because he knows all at once.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na /🔽be'u'i sde bdag ni nged thams cad mkhyen pa zhes zer bar zad kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na / be'u'i sde bdag ni nged thams cad mkhyen pa zhes zer bar zad kyi /
translated: When applied to this explanation,🔽the Bhadrakalpita-sutra states:

original: bdag gi shes so zhes mi smra ste /
analyzed: bdag gi shes so zhes mi smra ste /
translated: We say that the Buddha is omniscient, but we do not say that he knows all at once.

original: 'di ltar rgyud kyi dbang du byas nas spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan brnyes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyud kyi dbang du byas nas spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan brnyes pa yin te /
translated: Thus he obtained the name Buddha because he possesses the conduct of omniscience from the perspective of the continuum.

original: phung po rnams kyi rgyud la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu yongs su grub pas thugs la dgongs pa tsam gyis mkhyen par mdzad pa'i dgongs pa'i yul dag la phyin ci log mi mnga' bar mkhyen pa skye ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi rgyud la nus pa khyad par du 'phags pa de lta bu yongs su grub pas thugs la dgongs pa tsam gyis mkhyen par mdzad pa'i dgongs pa'i yul dag la phyin ci log mi mnga' bar mkhyen pa skye ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes
translated: Because the continuum of the aggregates is fully established with such a special potency, omniscience is generated without error in the object of omniscience, which is known by the mere intention of the mind.

original: bya'i / skad cig ma gcig la cig car mkhyen pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bya'i / skad cig ma gcig la cig car mkhyen pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not known all at once in a single moment.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /🔽dper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du / dper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
translated: As it is said in a verse:🔽Just as fire is said to burn everything

original: me yis thams cad sreg 'dod ltar //
analyzed: me yis thams cad sreg 'dod ltar //
translated: through the power of its continuum,

original: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
translated: so too it is said to know everything

original: gcig par thams cad mkhyen phyir min //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gcig par thams cad mkhyen phyir min // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: but not because it knows everything in a single moment.

original: de ltar rgyun gyi dbang du byas nas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun gyi dbang du byas nas thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Thus it is said to be omniscience in terms of the continuum.

original: bdag gis kun shes pa ni ma yin par shes na 'di dang de dag gis brtags pa dang sbyar na bdag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang rung /
analyzed: bdag gis kun shes pa ni ma yin par shes na 'di dang de dag gis brtags pa dang sbyar na bdag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la yang rung /
translated: If one knows that one does not know everything, then when one examines and applies this, one will not be arrogant toward the Bhagavān Buddha.

original: dus gsum mnga' bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum mnga' bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one knows that one does not know all, then one should investigate and apply oneself to this, because the Bhagavat Buddha has said that one should know the three times.

original: gang du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang du bstan zhe na /
translated: Where is this taught?

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: In the verse:🔽The buddhas of the past,🔽the buddhas of the future,

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin dang // ma byon sangs rgyas gang yin dang // da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas gang //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin dang // ma byon sangs rgyas gang yin dang // da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas gang //
translated: and the buddhas of the present

original: de dag sems can mya ngan sel ;
analyzed: de dag sems can mya ngan sel ;
translated: remove the sorrow of sentient beings.

original: / zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: / zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: khyod kyi gzhung gis ni phung po kho na la dus gsum yod par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: khyod kyi gzhung gis ni phung po kho na la dus gsum yod par 'dod kyi /
translated: In your system, only the aggregates exist in the three times,

original: gang zag las ni ma yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de ltar nges shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang zag las ni ma yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de ltar nges shes 'byung ngo //
translated: not the person, and therefore it is certain that the knowledge of all things would not occur.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba de'i gzhung gis thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba de yang dag pa dang kun rdzob kyi ye @144a * //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba de'i gzhung gis thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba de yang dag pa dang kun rdzob kyi ye @144a * //
translated: In the system of the Sarvāstivādins, the so-called knowledge of all things is the knowledge of all things in the three times.

original: shes las ye shes gang gi dbang du byas nas bstan zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: shes las ye shes gang gi dbang du byas nas bstan zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is the knowledge in terms of which the Buddha is said to be omniscient?

original: yang dag pa dang kun rdzob la dmigs pa gnyi ga la brjod pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang kun rdzob la dmigs pa gnyi ga la brjod pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called omniscient because he is said to have both kinds of knowledge, that which has reality for its object and that which has convention for its object.

original: de lta ma yin na ni theg pa gnyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni theg pa gnyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the two vehicles would also be called omniscient.

original: mdo sde'i gzhung dang / gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las //
analyzed: mdo sde'i gzhung dang / gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las //
translated: In the scriptures of the sutras and also in the treatise called the Abhidharma Kosa,

original: ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: it is said that there are four kinds of knowledge:

original: slob dpon med pa'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob dpon med pa'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rtsol ba med pa'i ye shes so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: knowledge without a teacher, omniscience, knowledge of all aspects, and effortless knowledge.

original: rnam par phye ste bshad pa med na 'di dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste bshad pa med na 'di dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: If they are not distinguished, what is the difference between them?

original: kha cig na re thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Some say: That which is called omniscience has reality for its object.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i mkhyen pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la dmigs pa'i mkhyen pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The knowledge called “omniscience” is the knowledge that has as its object the entities.

original: dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / bya ma la pa'i sde pa dag ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dang / lan cig brjod pa'i sde pa dang / bya ma la pa'i sde pa dag ni 'di skad du /
translated: The Mahāsāṃghika, Ekavyāvahārika, and Prajñaptivādin schools say:

original: skad cig ma'i sems gcig gis thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i sems gcig gis thams cad khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: All is comprehended by a single moment of mind.

original: skad cig ma gcig gis sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad shes so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad shes so //
translated: By the wisdom that is concomitant with a single moment of mind, all phenomena are known.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes rtag par rgyun du 'jug go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes rtag par rgyun du 'jug go zhes bshad de /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising operate continuously and uninterruptedly.

original: sde pa tha dad pa'i gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sde pa tha dad pa'i gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood according to the explanations in the treatises of the different schools.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: Now, if we apply this to the Mahāyāna teaching,

original: yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
analyzed: yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
translated: there are also different explanations. The treatise Mahāyāna–saṃgraha composed by the master Niḥsvabhāva says:

original: theg pa gnyis kyis thams cad mkhyen pa thob par lta bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis thams cad mkhyen pa thob par lta bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Since the two vehicles view the attainment of omniscience, they are not omniscient in all aspects.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that very commentary states:

original: lung gi tshul legs par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lung gi tshul legs par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not properly understand the way of scripture.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in a verse:

original: rgyun dag gis ni nus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyun dag gis ni nus pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the potency of the continuum,

original: de ni thams cad zad par 'dod //
analyzed: de ni thams cad zad par 'dod //
translated: it is asserted that all is exhausted.

original: cig car thams cad rig min pas //
analyzed: cig car thams cad rig min pas //
translated: Because all is not known simultaneously,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de ltar 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de ltar 'dod //
translated: omniscience is asserted in that way.

original: ces smra'o // de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par dka' ba dang / sla bar 'gyur ro zhes de'i gzhung gis de ltar 'dod par shes so //
analyzed: ces smra'o // de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par dka' ba dang / sla bar 'gyur ro zhes de'i gzhung gis de ltar 'dod par shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is known that they assert that it is difficult to attain the wisdom of omniscience without understanding foundation consciousness, and that it is easy with it.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes thugs su chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes thugs su chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't the understanding of the selflessness of all phenomena the wisdom of omniscience?

original: thams cad mkhyen @144b pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen @144b pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is omniscience,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: But it is not omniscience.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //🔽bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid du chos thams cad thugs su chud cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do ;
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no // bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid du chos thams cad thugs su chud cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad kyang 'gal ba med do ;
translated: This is extensively taught in that text.

original: / gzhan yang bshad pa 'di dag dang sbyar na /
analyzed: / gzhan yang bshad pa 'di dag dang sbyar na /
translated: If this explanation is applied, then even though it is explained that the so-called omniscience is the understanding of all phenomena as having distinct characteristics and also includes nonconceptual wisdom, there is no contradiction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas skad cig ma gcig la rang gi ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos la sogs pa thugs su chud par 'dod pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas skad cig ma gcig la rang gi ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos la sogs pa thugs su chud par 'dod pa yang /
translated: Moreover, if this explanation is applied, then the assertion that the Tathāgata understands his own nature and concomitant phenomena in a single moment

original: phal cher dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag dang mthun no //
analyzed: phal cher dge 'dun phal chen pa'i sde pa dag dang mthun no //
translated: is mostly in accord with the Mahāsāṃghika school.

original: de la bye brag yod pa de'i gzhung gis cha bzhi'i don rnam par mi 'jog pas 'dir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa de'i gzhung gis cha bzhi'i don rnam par mi 'jog pas 'dir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In that regard, since the texts of the Vaibhāṣika do not posit the meaning of the four parts, here in the treatise Establishing the Existence of Consciousness Only,

original: lta ba'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa ni rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa ni rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa rnams kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other aspects of the view are not objective supports of the cause.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa 'byung ste /
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, two masters explain:

original: kha cig na re ye shes gnyis la bye brag med do zhes zer /🔽kha cig na re bye brag yod do zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re ye shes gnyis la bye brag med do zhes zer / kha cig na re bye brag yod do zhes zer /
translated: Some say that there is no difference between the two knowledges.🔽Some say that there is a difference.

original: kha cig na re bye brag yod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bye brag yod do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that there is a difference.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, the commentary itself asks: What is the difference between omniscience and knowledge of all aspects?

original: smras pa / kha cig na re bye brag med pas ;🔽res 'ga' ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smras pa / kha cig na re bye brag med pas ; res 'ga' ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It responds: Some say that there is no difference.🔽Sometimes it is called omniscience.

original: res 'ga' ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: Sometimes it is called knowledge of all aspects.

original: kha cig na re spyi'i mtshan nyid du ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re spyi'i mtshan nyid du ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: In general, it is called omniscience.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: In particular, it is called knowledge of all aspects.

original: rgyu gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the cause is called omniscience.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the result is called knowledge of all aspects.

original: mdor bstan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the brief teaching is called omniscience.

original: rgya cher ston pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ston pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the extensive teaching is called knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad la kun du rmongs pa'i ma rig pa 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni chos thams cad la kun du rmongs pa'i ma rig pa 'jig par byed do //
translated: Therein, by the name omniscience, the ignorance that is confusion about all phenomena is destroyed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni chos rnam pa sna tshogs la so sor rtog pa'i ma rig pa 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya bas ni chos rnam pa sna tshogs la so sor rtog pa'i ma rig pa 'jig par byed do zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: By the name knowledge of all aspects, the ignorance that is discernment of various aspects of phenomena is destroyed.

original: gzhan yang le'u phyi ma las /🔽bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thams cad @145a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang le'u phyi ma las / bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thams cad @145a * //
translated: Moreover, in the later chapters,🔽the Lord himself says,

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: Knowledge of all refers to the state of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dngos bo'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i dngos bo'o //
translated: Knowledge of aspects of the path refers to the state of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: Knowledge of all aspects refers to the state of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la ni thams cad mkhyen pa kho na yod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la ni thams cad mkhyen pa kho na yod kyi /
translated: Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have only omniscience,

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa nyid ni med do //
translated: but not knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzhan yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa dang ldan yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod pa dang ldan yang /
translated: Moreover, śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have conceptual activity that conceptualizes specific characteristics,

original: zad par shes par mi nus pas spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: zad par shes par mi nus pas spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ming thob pa yin no //
translated: but because they are unable to know exhaustively, they attain the name of knowing the general characteristics.

original: sangs rgyas kyi thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid yin la /
translated: The omniscience and knowledge of all aspects of the Buddha are true.

original: theg pa gnyis kyis ni gdags pa'i ming can no //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis ni gdags pa'i ming can no //
translated: The two vehicles are called the nominal.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen par mdzad pa'i chos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen par mdzad pa'i chos gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the Dharma that is known by the Omniscient One?

original: smras pa / skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / skye mched bcu gnyis so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said: The twelve sense bases.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the same text.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis lam brnyes pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis lam brnyes pa na /
translated: Moreover, in that same text, when the Blessed One attained the path,

original: lam gyi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad brnyes pa yin na /
analyzed: lam gyi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad brnyes pa yin na /
translated: through the knowledge of the path, he attained omniscience and all aspects.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa dang ldan par bstan par bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa dang ldan par bstan par bstan zhe na /
translated: Here, why is it taught that he possesses omniscience?

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis lam brnyes pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis lam brnyes pa na /
translated: It is said: When the Blessed One attained the path,

original: 'di nas lam gyi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid phun sum tshogs par brnyes pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'di nas lam gyi mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid phun sum tshogs par brnyes pa yin yang /
translated: through the knowledge of the path, he attained omniscience and the perfection of knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni spyod par mi mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni spyod par mi mdzad de /
translated: However, he does not engage in omniscience of all aspects.

original: dper na rgyal po chen por dbang bskur ba thob na /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po chen por dbang bskur ba thob na /
translated: For example, when one obtains the consecration as a great king,

original: rin po che'i bang mdzod la sogs pa la dbang thob pa yin yang /
analyzed: rin po che'i bang mdzod la sogs pa la dbang thob pa yin yang /
translated: one obtains power over the treasury of jewels and so forth,🔽but it is still unopened and unused.

original: da dung ma phye ma spyad pa dang 'dra bar 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs nas /
analyzed: da dung ma phye ma spyad pa dang 'dra bar 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs nas /
translated: In the same way, the Buddha wishes to teach that, having abandoned the instinct for affliction by means of the knowledge of all modes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa nyid du bstan par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa nyid du bstan par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has accomplished the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pa yin na /
analyzed: sems gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spangs pa yin na /
translated: If he has obtained the knowledge of all modes and the knowledge of all aspects by means of a single thought, and has abandoned the instinct for affliction,

original: 'dir ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spong bar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spong bar bstan zhe na /
translated: why is it taught here that the knowledge of all modes obtains the knowledge of all aspects and abandons the instinct for affliction?

original: dus gcig tu brnyes pa yin mod kyi 'dir gzhan dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par yid shes par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / rim @145b gyis bye brag gi rnam pas bstan nas /
analyzed: dus gcig tu brnyes pa yin mod kyi 'dir gzhan dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par yid shes par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / rim @145b gyis bye brag gi rnam pas bstan nas /
translated: Although he attained them simultaneously, he taught in this way in order to cause others to understand the perfection of wisdom, and in order to show the specific order of the perfections,

original: sems can rnams yongs su dag pa'i sems 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de skad du bstan to //
