analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su dag pa'i sems 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir de skad du bstan to //
translated: so that sentient beings might attain a pure mind.

original: gzhan yang sems gcig gis brnyes pa yin yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems gcig gis brnyes pa yin yang /
translated: Moreover, although he attained them by a single mind,

original: dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i go rims kyang yod pas /
analyzed: dang po dang / bar ma dang / tha ma'i go rims kyang yod pas /
translated: there is an order of first, middle, and last.

original: dper na sems gcig la mtshan nyid gnyis pa rgyu dang rkyen la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen 'gag pa la gnas pa skye ba lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na sems gcig la mtshan nyid gnyis pa rgyu dang rkyen la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen 'gag pa la gnas pa skye ba lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: For example, a single mind has two characteristics: one abides in causes and conditions, and one abides in the cessation of causes and conditions, and arises.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Mere Consciousness,

original: bstan pa las phan tshun bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa las phan tshun bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it is said that the order should be known as the reverse of the teaching.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: In the commentary on the noble Buddha Land Sutra,🔽it is said:

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kho na las brtsams nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kho na las brtsams nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston te /
translated: The Mirror of the Dharmadhatu Sutra teaches omniscience from the perspective of the mirror-like pristine wisdom alone,

original: dus thams cad du rtag par chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du rtag par chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: because it always and forever comprehends all phenomena.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that sutra.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
translated: The Yogacarya-bhumi-shastra explains:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it is the pristine wisdom of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du mkhyen pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa gnag yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du mkhyen pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa gnag yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that very text says, “Omniscience is the unobstructed engagement in all the elements, all things, all aspects, and all times.”

original: de la khams ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la khams ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of elements:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can gyi khams so //
translated: the world-element and the sentient-being element.

original: dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of things:

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: compounded and uncompounded.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po de nyid la yang /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / khams dang 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i dngos po de nyid la yang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi phyi ma phyi ma'i rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'i phyir dang / khams dang 'gro ba dang / dge ba dang /
translated: And with regard to those things that are conditioned and unconditioned,

original: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med do //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med do //
translated: there is an immeasurable classification of aspects due to the classification of their individual characteristics, due to the classification of their general characteristics, due to the classification of their causes and effects, due to the classification of their realms, migrations, virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminate states, and so on.

original: de la dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Time is threefold:

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'o /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'o /
translated: past, future, and present.

original: de ltar khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Thus omniscience is the knowledge of all realms, all things, all aspects, and all times.

original: 'phags pa legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo dang / bstan bcos sa yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang de skad du bstan to //🔽'dir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / lung gcig @146a * //🔽las 'phros pa dang / lung sna tshogs las ba glang skyong ba'i chos rnam pa bcu gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: 'phags pa legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo dang / bstan bcos sa yongs su 'dzin pa las kyang de skad du bstan to // 'dir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / lung gcig @146a * // las 'phros pa dang / lung sna tshogs las ba glang skyong ba'i chos rnam pa bcu gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: The noble Sūtra Teaching Good Conduct and the treatise Dhātrī also teach this.🔽Here, the noble commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom, the one treatise that is an expansion of the scriptures, and the various scriptures teach the characteristics of omniscience through eleven dharmas of the cowherd, and moreover, the noble commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom teaches that the pigeon will become a buddha after a very long time.

original: phug ron shin tu yun ring po'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub pa yin pas khungs su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phug ron shin tu yun ring po'i dus su sangs rgyas su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa dag kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub pa yin pas khungs su brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since these teachings are established as omniscience, they should be cited as sources.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: Son of noble family, in brief, there are five aspects, and so on, this teaches the Tathāgata's true answer.

original: 'di yang mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba bstan te /
translated: This also teaches the brief introduction, the detailed explanation, and the summary.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs mdor smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs mdor smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the first, having briefly mentioned the number, the brief answer.

original: gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na /
analyzed: gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na /
translated: If anyone should come,

original: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sgra rnam par grags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: in the world, the sound of omniscience is renowned, and so on, is the second, the detailed explanation in order.

original: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga rnam par phye ste /
translated: This also distinguishes the five characteristics.

original: bshad pa 'di nyid kyis rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di nyid kyis rnam pa lngar dbye ste /
translated: By this very explanation, it is divided into five aspects.

original: 'di ni dang po kun du grags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po kun du grags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the first teaching of the characteristic of universal renown.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Vyākhyāyukti,

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra yang dag pa nyid 'jig rten kun du khyab par gyur pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra yang dag pa nyid 'jig rten kun du khyab par gyur pa zhes bstan to //
translated: and the sound of omniscience, which is the true nature of the Buddha, has spread throughout the world.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa skyes bu chen po gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa skyes bu chen po gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The second, the excellent characteristics of a great being, is taught by the phrase endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du /
translated: As the Great Exegesis says:

original: mtshan zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of mark?

original: smras pa / rtags bstan pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
analyzed: smras pa / rtags bstan pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the term that indicates a sign.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the term that indicates a special quality.

original: bkra shis kyi rtags kyi don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
analyzed: bkra shis kyi rtags kyi don gang yin pa de ni mtshan gyi don to //
translated: It is the meaning of the term that indicates an auspicious sign.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kho na yin la /
translated: Why are there only thirty-two marks of a great being?

original: mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
analyzed: mi mang mi nyung zhe na /
translated: Why are there not more or fewer?

original: smras pa / gal te mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku brgyan par gyur na ni 'jig rten na dpe zla med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi sku brgyan par gyur na ni 'jig rten na dpe zla med par 'gyur la /
translated: He replied: If the body of the Buddha were adorned with thirty-two marks, it would be without peer in the world.

original: gal te de las nyung na ni ma tshang bar nyid du gyur pas so //
analyzed: gal te de las nyung na ni ma tshang bar nyid du gyur pas so //
translated: If it had fewer than that, it would be incomplete.

original: de las mang na ni 'dres shing 'khrugs @146b pas khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir de ltar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de las mang na ni 'dres shing 'khrugs @146b pas khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir de ltar nges pa yin te /
translated: If it had more than that, it would be mixed and confused and not distinguished.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa la /
translated: Just as the Bhagavān’s teaching of the Dharma

original: lhag pa dang nyung ba med pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag pa dang nyung ba med pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang de bzhin te /
translated: is neither excessive nor deficient, so too the Buddha’s marks are neither excessive nor deficient.

original: ma tshang ba ci yang med pas bskyed du med la /
analyzed: ma tshang ba ci yang med pas bskyed du med la /
translated: Since there is nothing incomplete, there is nothing to add.

original: lhag pa ci yang med pas dbrir med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lhag pa ci yang med pas dbrir med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Since there is nothing excessive, there is nothing to remove.

original: / byang chub sems dpas 'thob pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang yin pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos 'thob pa'i mtshan la bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpas 'thob pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang yin pa dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos 'thob pa'i mtshan la bye brag tu gyur pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the thirty-two marks obtained by a bodhisattva and the thirty-two marks obtained by a universal monarch?

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po rnam pa bzhis khyad par 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' ni dngos po rnam pa bzhis khyad par 'phags pa yin te /
translated: He replied, “The bodhisattva is superior in four ways:

original: rab tu sbyangs pa dang / gsal ba dang ; yongs su rdzogs pa dang / gnas thob pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sbyangs pa dang / gsal ba dang ; yongs su rdzogs pa dang / gnas thob pa'o //
translated: he is well-trained, clear, fully developed, and has attained the stages.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: Moreover, he is superior in five ways:

original: gnas thob pa dang / shin tu mdzes pa dang / ri mo shin tu zab pa dang / ye shes dam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su mi 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: gnas thob pa dang / shin tu mdzes pa dang / ri mo shin tu zab pa dang / ye shes dam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rjes su mi 'brang ba'o //
translated: he has attained the stages, is very beautiful, has very deep lines, follows the highest knowledge, and does not follow the afflictions.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mtshan gyis lus brgyan par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mtshan gyis lus brgyan par byed ce na /
translated: Why does the bodhisattva adorn his body with the major marks?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gnas dang snod du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gnas dang snod du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make it a basis and a vessel for unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dag ni nges par lus khyad du 'phags pa la gnas pas de la ma 'ongs pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don gyis byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa dag ni nges par lus khyad du 'phags pa la gnas pas de la ma 'ongs pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i don gyis byang chub sems dpa'
translated: Those with special qualities definitely abide in a special body. Therefore, in the future, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: la khyod kyis bdag lus la gnas par 'dod na sngar khyod kyi lus yongs su dag cing khyad par du 'phags pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: la khyod kyis bdag lus la gnas par 'dod na sngar khyod kyi lus yongs su dag cing khyad par du 'phags pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: “If you wish to abide in my body, first you must purify your body and make it special, adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na ni bdag ni khyed kyi lus la skye bar mi nus so zhes zer bas /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na ni bdag ni khyed kyi lus la skye bar mi nus so zhes zer bas /
translated: If you cannot do that, I cannot be born in your body.”

original: dper na la la zhig bud med rin po che chung mar blangs nas khyim du bsdu bar 'dod pa la des gsang thabs su pho nya btang nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig bud med rin po che chung mar blangs nas khyim du bsdu bar 'dod pa la des gsang thabs su pho nya btang nas 'di skad du /
translated: For example, suppose someone wanted to take a precious woman as his wife and bring her to his home. She would secretly send a messenger to him, saying,

original: khyod kyis bdag khyim du 'ongs par 'dod na sngar chag chag thob /
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag khyim du 'ongs par 'dod na sngar chag chag thob /
translated: “If you want me to come to your home, first you must sweep it out.

original: phyag dar byos la /
analyzed: phyag dar byos la /
translated: Clean it up!

original: mi gtsang ba dag bsal nas dar gyi lda ldi bres shing /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dag bsal nas dar gyi lda ldi bres shing /
translated: After you remove the filth, hang silk tassels,

original: spos kyis bdugs la me tog gtor cig / bkod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan par gyis shig dang / gdod bdag 'ong ngo //
analyzed: spos kyis bdugs la me tog gtor cig / bkod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan par gyis shig dang / gdod bdag 'ong ngo //
translated: burn incense, scatter flowers, and adorn it with various arrays, then I will come.

original: de lta ma yin na ni bdag khyod kyi khyim du 'ong mi nus so zhes zer ba dang 'dra bas na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni bdag khyod kyi khyim du 'ong mi nus so zhes zer ba dang 'dra bas na /
translated: If you do not do that, I cannot come to your house.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' lus brgyan par @147a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' lus brgyan par @147a * //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva adorns his body.

original: byed do zhes 'byung ste /🔽'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang phal cher bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //🔽gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: byed do zhes 'byung ste / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang phal cher bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do // gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽The commentary on the perfection of wisdom also explains this for the most part in accordance with the great treatise.

original: mtshan gyi dgongs pa ston te /
analyzed: mtshan gyi dgongs pa ston te /
translated: Moreover, the commentary on the perfection of wisdom explains the intention of the names.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / dus gsum gyi chos ni mtshan ma yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams dang / dus gsum gyi chos ni mtshan ma yod pa ma yin na /
translated: The buddhas of the ten directions and the phenomena of the three times do not have characteristics.

original: 'di ci'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan /
translated: Why then are the thirty-two marks taught?

original: mtshan gcig kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mtshan gcig kyang yang dag par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If not even a single mark exists in reality,

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis lta smos kyang ci dgos she na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis lta smos kyang ci dgos she na /
translated: what need is there to mention thirty-two?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos la bden pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos la bden pa gnyis yod do //
translated: The qualities of a buddha have two truths.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: There is the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The thirty-two marks are taught for the sake of the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
translated: The absence of marks is taught for the sake of the ultimate truth.

original: gzhan yang lam gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lam gnyis te /
translated: There are also two paths:

original: sems can bsod nams spel ba'i lam dang ; sems can shes rab sgom par byed pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sems can bsod nams spel ba'i lam dang ; sems can shes rab sgom par byed pa'i lam mo //
translated: the path that increases the merit of sentient beings and the path that causes sentient beings to cultivate wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi lam gyi phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi lam gyi phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The thirty-two marks are taught for the sake of the path of merit.

original: shes rab kyi lam gyi phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi lam gyi phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
translated: For the path of wisdom, he taught the signless.

original: skye ba'i lus kyi phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i lus kyi phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
translated: For the body of birth, he taught the thirty-two marks.

original: chos kyi sku'i phyir ni mtshan med par bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i phyir ni mtshan med par bstan te /
translated: For the Dharma body, he taught the signless.

original: 'di ltar skye ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos bdag nyid brgyan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos bdag nyid brgyan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the body of birth is adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: chos kyi sku ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pas bdag nyid brgyan pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sogs pas bdag nyid brgyan pas so //
translated: The Dharma body is adorned with the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four specific knowledges, the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha, and so forth.

original: sems can rnams la rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rgyu dang rkyen rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Sentient beings have two kinds of causes and conditions:

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dang / shes rab kyi rgyu dang rkyen no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang rkyen dang / shes rab kyi rgyu dang rkyen no //
translated: the cause and condition of merit and the cause and condition of wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang rkyen can gyi sems can rab tu 'dren par bzhed pa'i phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sku spyod par mdzad do //🔽shes rab kyi rgyu dang rkyen can gyi sems can rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu dang rkyen can gyi sems can rab tu 'dren par bzhed pa'i phyir ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i sku spyod par mdzad do // shes rab kyi rgyu dang rkyen can gyi sems can rab tu 'dren pa'i phyir /
translated: He manifests the body endowed with the thirty-two marks in order to lead those sentient beings who are motivated by the cause and condition of merit.

original: chos kyi sku spyod par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku spyod par mdzad do //
translated: He manifests the Dharma body in order to lead those sentient beings who are motivated by the cause and condition of wisdom.

original: sems can ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Sentient beings are of two kinds:

original: chos rnams la btags pa tsam gyi ming can dang / ming la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la btags pa tsam gyi ming can dang / ming la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: those who have names that are mere designations for phenomena, and those who are attached to names.

original: ming la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
analyzed: ming la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can gyi phyir ni mtshan med par bstan to //
translated: The thirty-two marks are taught for the sake of sentient beings who are attached to names.

original: chos rnams la btags pa tsam du shes pa'i @147b sems can gyi phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: chos rnams la btags pa tsam du shes pa'i @147b sems can gyi phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The thirty-two marks are taught for the sake of sentient beings who understand that phenomena are mere designations.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Moreover, the thirty-two marks are taught in order to demonstrate that he is superior to all sentient beings.

original: mtshan med pa'i chos 'jig par mi mdzad do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan med pa'i chos 'jig par mi mdzad do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: He does not destroy the Dharma that is signless.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni /
translated: The thirty-two marks are explained in detail.

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as they appear in the teaching on the characteristics.

original: stobs bcu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gsum pa stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the ten powers, he cuts through all the doubts of all sentient beings. This is the third, the teaching on the characteristic of being endowed with the ten powers.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan zhing chos yang dag par ston pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang ldan zhing chos yang dag par ston pa phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis brgal du med cing /
translated: Endowed with the four confidences, he teaches the Dharma correctly. He is unassailable by any opponent.

original: log par smra ba thams cad tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: log par smra ba thams cad tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: He is victorious over all false teachings. This is the teaching on the characteristic of the ground.

original: mdo 'di nyid las mdor bsdus nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa drug bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las mdor bsdus nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa drug bstan pa'o //
translated: In this very sutra, in brief, the qualities of the Tathagata are taught to be of forty-six kinds.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ;
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ;
translated: In the treatise Yogacarabhumi,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brgya bzhi bcu ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brgya bzhi bcu ston to //
translated: It teaches the four hundred qualities of the Tathagata.

original: bla na med pa'i gnas pa'i mdo las ni yon tan rnam pa brgya brgyad cu ston te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas pa'i mdo las ni yon tan rnam pa brgya brgyad cu ston te /
translated: The Sutra of the Inconceivable Secret teaches one hundred and eighty qualities.

original: zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in detail according to the Compendium of Characteristics.🔽The noble eightfold path and the four kinds of spiritual practitioners appear in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ; dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te zhes bya ba ni lnga pa lam dang 'bras bu snang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ; dge sbyong bzhi snang ba yin te zhes bya ba ni lnga pa lam dang 'bras bu snang ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth characteristic, revealing the path and the result.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas chos legs par gsungs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / des mngon du byas pa'i dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang / 'phags ba nyi shu rtsa bdun la sogs pa 'bras bu sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas chos legs par gsungs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang / des mngon du byas pa'i dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang / 'phags ba nyi shu rtsa bdun la sogs pa 'bras bu sna tshogs snang bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Thus, when the Tathagata appears in the world and the Dharma is well-proclaimed, the noble eightfold path and the four kinds of spiritual practitioners who manifest it and the various results such as the twenty-seven noble ones appear.

original: gal te sangs rgyas byung bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas byung bar ma gyur na /
translated: If a Buddha had not appeared,

original: thams cad mi snang bas de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las mi ni bsod nams dang shes rab dang ldan mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mi snang bas de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las mi ni bsod nams dang shes rab dang ldan mod kyi /
translated: Humans have both merit and wisdom.🔽If a Buddha does not appear in the world, they do not experience the ripening of their merit or obtain the path.

original: gal te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du ma byung na rnam par smin pa myong ba dang / lam 'thob par mi 'gyur la gal te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du ma byung na rnam par smin pa myong ba dang / lam 'thob par mi 'gyur la gal te sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung bar gyur na ni /
translated: But if a Buddha appears in the world,

original: gdod lam thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdod lam thob par 'gyur te /
translated: they obtain the path.

original: dper na mi'i mig dang ldan yang /
analyzed: dper na mi'i mig dang ldan yang /
translated: For example, even though a person has eyes,

original: nyi ma ma shar na ci yang mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyi ma ma shar na ci yang mthong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: if the sun does not rise, they see nothing.

original: nyi ma shar nas gdod mthong bar 'gyur bas bdag la @148a * //
analyzed: nyi ma shar nas gdod mthong bar 'gyur bas bdag la @148a * //
translated: But when the sun rises, they see.🔽So it is not right to say, “What use is the sun to me,

original: mig yod pas nyi ma ci dgos zhes bya bar mi rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mig yod pas nyi ma ci dgos zhes bya bar mi rung ba bzhin no //
translated: since I have eyes?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: phyi nang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed de /
analyzed: phyi nang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed de /
translated: “The correct view arises from internal and external causes and conditions.”

original: gzhan las chos thos pa dang / bdag nyid nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las chos thos pa dang / bdag nyid nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: It is listening to the Dharma from others and properly attending to it in one's own mind.

original: bsod nams kyi dngos po bskyed pa'i phyir dang ; dge ba'i sems kyi dngos po dang / shes rab bskyed pa'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi dngos po bskyed pa'i phyir dang ; dge ba'i sems kyi dngos po dang / shes rab bskyed pa'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
translated: Proper attention generates the entity of merit, the entity of virtuous mind and the entity of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas las thos pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas las thos pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one listens to the Dharma from the Buddha.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively taught in the sutra.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ni mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The four fruits of virtuous endeavor are as they appear in the sutra on the characteristics of the four fruits.

original: de ltar skye ba'i phyir dang / mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / the tshom gyi dra ba gcod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gis brgal du med cing gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / dge sbyong dmigs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa mtshan nyid lnga bshad pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba'i phyir dang / mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / the tshom gyi dra ba gcod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gis brgal du med cing gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lam dang / dge sbyong dmigs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa mtshan nyid lnga bshad pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Thus, because of arising, because of possessing marks, because of cutting the net of doubt, because of being unassailable by others and overwhelming others, because of the noble path and the focus of spiritual practice, and so on.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga rnam par phye nas bstan pas mjug bsdu ba dang / mtshan nyid lnga po spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga rnam par phye nas bstan pas mjug bsdu ba dang / mtshan nyid lnga po spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: a summary of the five characteristics by distinguishing them, and a general summary of the five characteristics.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: go rims bzhin du mtshan nyid lnga po dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mtshan nyid lnga po dag dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to the five characteristics in order.

original: de ltar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na 'jig rten du zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skye ba zhes bya ba ni gang su yang rung ba zhig byung na 'jig rten du zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, arising means that when anyone appears, it is said to be in the world.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni de ltar 'byung ba'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
translated: because the treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition states:

original: gzhan ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no //🔽de ltar rnam pa lnga po dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid lnga bshad pa'i spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no // de ltar rnam pa lnga po dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid lnga bshad pa'i spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The other is in accord with what is stated in this sutra.🔽Thus, the five aspects should be known as the characteristics of omniscience. This is the second general conclusion to the explanation of the five characteristics.

original: rigs kyi bu de lta na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshad ma gsum las brtsams nas mtshan nyid snga ma lnga po dag yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de lta na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i lung gi tshad ma'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid lnga po dag gis yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa tshad ma gsum las brtsams nas mtshan nyid snga ma lnga po dag yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, thus, the reasoning of tenable establishment is pure by means of the five characteristics because of the valid cognition of direct perception, because of the valid cognition of inference, because of the valid cognition of the noble ones’ scriptures, and because of the five characteristics. This is the second explanation of the five former characteristics as characteristics of purity, beginning with the three valid cognitions.

original: 'di ltar bstan pa'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa las mtshan nyid lngar bstan pa de yang tshad ma gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa'i 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa las mtshan nyid lngar bstan pa de yang tshad ma gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the five characteristics taught by the principles of proof are also included in the three valid cognitions.

original: mtshan nyid dang po gcig ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang po gcig ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas bsdus so //
translated: The first characteristic is included in the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: mtshan nyid bar ma gsum ni rjes su dpag @148b pa'i tshad mas bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bar ma gsum ni rjes su dpag @148b pa'i tshad mas bsdus so //
translated: The three middle characteristics are included in the valid cognition of inference.

original: mtshan nyid phyi ma gcig ni 'phags pa'i lung gi tshad mas bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid phyi ma gcig ni 'phags pa'i lung gi tshad mas bsdus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The last characteristic is included in the valid cognition of ārya scripture.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Yogācāra Bhūmi Śāstra and the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention

original: mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ba'o //
translated: are in agreement with what is taught in the sūtras.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
translated: In the Treatise on Exposition,

original: mtshan nyid snga ma lnga po dag so sor sbyar bar bshad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid snga ma lnga po dag so sor sbyar bar bshad de /
translated: the first five characteristics are explained as being applied individually.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise itself says:

original: de ltar na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na 'thad pas sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the principle of proof🔽is the principle of proof that is the cause of the ascertainment of the meaning of the scriptures.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i phyir dang / dpe'i phyir dang / yongs su grags pa'i phyir dang / lung gi tshad ma'i phyir mtshan nyid lnga po dag yongs su dag pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i phyir dang / dpe'i phyir dang / yongs su grags pa'i phyir dang / lung gi tshad ma'i phyir mtshan nyid lnga po dag yongs su dag pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because of direct valid knowledge, because of inferential valid knowledge, because of analogy, because of general consensus, and because of scriptural valid knowledge, the five characteristics are pure.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also teaches this.

original: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gyis yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid yongs su ma dag pa bdun rnam par phye ste bshad pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun gyis yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid yongs su ma dag pa bdun rnam par phye ste bshad pa bstan to //
translated: The section beginning with “What is it for the seven characteristics not to be pure?” explains the second topic, the seven impure characteristics.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also explained by the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the question.

original: de las gzhan pa mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpe nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The other is the characteristic of observation of what is similar to that. The other is the characteristic of observation of what is dissimilar to that. The other is the characteristic of observation of what is similar to all. The other is the characteristic of observation of what is dissimilar to all. The other is the characteristic of the establishment of an example of another type.🔽The other is the characteristic of what is not well known. The other is the characteristic of a scripture that is not very pure.

original: yongs su grags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: yongs su grags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This is the second, the Tathāgata’s answer that is correct.

original: 'di yang mdor bkod pa dang / rnam par bshad pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mdor bkod pa dang / rnam par bshad pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by a brief presentation and an extensive explanation.

original: 'di ni mdor bkod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bkod pa'o //
translated: This is the brief presentation.

original: mtshan nyid bdun po 'di dag skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bdun po 'di dag skyon dang bcas pa'i phyir yongs su ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These seven characteristics are called impure because they are faulty.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
translated: The treatise entitled “Introduction to Correct Reason” explains:

original: skyon dang bcas pa'i rgyu rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu bzhi yod pas rgyu 'dra ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa'i rgyu rnams ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bcu bzhi yod pas rgyu 'dra ba zhes bshad de /
translated: Defective causes are of fourteen types, and are called “similar causes.”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yongs su ma grags pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma grags pa ni rnam pa gnyis yod pas 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two types of causes that are not well known:

original: gang yang rung ba cig yongs su grags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig yongs su grags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: those that are not well known in the world and those that are not well known in treatises.

original: ma nges pa ni rnam pa drug yod de /🔽@149a * // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni rnam pa drug yod de / @149a * // 'di lta ste /
translated: There are six types of uncertain causes:🔽those that are uncertain in terms of time,🔽those that are uncertain in terms of place,🔽those that are uncertain in terms of nature,🔽those that are uncertain in terms of both,🔽those that are uncertain in terms of the result,

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and those that are uncertain in terms of the cause.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba ni rnam pa bzhi yod do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba ni rnam pa bzhi yod do // 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four types of mutually contradictory causes:🔽those that are contradictory in terms of the result,🔽those that are contradictory in terms of the cause,🔽those that are contradictory in terms of the nature of the thing,

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i rgyu la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i rgyu la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and those that are contradictory in terms of the thing itself.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood in detail according to the explanation in that text.

original: 'dir bstan pa'i mtshan nyid bdun las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa'i mtshan nyid bdun las /
translated: Among the seven characteristics taught here,

original: mtshan nyid snga ma bzhi ni bstan bcos gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa las bstan pa'i ma nges pa drug las /
analyzed: mtshan nyid snga ma bzhi ni bstan bcos gtan tshigs kyi rigs pa las bstan pa'i ma nges pa drug las /
translated: The first four characteristics are taught in the treatise called Logic of Debate.🔽

original: snga ma lnga po dag yin te /
analyzed: snga ma lnga po dag yin te /
translated: The first four characteristics are the first five of the six nondeterminations taught in the treatise Rational System of Valid Cognition.

original: drug pa phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa nyid ces bya ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug pa phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa nyid ces bya ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixth, called “mutual contradiction,” is not understood.

original: 'di ni sngar bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las bstan pa'i ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid drug bkod nas /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las bstan pa'i ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid drug bkod nas /
translated: Having previously set forth the six characteristics of nondetermination in the treatise Introduction to the Correct View,

original: de'i 'og tu bstan bcos de dang / mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bstan bcos de dang / mdo'i tshig 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: subsequently one should apply this treatise and the words of the sutra.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
translated: In the treatise Introduction to the Correct View,

original: ma nges pa ni drug ste /🔽thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni drug ste / thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
translated: nondetermination is sixfold:🔽common, uncommon, partial engagement with similar positions,

original: phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa dang / phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la /
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa dang / phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la /
translated: complete engagement with different positions, partial engagement with different positions,🔽and nonengagement with different positions.

original: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig tu 'jug pa dang / phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig tu 'jug pa dang / phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa'o //
translated: 1. common to both sides, 2. common to one part of both sides, and 3. definitely contradictory.

original: de la thun mong ba ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thun mong ba ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: 1. A common reason is like the following: Sound is permanent,🔽because it is an entity that is to be cognized.

original: gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs kun kyang gtan tshigs 'di thun mong du gyur pas de'i phyir ma nges pa yin te /🔽bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs kun kyang gtan tshigs 'di thun mong du gyur pas de'i phyir ma nges pa yin te / bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: This is uncertain because the reason is common to both sides, since it is common to all positions, both permanent and impermanent.🔽Sound is impermanent, because it is an entity that is to be cognized, like a pot.

original: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bur gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgra ni rtag pa yin no ;
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la sogs pa lta bur gzhal bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir sgra ni rtag pa yin no ;
translated: Sound is permanent, because it is an entity that is to be cognized, like space.

original: / de la thun mong ma yin pa ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs kyi gtan tshigs 'di spangs nas rtag pa dang mi
analyzed: / de la thun mong ma yin pa ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs kyi gtan tshigs 'di spangs nas rtag pa dang mi
translated: The uncommon is like saying, “Sound is permanent because of being the nature of the audible.”

original: rtag pa las gud na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir som nyi'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa las gud na yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir som nyi'i rgyu yin te /
translated: This is a cause of doubt because the reason for the position of permanence or impermanence is abandoned, and it does not exist apart from permanence and impermanence.

original: thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ci 'dra ba zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid ci 'dra ba zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like saying, “What is the nature of the audible?”

original: de la phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
analyzed: de la phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
translated: The similar position is the partial engagement.

original: phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa ni dper na sgra ni rtsol ba ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa ni dper na sgra ni rtsol ba ma yin pa'o zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: The different position is the complete engagement, like saying, “Sound is not a product.”

original: bar chad med pas bskyed pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pas bskyed pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is impermanent, generated without obstruction.

original: de la rtsol ba dang / bar chad med pas bskyed pa ma yin par dam @149b bca' ba ni 'di ltar glog dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin pas mi rtag pa nyid de glog la sogs pa la ni yod la /
analyzed: de la rtsol ba dang / bar chad med pas bskyed pa ma yin par dam @149b bca' ba ni 'di ltar glog dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin pas mi rtag pa nyid de glog la sogs pa la ni yod la /
translated: Since lightning, space, etc. are similar in being a part, impermanence is like that, existing in lightning, etc.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la med pa lta bu'o //
translated: but not existing in space, etc.

original: rtsol ba ma yin pa bar chad med pas bskyed par dam bca' ba ni /
analyzed: rtsol ba ma yin pa bar chad med pas bskyed par dam bca' ba ni /
translated: The thesis that it is not produced by effort or by an uninterrupted cause is as follows:

original: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni phyogs tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is a pot, etc. is a different part.

original: de la gtan tshigs 'di tshang bar yod pas glog dang bum pa ni chos mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs 'di tshang bar yod pas glog dang bum pa ni chos mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa'ang yin no //
translated: Since this reason is complete in that, lightning and a pot are similar in being a phenomenon, it is also uncertain.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rtsol ba dang bar chad med pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rtsol ba dang bar chad med pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Since it is impermanent like a pot, etc., it is produced by effort and by an uninterrupted cause.

original: glog la sogs pa lta bur mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rtsol ba ma yin pa bar chad med pas bskyed pa'o //🔽de la phyogs tha dad pa'i cha gcig la 'jug la /
analyzed: glog la sogs pa lta bur mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de rtsol ba ma yin pa bar chad med pas bskyed pa'o // de la phyogs tha dad pa'i cha gcig la 'jug la /
translated: because it is impermanent, like lightning, etc.

original: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa ni /
translated: The second is the application of a part of a position to a different position.

original: dper na sgra ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa bar chad med pas skyed pa'o zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtsol ba dang bcas pa bar chad med pas skyed pa'o zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the thesis: “Sound is produced by effort and is not without obstruction,”

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is impermanent.

original: rtsol ba dang bcas pa bar chad med pas bskyed par dam bca' ba ni 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin pas mi rtag pa nyid de 'di dag la tshang bar yod pas so //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang bcas pa bar chad med pas bskyed par dam bca' ba ni 'di ltar bum pa la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin pas mi rtag pa nyid de 'di dag la tshang bar yod pas so //
translated: The thesis that it is produced by effort and is not without obstruction is like this: because a pot, etc. is a similar position, impermanence is complete in it.

original: glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni phyogs tha dad ma yin te /
analyzed: glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni phyogs tha dad ma yin te /
translated: Lightning, space, etc. are not different positions.

original: de'i phyogs gcig glog ni yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig glog ni yod pa yin la /
translated: One part of that, lightning, exists,

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa yin no //
translated: but space, etc. do not exist. Therefore, as before, it is not ascertained.

original: de la gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa ni sgra rtag ces zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la gnyis ka'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa ni sgra rtag ces zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: One part of the two positions is engaged in, as in the case of the statement, “Sound is permanent,”

original: gzugs dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is visible and unimpeded.

original: de la rtag par dam bca' ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la rtag par dam bca' ba ni nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: In that case, the thesis of permanence is like space.

original: rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni phyogs mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The subtle particle, etc., are similar positions,

original: thogs pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni yod la /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa la ni yod la /
translated: because they exist in space, etc., which are unimpeded,

original: rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni med pa'o //
translated: but they do not exist in the subtle particle, etc.

original: bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa ni phyogs tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa ni phyogs tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The pot, pleasure, etc., are different positions,

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni yod la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni yod la /
translated: because pleasure, etc., exist,

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni bde ba dang / nam mkha' chos mtshungs pa mad pa'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni med pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni bde ba dang / nam mkha' chos mtshungs pa mad pa'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but the pot, etc., do not. Therefore, this reason is called “uncertain” because of the similarity of the properties of pleasure and space.

original: de la phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa'o zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la phan tshun 'gal bar nges pa ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa'o zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
translated: In that case, the certainty of mutual contradiction is, for example, like the thesis, “Sound is impermanent,”

original: byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of being produced.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la rtag pa'i sgrar rnam par gzhag pa lta bu ste /🔽thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la rtag pa'i sgrar rnam par gzhag pa lta bu ste / thos par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like positing a pot and so on as permanent because it is the nature of what is heard.

original: dper na sgra'i ngo bo nyid lta bu ste 'di gnyi ga yang yid @150a * //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i ngo bo nyid lta bu ste 'di gnyi ga yang yid @150a * //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of sound.

original: gnyis za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma nges pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis za ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga ma nges pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because both are causes of doubt, both are called indeterminate.

original: de yan chad du bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las 'jug pa las 'byung ba'i don bshad de /
analyzed: de yan chad du bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las 'jug pa las 'byung ba'i don bshad de /
translated: Up to this point, the meaning that occurs in the treatise Correct Logical Analysis has been explained.

original: gzhan ni mangs pas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni mangs pas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Others are not mentioned here because of being too numerous.

original: de la bstan bcos de las byung ba dang / mdo 'di'i tshig sbyar bar bya ba yang 'di la bshad pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la bstan bcos de las byung ba dang / mdo 'di'i tshig sbyar bar bya ba yang 'di la bshad pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Regarding that, there are two explanations of what occurs in that treatise and what is to be applied to the words of this sutra.

original: kha cig na re 'di las gsungs pa'i gnyis kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba gsum po dag bsdus te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di las gsungs pa'i gnyis kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba gsum po dag bsdus te /
translated: Some say: The two stated here subsume the three that occur in the treatise.

original: 'di ltar de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gsum pa phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gsum pa phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug la /
translated: Thus, the treatise mentions the third, partial engagement of similar classes, by the characteristic of observing that which is similar to that.

original: phyogs tha dad pa la kun 'jug pa dang / lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig gis 'jug pa las phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug pa bsdus so //
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa la kun 'jug pa dang / lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig gis 'jug pa las phyogs mtshungs pa cha gcig 'jug pa bsdus so //
translated: It is included in the fifth, partial engagement of both classes, and in the fourth, complete engagement of dissimilar classes.

original: de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bzhi pa tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bzhi pa tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la /
translated: The treatise mentions the fourth, partial engagement of dissimilar classes, by the characteristic of observing that which is dissimilar to that.

original: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa las phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug pa gsungs so //🔽thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
analyzed: phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa las phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug pa gsungs so // thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis /
translated: It is included in the fifth, partial engagement of both classes, and in the third, partial engagement of similar classes.

original: bstan bcos las byung ba dang po thun mong gi ma nges pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bstan bcos las byung ba dang po thun mong gi ma nges pa gsungs so //
translated: The treatise mentions the first, common indecision, by the characteristic of observing all in common.

original: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bsdus so zhe'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa bsdus so zhe'o //
translated: The second, the unestablished reason due to the nonestablished reason, is included in the treatise under the characteristic of the nonapprehended.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de ;
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de ;
translated: In connection with this explanation, there are two kinds of explanations of the nonapprehended characteristic of the reason, namely, the nonestablished reason due to the nonapprehended reason and the nonestablished reason due to the nonestablished reason.

original: kha cig na re mi mtshungs pa'i dpe kho na yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re mi mtshungs pa'i dpe kho na yod par zad kyi /
translated: Some say that there is only the nonestablished reason due to the nonapprehended reason,

original: mtshungs pa'i dpe ni med kyi /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i dpe ni med kyi /
translated: but not the nonestablished reason due to the nonestablished reason.

original: dper na sgra ni rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs na byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs na byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: For example, when sound is being proven to be permanent, it is said, “Because it is produced.”

original: kha cig na re 'di ni dpe la skyon rnam pa bcu yod pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni dpe la skyon rnam pa bcu yod pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Some say that there are ten faults in the example.

original: yongs su grags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gong du skyon rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis dam bca' ba'i don yongs su ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grags pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gong du skyon rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis dam bca' ba'i don yongs su ma grub pa'o //
translated: The nonestablished reason due to the nonestablished reason is the nonestablished meaning of the proposition, by the very fault of the nonestablished reason, as previously set forth.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of a very impure scripture is this:

analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lung gis mngon par bsgrubs pa gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
translated: it is established by a non-noble scripture.

original: kha cig na re mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga @150b las ;
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga @150b las ;
translated: Some say: From the five characteristics stated in the sutra,

original: dang po ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gsum pa phyogs mtshungs pa gcig 'jug la phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa bsdus so //
analyzed: dang po ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i gsum pa phyogs mtshungs pa gcig 'jug la phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa bsdus so //

original: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bzhi pa phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la /🔽phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa bsdus pas so //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i bzhi pa phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug la / phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa bsdus pas so //
translated: The second characteristic stated in the sutra includes the fourth one occurring in the treatise, which includes the application of a part of the different positions.

original: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i dang po thun mong ba'i nges pa bsdus so //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i dang po thun mong ba'i nges pa bsdus so //
translated: The third characteristic stated in the sutra includes the first one occurring in the treatise, which is the common certainty.

original: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pas gsungs so //🔽mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid lnga pas ni /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pas ni bstan bcos las 'byung ba gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pas gsungs so // mdo las gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid lnga pas ni /
translated: The fourth characteristic stated in the sutra indicates the second characteristic stated in the treatise, which is the non-ascertainment of the uncommon.

original: bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa bsdus so zhes zer te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i lnga pa gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa bsdus so zhes zer te /
translated: The fifth characteristic stated in the sutra indicates the fifth characteristic stated in the treatise, which is the inclusion of the part of both.

translated: The definition should be understood as before.🔽Here, that which is the fact that all phenomena are to be known by mental consciousness is called the characteristic of the observation of all in common.

analyzed: de la chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid gong ma bdun po dag rnam par bshad de
translated: This is the second explanation of the seven characteristics above.

original: / 'di yang bshad pa so so nas mi mthun pa ;
analyzed: / 'di yang bshad pa so so nas mi mthun pa ;
translated: This also has different explanations.

original: kha cig na re 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /

translated: The third is the teaching of the definition of the observation of all that is similar. The fourth is the teaching of the definition of the observation of all that is dissimilar, beginning with the words “All phenomena are permanent.”🔽The fifth is the teaching of the definition of the example of another type, beginning with the words “Other than that.” The sixth is the general teaching of the definition of that which is not mixed, beginning with the words “Son of noble family.”

original: drug pa yongs su 'dres pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa dang / yang de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis lnga pa gzhan gyi rigs kyi dper nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdun pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: drug pa yongs su 'dres pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid spyir bstan pa dang / yang de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba man chad kyis lnga pa gzhan gyi rigs kyi dper nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdun pa shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The seventh is the teaching of the definition of scripture that is not completely pure, beginning with the words “The definition of scripture is as follows.”

original: 'di ni dang po thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the definition of the observation of all that is similar, which is the first.

original: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i chos las gzhan pa dpe chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad ces bya ba ni dam bcas pa'i chos las gzhan pa dpe chos thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena” means all phenomena other than the thesis.

original: tshad ma'i don ni 'di skad du re zhig dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i don ni 'di skad du re zhig dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of valid cognition is as follows: For example, it is like a thesis that states, “Sound is permanent.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no zhes dam bca' ba lta bu ste /
translated: Because it is an object of knowledge of mental consciousness, like space and so on.”

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs gnyi ga yang rgyu 'di thun mong du gyur pas de'i phyir ma nges pa'o //🔽bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i phyogs gnyi ga yang rgyu 'di thun mong du gyur pas de'i phyir ma nges pa'o // bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Since this reason is common to both the permanent and impermanent positions, it is therefore indefinite.🔽Sound is impermanent because it is an object of knowledge by nature, like a pot and so on.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir sgra ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Sound is permanent because it is an object of knowledge by nature, like space and so on.

original: dam bcas pa'i tshogs las gzhan pa rnams ni rgyu'i phyogs mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir de thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i tshogs las gzhan pa rnams ni rgyu'i phyogs mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir de thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The other collections of theses are similar to the cause, and all of them are called the characteristic of the observation of the dissimilar.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las /
translated: This is taught in the treatise called the Introduction to Correct Reason

original: thun mong ba'i ma nges @151b pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i ma nges @151b pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: as the “common uncertainty.”

original: bstan bcos las gzhal bar bya ba zhes 'byung ba dang / 'dir mdo las shes par bya zhes gsungs pa tshig mi mthun yang don ni gcig go //
analyzed: bstan bcos las gzhal bar bya ba zhes 'byung ba dang / 'dir mdo las shes par bya zhes gsungs pa tshig mi mthun yang don ni gcig go //
translated: Although the treatise uses the term “to be evaluated” and this sūtra uses the term “to be understood,” the meaning is the same.

original: chos thams cad rtags dang ngo bo nyid dang / las dang chos dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas nges par phan tshun so so nas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces
analyzed: chos thams cad rtags dang ngo bo nyid dang / las dang chos dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yang rung bas nges par phan tshun so so nas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces
translated: All phenomena have different characteristics of reason, nature, action, quality, cause, and result. Any phenomenon that is ascertained by any dissimilar characteristic is dissimilar to all other phenomena. This is called the characteristic of the observation of the dissimilar.

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid bzhi pa thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid bzhi pa thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: The phrase one should know indicates the second, the fourth characteristic, the characteristic of the observation of all as discordant.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang khong du chud par dka' bas sngar rtags dang ngo bo nyid la sogs par rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang khong du chud par dka' bas sngar rtags dang ngo bo nyid la sogs par rnam par phye nas /
translated: Since the words of the sutra are difficult to understand, first the nature of the signs, etc. are distinguished,

original: de'i 'og tu don nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu don nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: and then the meaning itself is taught.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /

translated: Son of noble family, in that regard, the characteristic of observation that is consistent with something other than that, together with an example, is included in the characteristic of observation that is inconsistent with everything, which is called “existent” and so on.

analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid dang po las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid 'di yang tshig tshang bar bya ste /

analyzed: brjod na 'di skad du /

original: phyogs mtshungs pa'i cha gcig @153a * //
analyzed: phyogs mtshungs pa'i cha gcig @153a * //

translated: and the second is the definition of the observation of what is similar to that which is other than it, because of the difference of the parts.🔽In this regard, the definition of the observation of all that is dissimilar to it, together with the example, is said to be the meaning of the universal preclusion of all that is different from it.

original: don de'i phyir mdo'i tshig 'dis bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa la 'jug pa las phyogs mtshungs pa'i cha gcig 'jug pa dang / phyogs tha dad pa kun 'jug pa dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa las phyogs mtshungs pa'i cha gcig 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa yin no //

translated: For this reason, this statement of the sutra indicates that the meaning of the observation of what is similar to it, in the treatise, the Alankara, is included in the universal preclusion of all that is different from it, in the universal preclusion of all that is different from it, and in the universal preclusion of both.

translated: Because of that cause and that condition, it is not definite that it will be accomplished, and therefore it is said to be the characteristic of non-accomplishment.

analyzed: 'di ltar de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gang yin pa de nyid yongs su gregs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
