analyzed: nges par dam bcas pa'i don bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not able to accomplish the meaning of the definite promise.

original: yang de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa las yang thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid de las gzhan pa dang ni mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dpe dang bcas pa las yang thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa mtshan nyid de las gzhan pa dang ni mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan
translated: The characteristic of the observation of something else that is not in accordance with that, together with an example, is stated in the second half of the verse, beginning with “there is the characteristic of the observation of something in accordance with that.”

original: nyid dang / yongs su gregs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nyid dang / yongs su gregs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the observation of something in accordance with that, and the characteristic of the well-known, are explained.

original: 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the characteristic of the observation of something else that is not in accordance with that.

original: 'di yang tshig tshang bar byas te brjod nas 'di skad du phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug pa dang / phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang tshig tshang bar byas te brjod nas 'di skad du phyogs tha dad pa cha gcig 'jug pa dang / phyogs mtshungs pa kun 'jug pa dang / gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa'i don bsdus pa yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is also stated in complete sentences. It should be said that this is a summary of the meaning of the application of a part of a different position, the application of all of a similar position, and the application of a part of both positions.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as above.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des na de grub par bya ba la gcig tu @153b ma nges pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des na de grub par bya ba la gcig tu @153b ma nges pa'i phyir yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su gregs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: Because of that cause and condition, it is called the characteristic of thorough affliction, since it is not ascertained as being solely that which is to be established.

original: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The second, the explanation of the characteristic of thorough affliction, should be understood as above.

original: yongs su ma gregs pa'i phyir legs par so sor brtags pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su ma gregs pa'i phyir legs par so sor brtags pa'i rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not thoroughly afflicted, it is not properly investigated.🔽Because it is not thoroughly purified, it should not be relied upon.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mi brten par bskul ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mi brten par bskul ba'o //
translated: The second, the exhortation not to rely, is as follows.

original: gong du bstan pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yongs su gregs pa ma yin na ci'i phyir mdo las de skad du ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang yongs su gregs pa ma yin na ci'i phyir mdo las de skad du ma gsungs she na /
translated: If one applies the reasoning taught above, if the characteristic of observation is not thoroughly afflicted, and the characteristic of non-observation is not thoroughly afflicted, why is it said in the sutra?

original: smras pa / nges pa'i rigs pa las ma bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ma gsungs so //🔽gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'dis snga ma lnga po dag tshang bar bsdus nas yongs su gregs pa yin pa nyid du rab tu bsten te /
analyzed: smras pa / nges pa'i rigs pa las ma bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa'i phyir ma gsungs so // gzhan yang mdo'i tshig 'dis snga ma lnga po dag tshang bar bsdus nas yongs su gregs pa yin pa nyid du rab tu bsten te /
translated: He replied: “That which is not taught in the ascertainment of the principles is not mentioned because it is included in the summary.

original: de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dang mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: Moreover, this statement of the sūtra is taught as the complete inclusion of the previous five, and it is taught as the complete inclusion of the four characteristics of the observation of the other.

original: dpe dang bcas pas zhes bya ba mtshan nyid lnga pa bstan to //
analyzed: dpe dang bcas pas zhes bya ba mtshan nyid lnga pa bstan to //
translated: The statement, “along with the example,” teaches the fifth characteristic.

original: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: The statement, “the existence of the characteristic of the observation of all that is incompatible,” teaches the fourth characteristic.

original: yang de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang de las gzhan pa dang mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya bas ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: The statement, “the characteristic of the observation of that which is incompatible with the other,” teaches the second characteristic.

original: dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid lnga pa yang bzlas te bstan to //
analyzed: dpe dang bcas pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid lnga pa yang bzlas te bstan to //
translated: The statement, “along with the example,” teaches the fifth characteristic again.

original: thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: thams cad mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa zhes bya bas ni mtshan nyid gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “all agree that the characteristics of objects of knowledge exist” indicates the third characteristic.

original: rigs pa des na snga ma lnga po dag las brtsams nas yongs su gregs pa ma yin pa nyid du rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa des na snga ma lnga po dag las brtsams nas yongs su gregs pa ma yin pa nyid du rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this reasoning, the first five characteristics are taught to be unmistaken.

original: de ltar bshad na ni sngar yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas mngon sum du dmigs pa la sogs pa gsum po dag gis yongs su gregs pa nyid du bstan pa dag dang yang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na ni sngar yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs nas mngon sum du dmigs pa la sogs pa gsum po dag gis yongs su gregs pa nyid du bstan pa dag dang yang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is explained in this way, it will be consistent with the earlier explanation of the characteristics of purity, which states that the first three characteristics of direct perception and so on are unmistaken.

original: gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa gang yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid de ni rang bzhin nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa mtshan nyid lnga pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa gang yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid de ni rang bzhin nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ma yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni bzhi pa mtshan nyid lnga pa dang /
translated: The fourth characteristic is the characteristic of scripture that is not completely pure. It should be understood that the example of another’s lineage and the characteristic of scripture that is not completely pure are not completely pure by nature.

original: bdun pa gcig tu bsdus te rnam par bshad pa ston to //🔽de la gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar @154a * //
analyzed: bdun pa gcig tu bsdus te rnam par bshad pa ston to // de la gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar @154a * //
translated: The seventh is the teaching of the summary and the explanation.

original: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Among them, the definition of the proof by the example of another type is the reason of the dissimilar type.

original: dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa dag gis byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te zhes dam bcas pa dag gis byas pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the statement: “Sound is permanent, because it is produced,”

original: de la nam mkha' la sogs pa ni cha mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' la sogs pa ni cha mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: Among them, space, etc. are similar parts.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni cha mi mtshungs pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'di ni cha mi mtshungs pa kho na la yod pas de'i phyir gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni cha mi mtshungs pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'di ni cha mi mtshungs pa kho na la yod pas de'i phyir gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: But a pot, etc. are dissimilar parts. Since this reason exists only in the dissimilar type, therefore it is called the definition of the proof by the example of another type.

original: yang dpe'i skyon rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dpe'i skyon rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it has the ten faults of the example.

original: de la shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol ba'i log par bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i lung gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni phyi rol ba'i log par bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, the definition of the scripture that is not very pure is the false teachings of the non-Buddhists.

original: yang na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dang / dpe skyon dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs dang / dpe skyon dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: or else they are the thesis, the reason, and the example, together with their faults.

original: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni phal cher sngar bshad pa dag dang mthun te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni phal cher sngar bshad pa dag dang mthun te /
translated: Some say: These four are for the most part similar to the previous explanations.

original: de la bye brag yod pa yang /
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa yang /
translated: But there is a difference.

original: mtshan nyid bzhi pas ni gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma bsdus so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi pas ni gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma bsdus so //
translated: The fourth definition does not include the one called “pervasion of both parts”

original: mtshan nyid bzhi pa las gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba nyid ni gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhi pa las gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba nyid ni gnyi ga'i phyogs kyi cha gcig 'jug pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The fourth definition itself is the definition of the proof by the example of another type, which is called “pervasion of both parts.”

original: gzhan ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: The others are as previously explained.

original: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni snga ma'i bshad pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re bzhi po 'di dag ni snga ma'i bshad pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Some say: These four are similar to the previous explanations.

original: de la bye brag yod pa gzhan gyi rigs kyis nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa dang / bzhi par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa gzhan gyi rigs kyis nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa dang / bzhi par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But there is a difference. The definition of the proof by the example of another type is understood as the third and fourth,

original: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni snga ma bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: the others are as before.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang /
translated: Although these three explanations exist,

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo'i dpe rnam pa gnyis las bstan pa dag dang sbyar na gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa las gzhan gyi rigs kyis dpe zhes bya ba'i tshig spyir med do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo'i dpe rnam pa gnyis las bstan pa dag dang sbyar na gzhan gyi rigs kyi dpes nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa las gzhan gyi rigs kyis dpe zhes bya ba'i tshig spyir med do //
translated: when applied to the explanations in the two works, the treatise Exposition of Valid Knowledge and the sūtra example, the definition of the proof by example of another type is not found in the third and fourth, because the words “example of another type” are not found in general.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa las ming bkod pa ni mthun la ;
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / rnam par bshad pa las ming bkod pa ni mthun la ;
translated: The names listed in the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds and the Exposition are similar,

original: bshad pa ni cung zad tha dad de /
analyzed: bshad pa ni cung zad tha dad de /
translated: but the explanations are slightly different.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: chos thams cad rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba'i cha gcig phan tshun @154b mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa dang mthun pa dang /🔽mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa'i mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang rung ba'i cha gcig phan tshun @154b mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa dang mthun pa dang / mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of all phenomena are either the characteristics of their commonality or their dissimilarity, such as their reason, nature, action, attribute, cause, effect, and so on.🔽The characteristics of their commonality and dissimilarity are the characteristics of their being observed as similar or dissimilar to other phenomena.

original: nges par phan tshun so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad de ;
analyzed: nges par phan tshun so so tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni thams cad mi mthun par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad de ;
translated: The characteristics of their dissimilarity are the characteristics of their being observed as dissimilar to all other phenomena.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: This is also taught in the Commentary on the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The characteristics of phenomena other than these are taught in accordance with this sutra.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na rtags dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa lnga po dag ni mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang gcig tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du yang rtogs so //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na rtags dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa lnga po dag ni mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang gcig tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du yang rtogs so //
translated: When applied to this explanation, the five such as reason and nature are also understood as the characteristics of sameness and difference.

original: de la chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the principle of reality is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the five Tathagatas appear in the world or not,

original: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether they appear in the world or not,🔽the abiding reality and the abiding realm of reality are called the principle of reality.

original: chos nyid gnas pa dang chos kyi dbyings gnas pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa chos nyid kyi rigs pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid gnas pa dang chos kyi dbyings gnas pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa chos nyid kyi rigs pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the fourth principle of reality, the principle of reality, which is distinguished and explained.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don las brtsams nas mdo'i tshig gsum po chos nyid gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi don ston te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don las brtsams nas mdo'i tshig gsum po chos nyid gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa dang chos kyi dbyings kyi don ston te /
translated: In the Yogacarabhumi Sastra, starting from the meaning of dependent origination, the meaning of the three sutra phrases abiding reality, abiding phenomena, and the realm of phenomena is taught.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has said in that treatise:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngas byas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngas byas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Dependent origination is not created by me,

original: gzhan dag gis byas pa yang ma yin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis byas pa yang ma yin te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'jig rten du byung yang rung /
translated: nor by others,

original: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: whether Buddhas appear or not,🔽the intrinsic nature of phenomena🔽and the stability of the laws of phenomena

original: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa dang ; chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa la chos nyid ni gang /
analyzed: chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa dang ; chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa la chos nyid ni gang /
translated: and the expanse of reality always remain.🔽What is the intrinsic nature of phenomena?

original: chos gnas pa ni gang /
analyzed: chos gnas pa ni gang /
translated: What is the stability of the laws of phenomena?

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the expanse of reality?

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas grags pa gang yin pa de ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That which is renowned from beginningless time is called the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

original: ji ltar grags pa de rigs pa'i tshig dang / yi ge rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa de ni chos gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa de rigs pa'i tshig dang / yi ge rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa de ni chos gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is renowned in that way is established by the words and letters of reasoning. That is called the stability of the laws of phenomena.

original: gnas pa de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na de'i phyir dbyings zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa de'i rgyu chos nyid de yin pas na de'i phyir dbyings zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the cause of that abiding is reality, therefore it is called the “element.”

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas nyan thos kyi sa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas nyan thos kyi sa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the reasoning of reality in the Sravaka Levels and so on in the Yogacarya Levels is as follows:

original: ci'i phyir phung po @155a * //🔽rnams de lta bur gyur pa yin /🔽'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po @155a * // rnams de lta bur gyur pa yin / 'jig rten gnas pa de lta bur gyur pa yin /
translated: Why are the aggregates like that?🔽Why is the world like that?

original: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid sra ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of earth solidity?

original: chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin /
analyzed: chu'i mtshan nyid gsher ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of water fluidity?

original: me'i mtshan nyid tsha ba yin /
analyzed: me'i mtshan nyid tsha ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of fire heat?

original: rlung gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba yin /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshan nyid g-yo ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of wind movement?

original: ci'i phyir phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po rnams mi rtag pa yin /
translated: Why are the aggregates impermanent?

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba yin /
translated: Why is nirvana peace?

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gzugs su rung ba yin /
translated: Similarly, why is the characteristic of form suitability to material form?

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid myong ba yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of feeling experience?

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kun du shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid kun du shes pa yin /
translated: Why is the characteristic of discernment thorough understanding?

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon par 'du byed pa yin /
translated: The characteristic of compositional activity is to form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed pa yin zhe na /🔽de ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed pa yin zhe na / de ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is to be conscious.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin de yin zhing /
translated: This is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.🔽It is the nature of those phenomena and it is as if it is their essence.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'dir rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid lta bu yin pas chos nyid de gang kho na yin pa de nyid 'dir rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This intrinsic nature is called reasoning here.🔽Moreover, the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las chos la brtson pa chos rnam par dpyad pa ni rigs pa du zhig gis rnam par dpyod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las chos la brtson pa chos rnam par dpyad pa ni rigs pa du zhig gis rnam par dpyod ce na /
translated: When the Dharma is analyzed in terms of striving for the Dharma, how many reasonings are there?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / rigs pa rnam pa bzhis dpyad de /
analyzed: smras pa / rigs pa rnam pa bzhis dpyad de /
translated: It is analyzed by four reasonings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof and the reasoning of intrinsic nature.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reasoning of dependence is as follows.

original: gang 'du 'du byed rnams skye ba rkyen la ltos pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'du 'du byed rnams skye ba rkyen la ltos pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The arising of any conditioned thing depends on conditions.

original: dper na myu gu 'byung ba na sa bon dang / dus dang / chu dang / zhing rnams la ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba na dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen la sogs pa la ltos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu 'byung ba na sa bon dang / dus dang / chu dang / zhing rnams la ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba na dbang po dang don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen la sogs pa la ltos pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the arising of a sprout depends on a seed, time, water, and a field. The arising of consciousness depends on conditions such as the faculties, objects, and attention.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The principle of efficacy is as follows:

original: gang zag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams so so rang gi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i chos rnams so so rang gi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The individual functions of the different characteristics of a person are their individual activities.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po la sogs pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: For example, the eye faculty, etc., are the bases of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so so rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so so rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., are the individual forms of awareness of forms, etc.

original: gser mgar la sogs ba la bzo rnams ni gser la sogs pa'i las byed ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gser mgar la sogs ba la bzo rnams ni gser la sogs pa'i las byed ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Artisans, such as goldsmiths, etc., are those who work with gold, etc.

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽gang bsgrub pa'i don tshad @155b dang mi 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste / gang bsgrub pa'i don tshad @155b dang mi 'gal bar ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The reasoning of efficacy is as follows.🔽It is that which shows that the object to be established is not contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: gang bsgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bcas pa la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang bsgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bcas pa la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the demonstration of a thesis, etc.,

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste thog ma med pa'i dus na /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste thog ma med pa'i dus na /
translated: The reasoning of reality is as follows.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'i chos rnams la chos nyid du grags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnas pa'i chos rnams la chos nyid du grags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is that which is renowned as the reality of phenomena that exist through the characteristics of universals and instantiated things since beginningless time.

original: dper na mes ni tshig par byed do //
analyzed: dper na mes ni tshig par byed do //
translated: For example, it is renowned that fire burns,

original: chus ni 'gul bar byed ces bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: chus ni 'gul bar byed ces bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
translated: water wets, and so on.

original: mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in a sūtra:

original: mig ni yongs su dag pa yin yang /
analyzed: mig ni yongs su dag pa yin yang /
translated: “The eye is completely pure,

original: rtag pa med pa nas bdag med pa'i bar gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa med pa nas bdag med pa'i bar gyis stong ngo //
translated: but it is empty of permanence and so on up to and including self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ni chos nyid kyis de yin pas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ni chos nyid kyis de yin pas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Its nature is such by way of reality.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang / rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang / rnam par bshad pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the Abhidharma treatise, the Compendium of Abhidharma, the Levels of Yogic Deeds, the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras, and the Explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom in a Hundred Thousand Stanzas.

original: de la spyi dang bye brag lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la spyi dang bye brag lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five general and specific topics are as follows:

original: sngar mdor bstan nas tshig gis bstan pa'i chos phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig gi bye brag tu rnam par phye nas mthar thug par ston pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni brgyad pa spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: sngar mdor bstan nas tshig gis bstan pa'i chos phyi ma phyi ma'i tshig gi bye brag tu rnam par phye nas mthar thug par ston pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ni brgyad pa spyi dang bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: The eighth, the general and specific topics, is indicated by the phrase “the final presentation, which is a detailed classification of the topics that were previously presented in brief and then explained in the root text, in terms of the specific words of the later topics.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Treatise on Explaning the Intention states that the topics are “condensed” and “extensive.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bsdus ba dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las bsdus ba dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the treatise itself states that the condensed and extensive topics are as follows:

original: sngar chos tshig gcig bstan pa'i tshig phyi ma phyi ma'i dpag tu med pa dag gis phan tshun rnam par phye nas mthar thug pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngar chos tshig gcig bstan pa'i tshig phyi ma phyi ma'i dpag tu med pa dag gis phan tshun rnam par phye nas mthar thug pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The former is a single word of Dharma, and the latter is the infinite words that mutually distinguish it, and finally, it is the ultimate.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las spyi dang bye brag gi sgo ni sngar tshig gcig mdor bstan nas tshig phyi ma gzhan gyis rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las spyi dang bye brag gi sgo ni sngar tshig gcig mdor bstan nas tshig phyi ma gzhan gyis rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, in the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma, it says: “The general and specific are first taught in a single word, and then the subsequent words distinguish and explain it.”

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, it says:

original: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “The general characteristic is like impermanence and so forth.

original: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni chos rnams mi rtag pa yin yang so so'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni tha dad de /
analyzed: bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni chos rnams mi rtag pa yin yang so so'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni tha dad de /
translated: The specific characteristic is that although phenomena are impermanent, their individual specific characteristics are distinct.

original: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i mtshan nyid ni sra ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of earth is solidity.

original: chu'i mtshan nyid ni gsher ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu'i mtshan nyid ni gsher ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The characteristic of water is fluidity,” and so forth.

original: de la @156a * //
analyzed: de la @156a * //
translated: Regarding that,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the defining characteristic of their intrinsic reality is as follows:

original: ngas rnam pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos len par byed pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngas rnam pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos len par byed pa 'di lta ste /
translated: I teach the factors of enlightenment that possess aspects and possess objects, which are the factors of enlightenment that are the bearers of the factors of enlightenment, which are as follows:🔽The teachings on the applications of mindfulness and so on are called the defining characteristic of their intrinsic reality.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma mo bstan pa la mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu phye ba las mtshan nyid bzhi pa'i
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma mo bstan pa la mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gcig tu phye ba las mtshan nyid bzhi pa'i
translated: This is the explanation of the defining characteristic in terms of the eleventh topic in the exposition of the mother, which is the fourth defining characteristic.

original: sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the defining characteristic in terms of the four defining characteristics,

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid lnga pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid lnga pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ston to //
translated: this is the explanation of the fifth defining characteristic, the defining characteristic of their intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dag gi bdag nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du bstan pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa de dag gi bdag nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa yin pas /
translated: Thus the intrinsic reality of those factors of enlightenment that are taught above, the applications of mindfulness and so on, is the bearer of them.

original: yul la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang bcas pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun len par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang bcas pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun len par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of the practice is the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, which are endowed with the aspects of the objects of meditation and endowed with the nature of the objects of meditation.

original: de la de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of its result is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu dang / yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa dang / de ni de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu dang / yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa dang / de ni de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the mundane and supramundane afflictions, the attainment of the mundane and supramundane results and qualities, and the attainment of the result of the practice are called the characteristic of its result.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams gtan du spangs pa thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de dag gis mngon par bsgrub pa 'dus byas kyi yon tan gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams gtan du spangs pa thob pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de dag gis mngon par bsgrub pa 'dus byas kyi yon tan gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of the result is the supression of the defilements by the mundane path, the attainment of nirvana which is the permanent abandonment of the defilements by the supramundane path, and whatever conditioned qualities are accomplished by them.

original: de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of the proclamation of one's experience is as follows:

original: de nyid las rnam par grol ba'i shes pas so sor yang dag par myong ba gzhan dag la rgya cher sgrogs pa dang / 'chad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de ni myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdun pa de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rnam par grol ba'i shes pas so sor yang dag par myong ba gzhan dag la rgya cher sgrogs pa dang / 'chad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa de ni myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdun pa de myong ba rnam par bsnyad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The proclamation of one's experience is the extensive declaration to others, the explanation and the teaching of the Dharma by the knowledge of liberation from those very defilements. This is called the characteristic of the proclamation of one's experience. This is the explanation of the seventh characteristic, the proclamation of one's experience.

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos des nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i shes pas 'dus byas dang 'dus @156b ma byas kyi yon tan myong ba gang yin pa de dge ba gzhan dag ston par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos des nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i shes pas 'dus byas dang 'dus @156b ma byas kyi yon tan myong ba gang yin pa de dge ba gzhan dag ston par byed pas so //
translated: Thus, that factor conducive to enlightenment is the experience of conditioned and unconditioned qualities by the knowledge that abandons the afflictions, because it teaches other virtues.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristic of the factors that obstruct it is as follows:🔽Any afflicted factor that obstructs the cultivation of the factors conducive to enlightenment is called the characteristic of the factors that obstruct it.🔽This explains the eighth characteristic, the characteristic of the factors that obstruct it.🔽The characteristics of the factors that are conducive to enlightenment are explained in the same way as the characteristics of the factors that obstruct it.🔽The characteristics of the factors that are conducive to enlightenment are explained in the same way as the characteristics of the factors that obstruct it.

analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristics of the factors that are conducive to enlightenment are explained in the same way as the characteristics

original: de dag nyid la gces spras byed pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid la gces spras byed pa'i chos gang dag yin pa de ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgu pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the ninth characteristic, that which is in accordance with it.

original: rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which performs the function of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment through roots of virtue on the side of liberation and so on is called the Dharma that is in accordance with it.🔽The characteristic of its disadvantages should be understood as the faults that exist in those very factors that are obstacles.

original: de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni bar du gcod pa'i chos de dag nyid la yod pa'i skyon rnams gang yin pa de ni de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams kyi nyes dmigs🔽kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni bar du gcod pa'i chos de dag nyid la yod pa'i skyon rnams gang yin pa de ni de'i nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu pa bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams kyi nyes dmigs🔽kyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the tenth characteristic, the disadvantages of the factors that are obstacles.

original: 'gro ba dang skye ba la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang skye ba la sogs pa mngon par 'grub pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la sgrib par byed pa gang yin pa dag go //
translated: They are obscurations to the characteristics of the mental afflictions that are the actualization of going, rebirth, etc.

original: de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos de dag nyid la yod pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa phan yon gyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad
analyzed: de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos de dag nyid la yod pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni de'i phan yon gyi mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa phan yon gyi mtshan nyid rnam par bshad
translated: The characteristic of benefit should be understood as the virtues that exist in those very favorable qualities.

original: pa'o // bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /🔽bsngags pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: pa'o // bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni / bsngags pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung ste /
translated: In the Vyakhyayukti,🔽it says that the characteristic of praise is

original: 'di ltar rjes su mthun pa'i chos la yon tan ji snyed yod pa gang yin pa de ni bsngags pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su mthun pa'i chos la yon tan ji snyed yod pa gang yin pa de ni bsngags pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: the virtues that exist in those very favorable qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Manjusri also said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo dag 'di las slar phyi @157a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo dag 'di las slar phyi @157a * //
translated: The Blessed One has taught the bodhisattvas the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkās.🔽Please explain in brief the meaning of the dhāraṇī that is not shared in common with outsiders.

original: rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma lags pa gzungs kyi don mdor bsdus te bshad du gsol zhes bya ba ni gong du bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma lags pa gzungs kyi don mdor bsdus te bshad du gsol zhes bya ba ni gong du bzhi pa ste /
translated: This is the fourth request.

original: snod gsum rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don rnam par bshad pa'o zhes gnyis su phye ba las /
analyzed: snod gsum rgya cher rnam par bshad pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don rnam par bshad pa'o zhes gnyis su phye ba las /
translated: It is divided into two parts: the extensive explanation of the three baskets, and the explanation of the meaning of the uncommon dhāraṇī.

original: de yan chod du sde snod gsum rgya cher rnam par bshad zin te /
analyzed: de yan chod du sde snod gsum rgya cher rnam par bshad zin te /
translated: Up to this point, the three baskets have been extensively explained.

original: 'di man chad ni gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gnyis pa thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: From here on, the second part is taught, the explanation of the meaning of the uncommon dhāraṇī.

original: 'di yang bshad par gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bshad par gsol ba dang / yang dag par bshad pas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This is also to be shown by requesting the explanation and the correct explanation.

original: bshad par gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bshad par gsol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The request for explanation is also of two kinds:

original: yang dag par bshad par gsol ba dang / bshad par gsol ba btab pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bshad par gsol ba dang / bshad par gsol ba btab pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: the request to explain correctly, and the explanation of the intention of the request to explain.

original: 'di ni dang po yang dag par bshad par gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po yang dag par bshad par gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: This is the first request to explain correctly.

original: de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzungs zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Therein, dharaṇī is the nature of mindfulness and wisdom.

original: de bshad par gsol ba'i gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis sde snod gsum rgya cher bshad pas 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas sde snod gsum mdor bsdus te bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bshad par gsol ba'i gong du bcom ldan 'das kyis sde snod gsum rgya cher bshad pas 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas sde snod gsum mdor bsdus te bshad du gsol /
translated: Since the Bhagavān previously extensively explained the three piṭakas, here it is said, May the Tathāgata explain the three piṭakas in brief.

original: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams zab mo ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa rnams brjed par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa' rnams zab mo ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa rnams brjed par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: By that, the bodhisattvas will not forget the profound teachings with implied meaning,

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus spangs nas 'dus ma byas 'thob par 'gyur bar dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus spangs nas 'dus ma byas 'thob par 'gyur bar dgongs pa ste /
translated: and will abandon the body of negative tendencies and attain the unconditioned.

original: mu stegs can log par bstan pa'i gzungs dang thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don ces bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can log par bstan pa'i gzungs dang thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the meaning of the uncommon dhāraṇī because it is not common with the dhāraṇīs of the tīrthikas' false teachings.

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na gang zag dang chos gnyis kyis stong pa'i tshul gyis gang zag dang chos gnyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na gang zag dang chos gnyis kyis stong pa'i tshul gyis gang zag dang chos gnyis stong pa'o //
translated: Another explanation is that the emptiness of the person and of phenomena is the emptiness of the two, i.e., the person and phenomena, in the sense that they are empty of the two, i.e., the person and phenomena.

original: shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don yin te /
analyzed: shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don yin te /
translated: The arising of this knowledge is the uncommon meaning of the dhāraṇī.

original: de khong du chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo ldem por dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de khong du chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo ldem por dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of comprehending that, one enters into the profound Dharma of the Tathāgata, which is taught with an implied meaning.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ;
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ;
translated: In the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra,

original: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it is explained that “it is not shared with those outside because of three kinds of meanings.”

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni mdor bsdus na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyir 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang / thun @157b mong ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ni mdor bsdus na ma 'dres pa'i yan lag gsum gyi phyir 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang / thun @157b mong ma yin par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, that text also says, “The well-taught Dharma and Vinaya is not shared with those outside because of three unshared aspects.”

original: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su yang 'gro'o //
translated: It also falls into the category of “well-spoken.”

original: de la yan lag gsum ni yongs su grub pa dang / mthar thug pa las rnam par grol bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyi thabs bstan pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyi nang gi so so rang gi rig pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yan lag gsum ni yongs su grub pa dang / mthar thug pa las rnam par grol bar bstan pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyi thabs bstan pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyi nang gi so so rang gi rig pa bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therein, the three branches are taught in order to demonstrate complete accomplishment, the ultimate, and liberation, in order to demonstrate the method for that, and in order to demonstrate the inner, personal knowledge of that.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin nos //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin nos //
translated: This is taught in detail in the same text.

original: thun mong ma lags pa'i gzungs kyi don des byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo rnams kyi ldem por dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa 'thob par 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bshad par gsol ba'i dgongs pa bstan
analyzed: thun mong ma lags pa'i gzungs kyi don des byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo rnams kyi ldem por dgongs pa'i rjes su 'jug pa 'thob par 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bshad par gsol ba'i dgongs pa bstan
translated: By means of that uncommon meaning of dhāraṇī, bodhisattvas attain the ability to engage in the indirect intention of the profound Dharma taught by the Tathāgata.” This is the second request, which is the intention of the question.

original: pa ste / 'dir mdor gsungs pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i ldem por dgongs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa ste / 'dir mdor gsungs pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos zab mo byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i ldem por dgongs pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, by the power of the brief teaching, one enters into the profound Dharma taught by the Tathagata, such as the absence of action, etc., which is intended as an indirect suggestion.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Manjusri:

original: rigs kyi bu khyed legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyed legs par nyon cig dang / ngas khyod la thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don mdor bsdus te /
translated: Son of good family, listen well, and I will explain to you in brief the meaning of the uncommon dharani.

original: bshad pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad bshad /
analyzed: bshad pas zhes bya ba 'di man chad bshad /
translated: From here onward is the explanation.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o//
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o//
translated: Second, the Tathagata's true reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: mnyan par bskul zhing bka' bshad par snang ba bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan par bskul zhing bka' bshad par snang ba bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: Encouraging listening and showing the appearance of explaining the teaching, and from Son of good family onward, the true explanation according to the request.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first also has two parts:

original: bshad par gnang ba bstan pa dang / bkas bshad pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bshad par gnang ba bstan pa dang / bkas bshad pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: 1. the explanation of the teaching, and 2. the explanation of the benefits of the teaching.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngas bshad pa'i ldem po dag la legs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bkas bshad pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ngas bshad pa'i ldem po dag la legs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bkas bshad pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas will understand well the indirect teachings that I have taught. This is the second, the explanation of the benefits of the teaching.

original: rigs kyi bu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni ngas thams cad byed pa med pa dang / gang zag ci yang med par bstan te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni ngas thams cad byed pa med pa dang / gang zag ci yang med par bstan te /
translated: Son of noble family, I have taught that all phenomena, whether defiled or purified, are devoid of any agent and any person.

original: rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are completely free of any agent.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur la /
translated: Defiled phenomena become defiled,

original: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur pa ma yin /
translated: and later they are not purified.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos kyang phyis rnam par byang @158a * //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos kyang phyis rnam par byang @158a * //
translated: Purified phenomena are later purified.

original: la ; sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur pa ma yin na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: la ; sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur pa ma yin na zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with not previously afflicted teaches the second question, which is the correct explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: tshig rkyang pas bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rkyang pas bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation in prose and the explanation in verse that repeats the prose.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first also has two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the summary.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The explanation also has three parts:

original: yang dag pa'i don nyid bstan pa dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis kun tu rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / gang la la zhes bya ba man chad kyis khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don nyid bstan pa dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis kun tu rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / gang la la zhes bya ba man chad kyis khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: the teaching of the correct meaning itself, the teaching of the faults of grasping through delusion beginning with childish ordinary beings, and the teaching of the benefits of understanding beginning with whatever...

original: 'di ni dang po yang dag pa'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po yang dag pa'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the correct meaning itself.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two explanations of the words of the sūtra:

original: kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Some say: Any phenomenon that is thoroughly afflicted...🔽🔽

original: gang zag ci yang med ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can gyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag ci yang med ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can gyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
translated: Some say: The passage from “whatever is a phenomenon of affliction” up to “there is no person at all” teaches the meaning of emptiness of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i chos thams cad la so so tha dad pa'i byed pa ci yang med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ngas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i chos thams cad la so so tha dad pa'i byed pa ci yang med par bstan te /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān said, “I teach that all phenomena of affliction and purification are devoid of any activity that is separate and distinct.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du gang zag la ni bdag ci yang med do zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba bzhin du gang zag la ni bdag ci yang med do zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Just as form and so on are seen, the self of the person does not exist at all.”

original: yang na byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mchog tu smra ba zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis chos las gud na med pa dgag pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yang na byed pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mchog tu smra ba zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis chos las gud na med pa dgag pa lta bu ste /
translated: Or the passage from “no activity” up to “the supreme” refutes the existence of a person that is separate from the aggregates, like the passage that states, “The self is not form.”

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi stong pa'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi stong pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of such passages is the meaning of emptiness of sentient beings.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos stong pa'i don bstan te ;🔽'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / spros pa sna tshogs kyi byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur la /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos stong pa'i don bstan te ; 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang / spros pa sna tshogs kyi byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur la /
translated: The phrase “because they are devoid of all activity” and so on teaches the meaning of the emptiness of phenomena.

original: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin /🔽rnam par byang ba'i chos kyang phyir rnam par byang la /
analyzed: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin / rnam par byang ba'i chos kyang phyir rnam par byang la /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are devoid of the activity of the various conceptual elaborations of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects. Therefore, afflicted phenomena are not first afflicted and then purified later.

original: sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Purified phenomena are not first purified and then later afflicted.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: kun nas brtags pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ni sems kyi rjes su yod pa ni yin la /
analyzed: kun nas brtags pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ni sems kyi rjes su yod pa ni yin la /
translated: Afflicted and purified phenomena that are imputed are related to the mind,

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur @158b la ;
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin pas de'i phyir sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur @158b la ;
translated: but they do not exist ultimately. Therefore, they are not first afflicted and then later purified.

original: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Later, they will be purified.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di las ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bstan pa med na /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di las ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tshig bstan pa med na /
translated: If the words “imagined reality” are not taught in this passage from the sutra,

original: ji ltar kun nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na yin par shes she na /
translated: how can it be known that it refers only to imagined reality?

original: smras pa / gong du spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: smras pa / gong du spyi'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa dang sbyar na /
translated: We reply: If it is applied to the teaching of emptiness as the general characteristic above,

original: kun brtags pa kho na bstsal pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun brtags pa kho na bstsal pa yin gyi /
translated: it refers only to the imagined.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis ni ma yin pas /
translated: It does not refer to the two realities,

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstsal bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bstsal bar shes so //
translated: so it should be understood that this sutra passage refers to the imagined reality.

original: yang na rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i spros pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i spros pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Alternatively, the above teaching of defilement and purification is free from all activity, because the phenomena of defilement and purification are free from the activity of the conceptualization of I and mine and so on.

original: kha cig na re de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams spyir smos pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams spyir smos pa'o //
translated: Some say: “That which is called the phenomena of affliction and the phenomena of purification” generally refers to the phenomena of affliction and purification.

original: ngas thams cad byed par bstan te zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med par rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngas thams cad byed par bstan te zhes bya ba ni chos bdag med par rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: “ I have taught that all are created” refers to the teaching of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang zag ci yang med par bstan zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag ci yang med par bstan zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'o //
translated: “ I have taught that the person is nothing at all” refers to the teaching of the selflessness of the person.

original: rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag med pa gnyis cig car bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag med pa gnyis cig car bstan te /
translated: “ Because of being completely devoid of creation” and so on teaches the two kinds of selflessness simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa las phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir sngon kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa las phyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because phenomena of affliction and purification are free from the activity of apprehended object and apprehending subject, they are not previously afflicted and later purified.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes states:

original: sems can dang chos gnyi ga yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can dang chos gnyi ga yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because neither sentient beings nor phenomena exist, neither the nature of affliction nor purification exists.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gnyi ga dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i don gnyi ga dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because neither the meaning of affliction nor purification is observed.

original: de las kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Affliction is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Suffering and its all-pervasive origination.

original: rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Purification is as follows:

original: 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: Cessation and the path.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas brtags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun nas brtags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Or else, the imagined is the imagined of the defilement class, and the relative is the relative of the defilement class.

original: rnam par byang ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni /
translated: Purification is

original: @159a * // rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa nyid do //🔽yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo rnam par byang ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: @159a * // rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa nyid do // yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo rnam par byang ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: the relative of the purification class and the perfected.🔽Or else, defilement is threefold: defilement by moral defilement, by action, and by rebirth. Purification is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gnas ngan len gyi lus la chos dang gang zag gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas dmigs par byas pa'i phyir bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pas
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams gnas ngan len gyi lus la chos dang gang zag gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la mngon par zhen pa'i bag la nyal yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas dmigs par byas pa'i phyir bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pas
translated: The latent impressions of the notional attachment to the self and to what pertains to the self, which are due to the notional attachment to the self and to what pertains to the self in regard to the personality aggregates, etc. that are subject to the impurity of moral defilement and action, are the cause of the notional attachment to the self and to what pertains to the self.

original: na yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag gis mthong ngo //🔽bdag gis thos so //
analyzed: na yang dag pa ma yin pas bdag gis mthong ngo // bdag gis thos so //
translated: But because of the unreal, one thinks, I see,🔽I hear,🔽I smell,

original: bdag gis bsnams so //
analyzed: bdag gis bsnams so //
translated: I taste,

original: bdag gis reg go //
analyzed: bdag gis reg go //
translated: I touch,

original: bdag gis rnam par shes so //
analyzed: bdag gis rnam par shes so //
translated: I know,

original: bdag gis zos so //
analyzed: bdag gis zos so //
translated: I eat,

original: bdag gis byas so //
analyzed: bdag gis byas so //
translated: I do,

original: bdag kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: bdag kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: I am defiled,

original: bdag rnam par byang ngo zhes 'di lta bu la sogs pa log pa'i sbyor ba 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kun du rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag rnam par byang ngo zhes 'di lta bu la sogs pa log pa'i sbyor ba 'jug go zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kun du rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: I am purified. Thus, one engages in false practice. This is the second teaching of the disadvantage of grasping through delusion.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya bas ni rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i gang zag bstan te /
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya bas ni rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i gang zag bstan te /
translated: Among them, foolish ordinary beings teaches the person who grasps through delusion.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya bas ni lta ba tha dad pa 'dzin pa las skyes pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya bas ni lta ba tha dad pa 'dzin pa las skyes pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of grasping different views, they are called ordinary beings.

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus zhes bya bas ni rmongs pa'i yul bstan te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus zhes bya bas ni rmongs pa'i yul bstan te /
translated: The phrase body of negative propensities teaches the object of delusion.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga dag sgrib pa gnyis po dag gis mngon par bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga dag sgrib pa gnyis po dag gis mngon par bsgrubs shing /
translated: The five contaminated aggregates are fully established by the two obscurations.

original: gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang bas na gnas ngan len gyi lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang bas na gnas ngan len gyi lus zhes bya'o //
translated: The five contaminated aggregates are called “the body of propensities” because they are fully developed by the two obstructions and because they are followed by propensities.

original: chos dang gang zag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya bas ni 'dzin pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya bas ni 'dzin pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “attachment to the individual and phenomenal selves” indicates the two apprehensions.

original: 'di ltar gnas ngan len gyi lus la chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa dang / gang zag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi mngon par zhen pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa gnyis zhes bya'o ;🔽/ bag la nyal yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas dmigs pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas ngan len gyi lus la chos kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi mngon par zhen pa bskyed pa dang / gang zag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi mngon par zhen pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa gnyis zhes bya'o ; / bag la nyal yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas dmigs pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the generation of attachment to the individual and phenomenal selves in the body of propensities is called the two apprehensions of self and dharmas.

original: bag la nyal ni sa bon gyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ni sa bon gyi rnam grangs te /
translated: The phrase “the object of observation of the latent propensities of unreal views” means that the seeds of the two apprehensions are called “latent propensities.”

original: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi sa bon la bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi sa bon la bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: The seeds of the two graspings are called “latency.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Existence of Representation-Only says:

original: 'dzin pa @159b gnyis kyi bag chags de'i bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa @159b gnyis kyi bag chags de'i bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
translated: The latent tendencies of the two graspings are called “latency.”

original: sems can gyi rjes su 'brang zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag la nyal ba dang / nyes pa rjes su 'phel ba'i phyir bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
