analyzed: sems can gyi rjes su 'brang zhing kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag la nyal ba dang / nyes pa rjes su 'phel ba'i phyir bag la nyal zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “latency” because they follow sentient beings, they are latencies of the foundation consciousness, and they increase faults.

original: 'di ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yin te /
translated: They are the seeds of the obscurations of the knowable and of affliction.

original: kun du 'byung ba de dag la ltos na bdag dang / chos su 'dzin pa gnyis yongs su bsgo bar byed pas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba de dag la ltos na bdag dang / chos su 'dzin pa gnyis yongs su bsgo bar byed pas so zhes bshad do //
translated: Because they are the seeds of the two graspings of self and phenomena, they are called “latency.”

original: bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma'i kun du 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi stobs kyis tshe 'di la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gir 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma'i kun du 'byung ba'i sa bon gyi stobs kyis tshe 'di la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par byed la /
translated: The line “Grasping at self and self-entity” and so on means that through the power of the seeds of the former arising, in this life one grasps at self and self-entity.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir ni bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir ni bdag gis mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because of the apprehension of “I” and “mine,” one thinks, “I see,” and so on,

original: bdag gis bdag rnam par byang ngo zhes de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i bar du byed par 'gyur ba'o /🔽// / bam po bdun cu bzhi pa /🔽gang la las de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi lus rab tu spang zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas ma yin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa spros pa rnams dang bral ba /
analyzed: bdag gis bdag rnam par byang ngo zhes de lta bu la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i bar du byed par 'gyur ba'o / // / bam po bdun cu bzhi pa / gang la las de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi lus rab tu spang zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnas ma yin pa shin tu rnam par dag pa spros pa rnams dang bral ba /
translated: up to “I purify myself.”

original: 'dus ma byas gnas su gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gnas su gyur pa /
translated: One who knows this as it really is abandons the body of negative tendencies and attains the state that is not the abode of any afflictions, which is utterly pure, free from elaborations,🔽the unconditioned, and effortless.

original: rtsol ba med pa 'thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gsum pa khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa 'thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gsum pa khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the third benefit of understanding.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa de ltar sems can dang / chos stong pa nyid gnyis rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa de ltar sems can dang / chos stong pa nyid gnyis rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: The phrase one should know them as they are in reality means that one should know the emptiness of sentient beings and the emptiness of phenomena, as they were explained above.

original: stong pa nyid gnyis kyi don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir phan yon thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gnyis kyi don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir phan yon thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because one knows the meaning of the two kinds of emptiness as it really is, one obtains the benefit.

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus rab tu spong zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad ni gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa nye bar hi bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus rab tu spong zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad ni gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa nye bar hi bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase one abandons the body of negative propensities and all the defilements are not its basis means that one applies oneself to the pacification of suffering and the pacification of the defilements, respectively.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni rab tu zhi ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa de'i ngo bo nyid ni rab tu zhi ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, Nirvāṇa is the pacification of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal mang po thams cad gtan du nye bar zhi ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan du nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po thams cad gtan du nye bar zhi ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan du nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because all the many kinds of suffering are completely extinguished forever, and because all the afflictions are completely extinguished forever.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang srid phyi ma'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang srid phyi ma'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs yongs su spangs nas /
translated: “In the future, it completely abandons the various kinds of suffering of future lives.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can thob pa'i @160a * //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can thob pa'i @160a * //
translated: In the future, it obtains the quality of not being born again.

original: phyir sdug bsngal mang po zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir sdug bsngal mang po zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the pacification of the many kinds of suffering.🔽Having completely abandoned all the afflictions, it finally obtains the quality of not being born again.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan du spangs nas mthar mi skye ba'i chos can thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan du spangs nas mthar mi skye ba'i chos can thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the pacification of the afflictions.”

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa spros pa rnams dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa gnas 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa spros pa rnams dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa gnas 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: “Extremely pure and free from conceptual elaboration” is the characteristic of nirvāṇa as the transformation of the support.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says,

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gyur pa mtshan nyid ci lta bur brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gyur pa mtshan nyid ci lta bur brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is the defining characteristic of the transformation that is the nirvana without remainder?”

original: smras pa / spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said, “The defining characteristic of the absence of elaborations and the defining characteristic of complete purity.”

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The defining characteristic of nirvana is this:

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: The defining characteristic of peace and the defining characteristic of the absence of elaborations.

original: nang gi so sor rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nang gi so sor rang gi rig pa'i mtshan nyid kho na yin par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It should be understood that it is only the defining characteristic of the inner individual self-knowing awareness.

original: 'dus ma byas gnas su gyur pa rtsol ba med pa thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gnas su gyur pa rtsol ba med pa thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The phrase “you will effortlessly attain the state of the unconditioned” means that you will attain the unconditioned body of truth.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Explanation of the “Treasury of Abhidharma” says:

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sku la gnas pa las rtsol ba'i 'bad pa mi mnga' yang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i chos kyi sku la gnas pa las rtsol ba'i 'bad pa mi mnga' yang /
translated: Although the dharmakāya, which is unconditioned, does not make effort or strive to abide,

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad de /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mdzad de /
translated: it acts for the welfare of sentient beings through the power of its previous aspirations.

original: dper na rnal 'byor pa dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dper na rnal 'byor pa dag 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba bzhin no zhes bshad do //
translated: For example, it is like the yogi who arises from the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gal te lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la sgrib pa med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gal te lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la sgrib pa med de /
translated: Moreover, the Yogācāryābhūmi Śāstra says, “If the dhātu of nirvāṇa without remainder is free of obscurations,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la sgrib pa mi mnga' ba de kho na bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la sgrib pa mi mnga' ba de kho na bzhin du /
translated: then just as the Tathāgata is free of obscurations,

original: dgra bcom pa la yang sgrib pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang sgrib pa med pa yin na /
translated: so too arhats would be free of obscurations.

original: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa yang /
translated: Why then do arhats

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa mi byed ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa mi byed ce na /
translated: not perform the deeds of a tathāgata?”

original: smras pa / sngon smon lam bsgom pa med pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i rigs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa ni ldang ba'i bsam pa med pa kho na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa mi byed do //
analyzed: smras pa / sngon smon lam bsgom pa med pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i rigs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa ni ldang ba'i bsam pa med pa kho na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas na de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa mi byed do //
translated: He said: Because they do not cultivate the aspiration for enlightenment in the past, and because they are not of that kind, the arhats are without the aspiration to rise up, and so they do not perform the deeds of the buddhas.

original: gang gi tshe spros pa med pa'i dbyings de gang gi grangs su yang 'gro @160b pa yin na ci ltar mngon du byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spros pa med pa'i dbyings de gang gi grangs su yang 'gro @160b pa yin na ci ltar mngon du byed ce na /
translated: When that sphere of non-elaboration is counted as what, how is it realized?

original: smras pa / sngon yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / lam de lta bu bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sngon yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / lam de lta bu bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: He said: By the power of cultivating the aspiration for enlightenment and the path in the past, it is like this.

original: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang bar bya'o //
translated: For example, one who has entered the absorption of cessation thinks, “I will rise up from the absorption,”

original: ldang ngo snyam du de ltar sems med kyang sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis langs nas yang sems dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la spyod par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ldang ngo snyam du de ltar sems med kyang sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis langs nas yang sems dang bcas pa'i spyod pa la spyod par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: and although there is no such thought, by the power of previous impetus, one rises up and again engages in conduct with a mind.

original: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This should be understood in the same way.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The noble Golden Light Sutra also teaches in a similar way, in terms of the meaning, to what is taught in this sutra.🔽Son of noble family, this is called the brief teaching on the meaning of the uncommon dhāraṇī.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don mdor bstan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i gzungs kyi don mdor bstan pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug bsdu ba ste brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is the second general conclusion, which is merely for the sake of communication.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pas bzlas te bshad pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: Then the Blessed One also spoke these verses. From here on is the second explanation by way of verses, which is called the repetition.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis yang dag par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis yang dag par bshad pa ste /
translated: the introduction by way of verses and the correct explanation by way of verses.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang ba'i chos //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par byang ba'i chos //
translated: The dharmas of affliction and purification

original: thams cad byed pa med cing gang zag med //
analyzed: thams cad byed pa med cing gang zag med //
translated: All are devoid of agent and person.

original: des ni nga yis byed dang bral bar bshad //
analyzed: des ni nga yis byed dang bral bar bshad //
translated: Thus I have explained the absence of agent.

original: de dag kun nas nyon mongs snga phyi min //
analyzed: de dag kun nas nyon mongs snga phyi min //
translated: They are not afflicted by prior or subsequent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa tshigs su bcad pa nyid kyis yang dag par bshad pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the second half of the verse teaches the correct explanation.

original: 'di yang tshigs su bcad pa gsum po yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang tshigs su bcad pa gsum po yod pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts by the three verses.

original: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni yang dag pa'i rigs pa rnams bzlas so //
analyzed: 'di la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni yang dag pa'i rigs pa rnams bzlas so //
translated: In this regard, the first verse repeats the correct reasons.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bar mas ni rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs rnams zlos so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bar mas ni rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs rnams zlos so //
translated: The middle verse repeats the disadvantages of grasping through delusion.

original: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad ni khong du chud pa'i yon tan zlos pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa thams cad ni khong du chud pa'i yon tan zlos pa yin te /
translated: The last verse repeats the advantages of understanding.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This statement of the sūtra is also twofold.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang pos ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang pos ni /
translated: The first half of the verse

original: gang zag stong pa nyid kyi tshul ston to //
analyzed: gang zag stong pa nyid kyi tshul ston to //
translated: teaches the method of the emptiness of persons.

original: tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas ni chos stong pa nyid kyi tshul ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas ni chos stong pa nyid kyi tshul ston to //
translated: The second half of the verse shows the way of the emptiness of things.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na mdo'i tshig 'di ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /🔽tshig dang po gcig gis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @161a * //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na mdo'i tshig 'di ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste / tshig dang po gcig gis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @161a * //
translated: Another explanation of the verse: the words of the sutra are divided into three parts.🔽The first word generally shows the dharmas of defilement and

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos spyir ston to //🔽de'i 'og ma gcig gis ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis rnam par phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos spyir ston to // de'i 'og ma gcig gis ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis rnam par phye ste bstan to //
translated: purification.🔽The next word analyzes and shows the two kinds of emptiness.

original: tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis cig car bstan te /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma gnyis kyis ni stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis cig car bstan te /
translated: The last two words show the two kinds of emptiness together.

original: tshig rkyang pa dang sbyar ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs su bya'o ;
analyzed: tshig rkyang pa dang sbyar ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du ci rigs su bya'o ;
translated: The application of the single words is as shown above, as appropriate.

original: / gnas ngan len lus bag la nyal ldang bas //
analyzed: / gnas ngan len lus bag la nyal ldang bas //
translated: The body of negative reflex actions, the lying latent within,

original: dmigs pa byas pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin //
analyzed: dmigs pa byas pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin //
translated: The objective realm is made, and one grasps at “I” and “mine.”

original: des na brdzun du bdag gis mthong stsogs dang // bdag za'o byed dang nyon mongs rnam dag snyom //
analyzed: des na brdzun du bdag gis mthong stsogs dang // bdag za'o byed dang nyon mongs rnam dag snyom //
translated: Therefore, I see falsely, etc., and I eat, and I act, and I am purified of the passions.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bsten to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rmongs pas 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs bsten to //
translated: This is the second, the danger of grasping through delusion.

original: gang gis yang dag ci bzhin rab shes pa //
analyzed: gang gis yang dag ci bzhin rab shes pa //
translated: One who knows reality as it is

original: gnas ngan len gyi lus ni spong byed cing //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi lus ni spong byed cing //
translated: abandons the body of negative propensities,🔽and attains the unconditioned, the unelaborated purity of affliction,

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag spros med dang // 'dus ma byas rnams rtsol pa med pas 'thob //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag spros med dang // 'dus ma byas rnams rtsol pa med pas 'thob //
translated: without effort.

original: ces bya ba ni gsum pa khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gsum pa khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the third, the benefit of understanding.

original: tshig rkang pa dang po ni mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do ;
analyzed: tshig rkang pa dang po ni mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do ;
translated: The first line is merely a salutation with this very sutra.

original: / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva Manjushri also said to the bhagavat:🔽Bhagavat, how should the characteristics of the arising of the tathagatas' minds be known?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ji lta bur rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: From here onward is the second, the teaching on the characteristics of the tathagatas' sambhogakaya.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bdun du dbye ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag par longs spyad pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan yid bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa dang /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bdun du dbye ste / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag par longs spyad pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan yid bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa dang /
translated: This is also divided into seven topics.🔽The first is the teaching of the characteristics of the arising of the mind of the Tathāgata’s body of perfect enjoyment, the second is the teaching of the characteristics of the distinctions of the Tathāgata’s domain, the third is the teaching of the characteristics of the nonduality of the three aspects such as manifest complete enlightenment,🔽the fourth is the teaching of the distinctions of the Tathāgata’s activity for sentient beings, the fifth is the teaching of the distinctions of the Tathāgata’s body of attributes and the body of liberation of the two vehicles, the sixth is the teaching of the Tathāgata’s body of sentient beings through the power of the Tathāgata’s and bodhisattvas’ blessings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa mdzad pa'i bye brag bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis rlabs kyi mthus sems can gyi lus yongs su 'dzin par bstan pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa mdzad pa'i bye brag bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi bye brag bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyis rlabs kyi mthus sems can gyi lus yongs su 'dzin par bstan pa dang /
translated: and the seventh is the teaching of the Tathāgata’s body of attributes through the power of the Tathāgata’s and bodhisattvas’ blessings.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa na dngos po gang dag rnyed dka' ba dang / gang dag yod pa'i mtshan @161b nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su ma dag pa na dngos po gang dag rnyed dka' ba dang / gang dag yod pa'i mtshan @161b nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the entities that are difficult to obtain in a completely pure or impure realm, and that exist, are taught.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also twofold:

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / sprul pa'i sku la sems mnga' ba'am mi mnga' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / sprul pa'i sku la sems mnga' ba'am mi mnga' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the correct teaching of the characteristics of the mental factors of the enjoyment body, and the teaching of whether or not the emanation body possesses mind.

original: dang po yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into four parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang / bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang / bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: the request, the response, the teaching, and the explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sems 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first request for the characteristics of the mental factors of the enjoyment body.

original: 'dis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that this teaches the enjoyment body?

original: smras pa / de'i 'og tu sprul pa'i sems mnga' ba yang yin mi mnga' ba yang yin par ston pa'i phyir 'dir sems bstan pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / de'i 'og tu sprul pa'i sems mnga' ba yang yin mi mnga' ba yang yin par ston pa'i phyir 'dir sems bstan pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ston pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In order to show that the Tathāgata is both possessed of a mind of emanation and not possessed of such a mind, the teaching of mind here should be understood to show the Enjoyment Body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas rab tu phye ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas rab tu phye ba yin mod kyi /
translated: “Son of good family, the Tathāgata is indeed distinguished by mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems kyi chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems kyi chos 'byung ste /
translated: Nevertheless, the dharmas of the mind arise in the Tathāgatas without effort.

original: dngos po 'di ni sprul pa lta bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'di ni sprul pa lta bur rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This matter should be understood to be like an emanation.” This is the second correct answer of the Tathāgata.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This statement of the sūtra also has two parts:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems dang yid dang ; rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtsol ba mi mnga' bar bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la rtsol ba mi mnga' bar yang sems kyi chos 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems dang yid dang ; rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtsol ba mi mnga' bar bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la rtsol ba mi mnga' bar yang sems kyi chos 'byung bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is shown to be free from the effort of the discrimination of mind, thought, and consciousness, and the Tathāgata is shown to be free from effort in the arising of the Dharma of mind.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i don de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i don de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of mind, thought, and consciousness is also twofold:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The mind with-outflows is also twofold:

original: dang po ni bye brag gi ming du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni bye brag gi ming du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The first is the specific names for mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The store consciousness is called mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid ces bya'o //
translated: The defiled mind is called thought.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses are called consciousness.

original: gnyis pa ni spyi'i ming du rnam par shes pa brgyad po thams cad kyang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spyi'i ming du rnam par shes pa brgyad po thams cad kyang sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The second is the general name, since all eight consciousnesses are called mind, mentality, and consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /🔽'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo de dang de dag tu sems dang yid @162a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las / 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo de dang de dag tu sems dang yid @162a * //
translated: Thus the treatise Establishing the Existence of Mind-Only says:

original: dang rnam par shes pa gsum po dag gi don tha dad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dang rnam par shes pa gsum po dag gi don tha dad pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus the Bhagavat taught the distinct meanings of the three terms mind, mentality, and consciousness in various sūtras.

original: bsags pa las byung bas na sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsags pa las byung bas na sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is a collection, it is called mind.

original: sems pas na yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems pas na yid ces bya'o //
translated: Since it thinks, it is called mentality.

original: rnam par rig pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is aware, it is called consciousness.

original: don rnam pa gsum po de dag rnam par shes pa brgyad po kun la khyab pa yin yang gtso bo'i rjes su byas te /🔽bstan nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum po de dag rnam par shes pa brgyad po kun la khyab pa yin yang gtso bo'i rjes su byas te / bstan nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya ste /
translated: Although these three meanings pervade all eight consciousnesses, they are taught in terms of their principal attributes.

original: sa bon rnams bstsags nas chos rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon rnams bstsags nas chos rnams 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foundation consciousness is called mind because it is the collection of all seeds and it generates all phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid ces bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni yid ces bya ste /
translated: The defiled mind is called manas.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la dmigs shing rtag par nges par bdag la sogs par sems pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan drug po dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la dmigs shing rtag par nges par bdag la sogs par sems pa'i phyir ro // gzhan drug po dag ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called manas because it always focuses on the store consciousness and thinks of it as a self.

original: rigs pa g-yo ba bar chad dang bcas pa nyid rnam par rig pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa g-yo ba bar chad dang bcas pa nyid rnam par rig pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The other six are called consciousnesses because they are discriminating, unstable, and interrupted.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: The Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra says,

original: kun gzhi la ni sems zhes bya //
analyzed: kun gzhi la ni sems zhes bya //
translated: The store consciousness is called mind;

original: sems pa'i bdag nyid yid ces bya //
analyzed: sems pa'i bdag nyid yid ces bya //
translated: The thinking self is called manas;

original: yul gyi mtshan nyid rnam rig pa //
analyzed: yul gyi mtshan nyid rnam rig pa //
translated: The discrimination of the characteristics of objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bstan //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bstan // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Is taught to be consciousness.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: Also, the Tathāgataguhya Sūtra says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dri ma med pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The stainless consciousness of the Tathāgata.

original: ched 'ga' ni mdo las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni mdo las 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid ces gsungs so //
translated: Sometimes the sutra speaks of a supramundane mind.

original: ched 'ga' ni sems zhes bya ba'i ming gnas skabs thams cad rtogs par gsungs pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni sems zhes bya ba'i ming gnas skabs thams cad rtogs par gsungs pas de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs kyang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sometimes the sutra speaks of the term mind in all its states. Therefore, the state of the buddha stage is also called consciousness and so on.

original: mdo 'di las ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni zag pa dang bcas pa rnam par rtog pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this sutra, the Buddha spoke from the perspective of the defiled mind, thought, and consciousness that have conceptualization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas rab tu phye ba ma yin zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pas rab tu phye ba ma yin zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: The sutra says, “The Tathagata is not distinguished by mind, thought, and consciousness.”

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not say that he is not distinguished by uncontaminated mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: chos bsdus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos bsdus pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra on the Compendium of the Teachings says:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i sems so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i sems so zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Mind, thought, and consciousness are the conceptual mind.”

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos byang chub kyi tshogs bstan pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos byang chub kyi tshogs bstan pa las /
translated: says,

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba @162b ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba @162b ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “Mind, thought, and consciousness are called the conceptualizer that grasps signs.”

original: de la 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems kyi chos 'byung ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i yid la byed par mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: de la 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtsol ba mi mnga' bar sems kyi chos 'byung ste zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i yid la byed par mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: Here, the phrase “but the dharmas of the mind arise effortlessly in the Tathāgatas” shows that the Tathāgatas do not have conceptual mental activity.

original: sngon gyi rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi stobs kyis rtsol ba mi mnga' bar yang sems kyi chos 'byung ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi stobs kyis rtsol ba mi mnga' bar yang sems kyi chos 'byung ste /
translated: However, the dharmas of the mind arise effortlessly through the power of their previous wisdom.

original: dper na sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like emanations.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis phyir ni thugs la dgongs pa bzhin du mngon du 'gyur zhing yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis phyir ni thugs la dgongs pa bzhin du mngon du 'gyur zhing yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: They arise effortlessly through the power of their previous wisdom, but they do not arise through the power of present mental activity.

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na yid la byed pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa na yid la byed pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: Another explanation is that when he enters right concentration, he does not have to apply his mind.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i mdun rol na yid la byas pa'i stobs kyis sprul pa ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i mdun rol na yid la byas pa'i stobs kyis sprul pa ston par mdzad do //
translated: But by the power of his mental attention in the past, he manifests emanations in the future.

original: 'di yang de bzhin te rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi stobs kyis sems kyi chos 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin te rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi shes rab kyi stobs kyis sems kyi chos 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is also like that, for by the power of his wisdom in the causal period, the Dharma of mind is born.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /🔽bcom ldan 'das gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mdzad par gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las / bcom ldan 'das gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mdzad par gyur /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary to the Mahayana-samgraha, the Bodhisattva-bhumi, and the Bodhisattvas’ commentaries on the Madhyamakavatara, it says:

original: mdzad par 'gyur /🔽mdzad mod kyi /
analyzed: mdzad par 'gyur / mdzad mod kyi /
translated: The Lord has acted, will act, and does act for the sake of helping others.

original: dus gsum po dag tu /🔽mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' la /
analyzed: dus gsum po dag tu / mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' la /
translated: But in the three times🔽he has no intention of acting,

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' yang phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' yang phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: and although he does not act, the activity of helping others is accomplished.

original: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / lha'i rnga la yid la byed pa med kyang bya ba'i dngos po rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / lha'i rnga la yid la byed pa med kyang bya ba'i dngos po rnams mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bshad do //
translated: For example, it is like the wish-fulfilling gem and the divine drum, which are not mentally fabricated, yet the things that are to be done are accomplished.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa las /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary to the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by the master *Asvabhāva, it says:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgoms pa las mngon par 'grub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bsgoms pa las mngon par 'grub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: “If the result of buddhahood, which is accomplished through the cultivation of nonconceptual wisdom, is nonconceptual,

original: ji ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mdzad ce na /
translated: how does it perform the activity of benefiting sentient beings?

original: yid bzhin nor bu dang ni lha yi rnga //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu dang ni lha yi rnga //
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling gem and the divine drum

original: bsam med rang gi bya ba 'grub pa ltar //
analyzed: bsam med rang gi bya ba 'grub pa ltar //
translated: accomplish their own activity without thought,

original: sangs rgyas mdzad pa sna tshogs grub gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mdzad pa sna tshogs grub gyur kyang //
translated: so it is that the various activities of the buddhas are accomplished

original: rtag par dgongs pa mi mnga' de bzhin no //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag par dgongs pa mi mnga' de bzhin no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: without their ever having any thought.🔽”

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to this says:

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las yid bzhin nor bu dang / lha'i rnga'i dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis ni rnam par mi rtog @163a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las yid bzhin nor bu dang / lha'i rnga'i dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis ni rnam par mi rtog @163a * //
translated: In this verse, the two examples of the wish-fulfilling gem and the divine drum show that, having attained nonconceptual gnosis, without any deliberate effort, various activities are accomplished.

original: pa'i ye shes brnyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtsol ba mi mnga' yang mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / lha'i rnga la 'di snyam du /
analyzed: pa'i ye shes brnyes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtsol ba mi mnga' yang mdzad pa rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub pa ni dper na yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / lha'i rnga la 'di snyam du /
translated: For example, the wish-fulfilling gem and the divine drum have no thought such as🔽I will emit light

original: bdag gis 'od 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis 'od 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: I will emit sound🔽but in accordance with the power of beings’ merit and karma, whatever they wish for, various lights are emitted and various sounds are heard, without any regard for whether they are beaten or not.

original: bdag gis sgra dbyung ngo snyam pa'i bsam pa med kyang sems can de dag gi bsod nams kyi las kyi mos pa'i mthu ci lta ba dang / brdung ba la mi ltos par yang 'od sna tshogs gtong zhing sgra sna tshogs 'byung ba ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bdag gis sgra dbyung ngo snyam pa'i bsam pa med kyang sems can de dag gi bsod nams kyi las kyi mos pa'i mthu ci lta ba dang / brdung ba la mi ltos par yang 'od sna tshogs gtong zhing sgra sna tshogs 'byung ba ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, the buddhas, without any deliberate effort, accomplish various activities for the sake of sentient beings, in accordance with their aspirations.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rtsol ba dang bral ba yin yang gdul ba'i sems can de dag gi bsod nams kyi mos pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs ston to zhes mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rtsol ba dang bral ba yin yang gdul ba'i sems can de dag gi bsod nams kyi mos pa'i stobs ji lta ba bzhin du phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs ston to zhes mngon par bsgrubs pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Although it is free from the effort of conceptualization, it displays various things that benefit in accordance with the power of the merit and aspiration of those sentient beings to be trained.🔽This is established.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba'i 'grel ba las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba'i 'grel ba las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: This is taught in the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu and in the commentary by Langali.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Manjushri again said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku mngon par 'du bgyi ba thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku mngon par 'du bgyi ba thams cad dang bral te /
translated: Blessed One, if the dharmakaya of the Tathagatas is free from all activity

original: rtsol ba ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: rtsol ba ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: and without effort,

original: 'o na ci ltar sems can gyi chos 'byung bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar sems can gyi chos 'byung bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa brtag pa'o //
translated: how then do the dharmas of sentient beings arise? This is the third investigation.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The so-called dharmakāya is also explained in two ways.

original: kha cig na re longs spyod rdzogs pa ni chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re longs spyod rdzogs pa ni chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
translated: Some say that the enjoyment body is called the dharmakāya.

original: 'dis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku la mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' yang /
analyzed: 'dis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku la mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' yang /
translated: This is because the enjoyment body does not have the intention of manifest composition,

original: sems 'byung ba yin na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pas de'i phyir zhu ba 'di zhus pa yin te /
analyzed: sems 'byung ba yin na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pas de'i phyir zhu ba 'di zhus pa yin te /
translated: but if the mind arises, how can the Tathāgata, who does not have a different intention, generate the mind included in the enjoyment body? Therefore, this question is asked.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: How

original: yid la byed pa med pa yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhes zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med pa yang sems skye bar 'gyur zhes zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: can the mind arise without mental activity?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gi phyir sems 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gi phyir sems 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bzhi pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: Son of noble family, the mind arises by the power of previously cultivating method and wisdom, and so forth. This teaches the fourth [topic].

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This also has three parts:

original: don nyid yang dag @163b par bstan pa dang / dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don nyid yang dag @163b par bstan pa dang / dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the correct teaching of the meaning, the illustration through an example, and the application of the example to the meaning.

original: 'di ni don yang dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni don yang dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the correct teaching of the meaning.

original: 'di ltar sa bcu po dag tu shes rab dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang sems skye bar 'gyur bas so //🔽de la mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / rjes las thob pa gsum po dag spyir mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu po dag tu shes rab dang / mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis dgongs pa mi mnga' bar yang sems skye bar 'gyur bas so // de la mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / rjes las thob pa gsum po dag spyir mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, on the ten grounds, the mind arises without intention by the power of wisdom and manifest activity.

original: 'bad pa'i rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa'i rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, manifest activity refers to the three: application in the state of cause, correct knowledge, and post-attainment. In general, they are called manifest activity because they are accompanied by the exertion of effort.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: sngon shes rab bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon shes rab bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of previously cultivating wisdom.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Elaborations of the Profoundly Intended Meaning says:

original: sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of previously cultivating method and wisdom, they arise naturally.

original: rigs kyi bu dper na gnyid log pa sems med pa las sad pa na mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis sad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dpe nye bar mtshon pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na gnyid log pa sems med pa las sad pa na mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i stobs kyis sad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dpe nye bar mtshon pa ston to //
translated: Son of noble family, for example, when you wake up from sleep, you do not need to make an effort to wake up, but you do wake up by the power of having gone to sleep.

original: 'di yang dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa las 'di ni dpe dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di yang dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa las 'di ni dpe dang po ste /
translated: This second example illustrates the second analogy.

original: 'di ltar sems med pa'i gnyid kyi gnas skabs na phyis sad par bya'o zhes mngon par 'dus byas pa med kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems med pa'i gnyid kyi gnas skabs na phyis sad par bya'o zhes mngon par 'dus byas pa med kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gi phyir te /
translated: In this way, when you are in a state of sleep that lacks mental activity, you do not need to make an effort to think, I will wake up later, but you do wake up by the power of your previous mind.

original: gnyid ma log pa'i mdun rol du bdag phyis ldang bar bya'o zhes mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis sad pa'i sems skye ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyid ma log pa'i mdun rol du bdag phyis ldang bar bya'o zhes mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis sad pa'i sems skye ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one has gone to sleep with the thought I will awaken later, the mind of awakening arises due to the force of that prior mental activity.

original: 'gog pa la snyom par zhugs pa ldang bar mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gi stobs kyis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyom par zhugs pa ldang bar mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gi stobs kyis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa bstan pa'o //
translated: When one arises from meditative attainment of cessation, one arises from concentration due to the force of prior mental activity, even though one does not have the mental activity of I will arise.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ngo snyam pa'i mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ngo snyam pa'i mngon par 'du bya ba med kyang sems snga ma'i dbang gi phyir te /
translated: This is the second example.🔽For example, when one arises from meditative attainment of cessation, one arises from concentration due to the force of the prior mind, even though one does not have the mental activity of I will arise.

original: 'di ltar 'gog pa la ma zhugs pa'i sngon rol na bdag phyis ldang bar bya'o snyam du mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gog pa la ma zhugs pa'i sngon rol na bdag phyis ldang bar bya'o snyam du mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, when one has not previously entered meditative attainment of cessation, one arises from concentration due to the force of the prior mental activity of I will arise later.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /🔽ji skad du /
translated: The Great Exegesis declares:

original: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus ji srid du gnas she na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus ji srid du gnas she na /
translated: How long does one remain in meditative attainment on the cessation of the āryas?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi dbang @164a * //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can gyi dbang @164a * //
translated: The faculties of sentient beings of the desire realm endure due to the power of oral food.🔽When those who remain for a long time in meditative attainment,

original: po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po ni kham gyi zas kyi dbang gis gnas pas ting nge 'dzin la yun ring du gnas pa dag gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po ni kham gyi zas kyi dbang gis gnas pas ting nge 'dzin la yun ring du gnas pa dag gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: their bodies do not deteriorate while they remain in meditative attainment.

original: lus la nyams pa med kyang ting nge 'dzin las langs pa na lus 'jig par 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa dus yun mi ring ba zhig tu gnas pa kho na yin pas de ltar yun ring na yang nyin zhag bdun las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: lus la nyams pa med kyang ting nge 'dzin las langs pa na lus 'jig par 'gyur te / de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa dus yun mi ring ba zhig tu gnas pa kho na yin pas de ltar yun ring na yang nyin zhag bdun las mi 'da' ste /
translated: But when they arise from meditative attainment, their bodies disintegrate.🔽Therefore, those who remain in this meditative attainment remain for only a short time.

original: kham gyi zas zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyi zas zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they remain for a long time, they do not remain for more than seven days because their oral food is exhausted.

original: 'di ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do you know this?

original: kun dga' ra ba zhig na dge slong cig 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas snga dro'i dus kyi chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs nas dge 'dun gyi bkad sar song ba las /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba zhig na dge slong cig 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas snga dro'i dus kyi chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs nas dge 'dun gyi bkad sar song ba las /
translated: In a monastery a monk had attained the samadhi of the absorption of cessation. In the morning he put on his robes, took his bowl, and went to the assembly hall of the Sangha.

original: de'i nyin par gand'i brdung ba dang sbyar ba dag cung zad cig thogs pa dang / dge slong de yang brtson 'grus can zhig pas 'di snyam du bdag gis ci ste dge ba mi spyod par dus zad par byed ces phyi ma'i mtha' la mi rtog par bdag gis nam gand'i brdung ba na gdod ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog pa la
analyzed: de'i nyin par gand'i brdung ba dang sbyar ba dag cung zad cig thogs pa dang / dge slong de yang brtson 'grus can zhig pas 'di snyam du bdag gis ci ste dge ba mi spyod par dus zad par byed ces phyi ma'i mtha' la mi rtog par bdag gis nam gand'i brdung ba na gdod ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog pa la
translated: On that day the striking of the gavel was delayed a little. Since that monk was also diligent, he thought, “Why should I waste time not practicing virtue?” Without considering the future, he made a vow, “When the gavel is struck, I will arise.”

original: snyoms par zhugs so /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs so /
translated: Then he entered the absorption of cessation.

original: de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba der bar chad kyi rkyen byung bas dge slong rnams so sor gyis nas gnas gzhan du dong ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba der bar chad kyi rkyen byung bas dge slong rnams so sor gyis nas gnas gzhan du dong ngo //
translated: At that time, because of an obstacle, the monks of the Sangha left the monastery and went to another place.

original: zla ba gsum 'das te bar chad kyi rkyen zhi nas dge slong rnams slar kun dga' ra bar 'dus te gand'i brdungs ma thag tu dge slong de ting nge 'dzin las langs nas dus las 'das so zhes grag go //
analyzed: zla ba gsum 'das te bar chad kyi rkyen zhi nas dge slong rnams slar kun dga' ra bar 'dus te gand'i brdungs ma thag tu dge slong de ting nge 'dzin las langs nas dus las 'das so zhes grag go //
translated: After three months, the conditions for the obstacle were pacified. The monks gathered again in the monastery and immediately after the gavel was struck, the monk rose from meditative attainment and died.

original: gzhan yang dge slong 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rtag par bsod snyoms slong ba zhig snga dro'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rtag par bsod snyoms slong ba zhig snga dro'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: Also, there was a monk who obtained meditative attainment of cessation and always went for alms in the morning.

original: chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs nas grong khyer du 'gro bar byas pa las char chen po bab pas gos kyi kha dog nyams par 'gyur bar dogs nas cung zad cig bsdad pa las /
analyzed: chos gos bgos lhung bzed thogs nas grong khyer du 'gro bar byas pa las char chen po bab pas gos kyi kha dog nyams par 'gyur bar dogs nas cung zad cig bsdad pa las /
translated: He put on his robes, took his alms bowl and went to the city. Because a great rain fell, fearing that the color of his robes would be ruined, he stayed for a while.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag gis dge ba mi spyod par ci'i phyir dus zad par byed ces phyi ma'i mtha' la mi rtog par char pa ma chad kyi bar du snyoms par zhugs lan ma char pa chad pa na gdod ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag gis dge ba mi spyod par ci'i phyir dus zad par byed ces phyi ma'i mtha' la mi rtog par char pa ma chad kyi bar du snyoms par zhugs lan ma char pa chad pa na gdod ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog
translated: He thought, “Why should I let my time expire without engaging in virtue?” He did not consider the future and thought, “I will enter meditative attainment until the rain stops. When the rain stops, I will arise.”

original: pa la snyoms par zhugs so //🔽kha cig na re zla ba phyed lon nas gdod char pa chad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa la snyoms par zhugs so // kha cig na re zla ba phyed lon nas gdod char pa chad do zhes zer ro //
translated: He entered into the concentration of the cloud of the Dharma.🔽Some say that the rain stopped after half a month.

original: kha cig na re zla ba gcig lon nas gdod char pa chad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re zla ba gcig lon nas gdod char pa chad do zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the rain stopped after one month.

original: ting nge 'dzin las langs ma thag tu dus las 'das so zhes grag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las langs ma thag tu dus las 'das so zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that he died immediately after rising from concentration.

original: de @164b nas 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de @164b nas 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Then, when one who is born in the desire realm and is abiding in concentration,🔽at the time of abiding in concentration, his body is impaired.

original: lus la nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa de ni dus yun mi ring ba zhig tu gnas pas /
analyzed: lus la nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa de ni dus yun mi ring ba zhig tu gnas pas /
translated: Because of that, he does not abide for a long time in that concentration.

original: de ltar yun ring na yang nyin zhag bdun las mi 'da' bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yun ring na yang nyin zhag bdun las mi 'da' bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, even if it is long, it should be known that it does not exceed seven days.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi dbang po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po ni kham gyi zad kyi dbang gis gnas shing gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa bskal pa phyed dam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi sems can gyi dbang po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po ni kham gyi zad kyi dbang gis gnas shing gzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa bskal pa phyed dam /
translated: Those abiding in this concentration abide for half an eon,

original: bskal pa gcig gam /
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gam /
translated: one eon,

original: yang na de las lhag par yang gnas so //
analyzed: yang na de las lhag par yang gnas so //
translated: or even longer.

original: gal te dge slong 'ga' zhig dam ma bcas par 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa de ci lta bur ldang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong 'ga' zhig dam ma bcas par 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa de ci lta bur ldang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If a bhikṣu enters the meditative attainment of cessation without having taken a vow, how does he arise?

original: smras pa / chos nyid kyis ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / chos nyid kyis ldang bar 'gyur te /
translated: He arises by the power of reality.🔽Just as he entered meditative attainment with a mind, so he arises from meditative attainment with a mind.

original: sems yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong de bza' ba dang / btung ba 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: sems yod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong de bza' ba dang / btung ba 'dod pa'am /
translated: If he desires food and drink,

original: bshang gci'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bshang gci'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: or if he desires to go to the bathroom,

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: he arises from meditative attainment.

original: gnod pa med kyang langs pa gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen des na gdon mi za bar ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med kyang langs pa gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen des na gdon mi za bar ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Even though there is no harm, since the arising of the mind is harmed, by that cause and condition, it is said that the mind definitely arises.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the commentary to the perfection of wisdom says:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ting nge 'dzin gya nom pa la zhugs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams ting nge 'dzin gya nom pa la zhugs par gyur pa na /
translated: If bodhisattvas enter into a subtle meditative absorption,

original: su zhig slong bar nus she na /
analyzed: su zhig slong bar nus she na /
translated: who can request them?🔽It is said: Yogis first set a time limit and then enter meditative absorption.

original: smras pa / rnal 'byor pa dag dang por 'jug pa na bdag nyid kyis dus kyi tshad byas nas de'i 'og tu gdod ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pas dus la bab na de'i sems rang gi ngang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnal 'byor pa dag dang por 'jug pa na bdag nyid kyis dus kyi tshad byas nas de'i 'og tu gdod ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pas dus la bab na de'i sems rang gi ngang gis ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the time is up, their minds naturally arise from meditative absorption.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong zhig 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na bdag gis gand'i'i sgra thos pa'i tshe ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa las dge 'dun gyi gnas khang du me shor bas dge slong rnams skrag nas gand'i ma brdungs par dong
analyzed: dge slong zhig 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa na bdag gis gand'i'i sgra thos pa'i tshe ldang bar bya'o zhes dam bcas nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa las dge 'dun gyi gnas khang du me shor bas dge slong rnams skrag nas gand'i ma brdungs par dong
translated: When the dwelling place of the saṃgha caught fire, the bhikṣus were frightened and left without snapping their fingers.

original: ngo // lo bcu gcig 'das nas yon bdag rnams kyis dge 'dun bsdus te /
analyzed: ngo // lo bcu gcig 'das nas yon bdag rnams kyis dge 'dun bsdus te /
translated: After eleven years had passed, the benefactors gathered the saṃgha🔽and snapped their fingers in order to rebuild the temple.

original: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i phyir gand'i brdungs pa las des gand'i'i sgra thos te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang brtsig pa'i phyir gand'i brdungs pa las des gand'i'i sgra thos te /
translated: The bhikṣu heard the sound of the finger snap,

original: langs ma thag tu lus zhig nas dus las 'das so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽gnyid log pa dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems @165a * //
analyzed: langs ma thag tu lus zhig nas dus las 'das so zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo // gnyid log pa dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems @165a * //
translated: and as soon as he arose, his body disintegrated and he died.

original: 'byung ba ci lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'byung ba ci lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the mind of one who is asleep and the mind of one who has entered the meditative attainment of cessation are not severed,🔽so too

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis yang sems kyi chos 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang sngon thabs dang shes rab bsgom pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i dbang gis yang sems kyi chos 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ste /
translated: This is the third application of the example and its meaning.

original: ci ltar sems med pa'i gnyis sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis phyis sems 'byung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar sems med pa'i gnyis sngon mngon par 'du byas pa'i dbang gis phyis sems 'byung ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the two, which are without mind, arise through the power of previous full arousing,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang mngon par 'du mdzad pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: so also the Tathagata, although he has no full arousing,

original: sngon rgyu'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dbang gis sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon rgyu'i gnas skabs su mngon par 'du mdzad pa'i dbang gis sems 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: arises through the power of his previous full arousing when he was a cause.🔽Therefore, the Arya Buddha-bhumi-vyakhya says,

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las gzhan yang ye shes dang sprul pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba bsgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed pas kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las gzhan yang ye shes dang sprul pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba bsgrub pa thams cad kyi go 'byed pas kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is also because it makes room for all the accomplishments of wisdom, emanations, and the performance of beings' aims.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad kyi go 'byed ces bya ba ste zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis sems can gyi bya ba bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan thams cad kyi go 'byed ces bya ba ste zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: In the completely pure expanse of reality, all the reasons for the enjoyment and emanation bodies to accomplish the activities of sentient beings are accommodated.

original: gzhan yang de las de'i tshe /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'di ni mdzad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de las de'i tshe / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'di ni mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, at that time,

original: 'di ni mi mdzad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni mi mdzad do snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' mod kyi /
translated: the tathāgatas do not have the conceptual thoughts, “I will do this” or “I will not do that.”

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis bya ba thams cad smon lam bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis bya ba thams cad smon lam bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of their previous aspirations, all their activities are in accordance with their aspirations.

original: dper na gnyid log pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba yid la byed mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na gnyid log pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba yid la byed mod kyi /
translated: For example, although one who is asleep or who has arisen from the meditative attainment of cessation does not think, “I will dream” or “I will arise from meditative attainment,”

original: ci ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du sang cing /
analyzed: ci ltar dam bcas pa bzhin du sang cing /
translated: just as they have committed themselves, they dream and

original: ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur te /
translated: they arise from meditative attainment.

original: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Sāgaranāgarājaparipṛcchā-sūtra says,

original: dper na dge slong gand'i brdungs pa la bab kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs te 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i rna lam du gand'i'i sgra mi grag la rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na dge slong gand'i brdungs pa la bab kyi bar du byin gyis brlabs te 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de'i rna lam du gand'i'i sgra mi grag la rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: For example, it is like the statement that when a monk is about to be struck by a fatal blow, he enters meditative attainment in the state of absorption and does not hear the sound of the fatal blow, nor does he have any thoughts.

original: 'on kyang dam bcas pa'i dbang gis ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dam bcas pa'i dbang gis ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: However, due to the power of his vow, he will arise from that state.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /🔽'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo khungs su bstan pa ni 'phags pa 'dus pa chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las / 'phags pa blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo khungs su bstan pa ni 'phags pa 'dus pa chen po'i mdo las /
translated: This is stated in the commentary to the noble Buddha’s Stages of the Bodhisattva:🔽The noble Sūtra Requested by Sāgaramati is cited as a source in the noble Sūtra of the Great Collection.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rgya mtsho'i le'u zhes bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo gros rgya mtsho'i le'u zhes bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: This is the chapter of the bodhisattva Sāgaramati in the Sūtra of the Great Collection.

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, in that very sūtra it says:

original: rigs kyi bu dper na dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pas sngar bdag gis gand'i brdungs pa'i sgra thos na gdod ldang bar bya'o @165b zhes dam bcas nas snyoms par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na dge slong 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'dod pas sngar bdag gis gand'i brdungs pa'i sgra thos na gdod ldang bar bya'o @165b zhes dam bcas nas snyoms par zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: a monk who wishes to enter the absorption of cessation makes a promise, saying, “I will arise when I hear the sound of a gong being struck.” He then enters into the absorption of cessation.

original: gand'i'i sgra med mod kyi 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis gand'i brdungs pas ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gand'i'i sgra med mod kyi 'on kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis gand'i brdungs pas ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: While he remains in that absorption, there is no sound of a gong. Nevertheless, due to the power of his previous aspiration, he arises from the absorption when the gong is struck.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī then said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku la sems mchis zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku la sems mchis zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Bhagavān, does the emanation body of the Tathāgata have mind or not?”

original: sems ma mchis zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku la sems mnga' ba ston to //
analyzed: sems ma mchis zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku la sems mnga' ba ston to //
translated: From here onward is the second [topic], demonstrating that the emanation body of the Tathāgata has mind.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Here there are also four parts.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang / brtags pa dang rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang / brtags pa dang rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: the question, the answer, the analysis, and the explanation.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the question itself.

original: de la sprul pa'i sku zhes bya ba ni gzhan longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i sku bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de la sprul pa'i sku zhes bya ba ni gzhan longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i sku bsdu ba ste /
translated: Therein, the so-called “emanation body” is the collection of the other two bodies, the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir re //
analyzed: sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir re //
translated: Because it is similar to an emanation, it is called the emanation body.
