original: sku gnyis po 'di dag sems mnga' ba zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: sku gnyis po 'di dag sems mnga' ba zhes bgyi'am /
translated: Are these two bodies said to have mind or not to have mind?

original: 'on te sems mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on te sems mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the meaning of “not to have mind”?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the Bodhisattva Manjusri:

original: rigs kyi bu sems yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: “Son of good family, they are not said to have mind,

original: sems med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan mdor gsungs pa ste /🔽yod ces byar yang mi rung la /
analyzed: sems med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan mdor gsungs pa ste / yod ces byar yang mi rung la /
translated: nor are they said not to have mind.” This is the second brief answer of the Tathagata.🔽The meaning is that it is not proper to say that they exist,

original: med ces byang yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med ces byang yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: nor is it proper to say that they do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gtan tshigs brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gtan tshigs brtag pa ste /
translated: This is the third, the examination of the reason.

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes gsungs kyang gtan tshigs ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes gsungs kyang gtan tshigs ma gsungs pa'i phyir 'dir brtag pa yin no //
translated: Although existence and nonexistence are mentioned, the reason is not stated, so it is examined here.🔽Because there is no mind that is based on itself and because there is a mind that is based on another.

original: bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la brten pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la brten pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth, the correct explanation by the Tathāgata.

original: de la bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems te /
translated: Here, the mind that is based on itself is the mind that has the aspect of view.

original: bdag nyid kyis dmigs pa'i byed pa lta ba'i rnam pa'i sa bon la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dmigs pa'i byed pa lta ba'i rnam pa'i sa bon la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises in dependence on the seed of the aspect of view, which is the activity of the object of perception by itself.

original: gzhan la brten pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems te /
analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind that is based on another is the mind that has the aspect of the sign of the cause.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa'i sems la brten nas skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Because it arises in dependence on the mind that has the aspect of view.

original: dmigs par ni mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par ni mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it does not take that as its object.

original: 'dir lan du gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan du gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention of the reply here is as follows.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa yang dag pa'i sems med @166a * //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa yang dag pa'i sems med @166a * //
translated: Since there is no mind of reality, the aspect of the view,

original: pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ni bdag nyid la brten pa'i sems med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said that there is no mind based on itself.

original: gzhan du brten pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ni med ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du brten pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa'i sems yod pa'i phyir ni med ces byar mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Since there is a mind that has the aspect of a sign based on another, it is not suitable to say that it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only,

original: sprul pa dang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de la yang dag pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba mi mnga' yang /
analyzed: sprul pa dang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de la yang dag pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba mi mnga' yang /
translated: it says that even though the emanation body and the body of perfect enjoyment do not have a real mind and mental factors,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos lta bur snang ste /
translated: they appear as if they are mind and mental factors.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu shin tu bsam par dka' ba'i phyir gzugs med pa'i chos sprul cing ston par byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub de'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu shin tu bsam par dka' ba'i phyir gzugs med pa'i chos sprul cing ston par byed do //
translated: Because the power of the miracles of that unsurpassed enlightenment is extremely difficult to imagine, it emanates and teaches formless dharmas.

original: gal te de ma yin na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ston par mdzad de snga nas gtan du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de ma yin na ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ston par mdzad de snga nas gtan du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, how could the Tathagata manifest desire, hatred, and so on, since he has already abandoned them forever?

original: ji ltar nyan thos dang byol song la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i sems shes par nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos dang byol song la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i sems shes par nus te /
translated: How could the Shravakas, animals, and so on, know the Tathagata's true mind?

original: mnyam pa nyid du byang chub sems dpas kyang shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du byang chub sems dpas kyang shes par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because even the Bodhisattvas cannot know it in its equality.

original: des na mdo dag las rigs dpag tu med pa dag sprul nas thams cad kyang sems yod pa lta bur ston to zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na mdo dag las rigs dpag tu med pa dag sprul nas thams cad kyang sems yod pa lta bur ston to zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in the sutras, it is said that the Tathagata emanates countless kinds of beings, all of whom appear to have minds.

original: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as stated in the noble Great Nirvana Sutra and so forth.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni phrin las rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni phrin las rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the wisdom of the Tathagata's accomplishment of his deeds manifests three kinds of activities.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is taught in the noble Buddha-bhumi-sutra and so on.

original: gzhan yang sprul pa gzhan la brten pa'i sems yod par gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sprul pa gzhan la brten pa'i sems yod par gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that there is a mind that is based on another emanation.

original: gzhan gyi yang dag pa'i sems la brten nas rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang dag pa'i sems la brten nas rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the appearance of the sign is based on the correct mind of another.

original: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is taught in this very sutra and so on.

original: sprul pa la dbang po dang / sems la sogs pa med par gsungs kyang /
analyzed: sprul pa la dbang po dang / sems la sogs pa med par gsungs kyang /
translated: Although it is said that the emanation does not have sense organs, mind, and so on,

original: gzhan las dgongs nas bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan las dgongs nas bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: it is taught with a special intention.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las brtsams pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las brtsams pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not with reference to the Tathagata.

original: gzhan sprul pa'i dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la dbang po la stsogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du ma bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan sprul pa'i dbang po gzugs can dang / sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos la dbang po la stsogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du ma bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is not taught that the other emanation has the existence of the physical sense organs, mind, and mental factors because it does not have the power of the sense organs and so on.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las phal cher de skad du ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las phal cher de skad du ston to //
translated: This is taught in the commentary on the noble Buddha-bhumi.

original: @166b mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: @166b mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intent says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku sems mchis pa zhig lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku sems mchis pa zhig lags sam /
translated: “Is the emanation of a tathāgata a mind or not?”

original: sems ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: sems ma mchis pa lags /
translated: “Is it not a mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Mañjuśrī,

original: sems med de sems rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems med de sems rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “It is not a mind because it is not independent.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intent says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa'i sku de sems mchis pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa'i sku de sems mchis pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: “Is that emanation of a tathāgata a mind or not?”

original: sems ma mchis pa zhes bgyi lags /
analyzed: sems ma mchis pa zhes bgyi lags /
translated: “Is it not a mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: sems yod ces bya bar yang mi rung la /
analyzed: sems yod ces bya bar yang mi rung la /
translated: “It is not suitable to say it is a mind.

original: sems med ces bya bar yang mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: sems med ces bya bar yang mi rung ngo ;
translated: It is not suitable to say it is not a mind.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi sems la dbang ma thob pa'i phyir sems med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems la dbang ma thob pa'i phyir sems med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be not a mind because it does not have mastery over its own mind.

original: gzhan gyi stobs kyi phyir sems yod pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs kyi phyir sems yod pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said to be a mind because it is the power of another.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī then said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, what is the difference between the domain of the tathāgatas and the object of the tathāgatas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gang lags pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gang lags pa de nyid la bye brag tu bgyi ba ni ci mchis lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gang lags pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gang lags pa de nyid la bye brag tu bgyi ba ni ci mchis lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul gyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: From here onward, the second part is taught, which is the characteristic of the difference between the domain of the tathāgatas.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis po zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis po zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This also has two parts: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the first part, the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, the domain of the tathāgatas is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du thun mong ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam pa thams cad du thun mong ba /
translated: The tathāgatas are in all ways common.

original: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / tshad med pa dag gis bkod pa /
analyzed: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / tshad med pa dag gis bkod pa /
translated: It is adorned with inconceivable and immeasurable good qualities.🔽It is a completely pure buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This passage shows the second, the reply given by the Tathagata.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This reply is also twofold:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu pa'o ;
translated: an explanation and a conclusion.

original: / rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: / rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation is also divided into two parts:

original: spyod yul rnam par bshad pa dang / yul rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: spyod yul rnam par bshad pa dang / yul rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: an explanation of the domain and an explanation of the object.

original: 'di ni dang po spyod yul rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po spyod yul rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: The first of these is the explanation of the domain.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thun mong du mnga' ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa /🔽stobs dang / mi @167a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams thun mong du mnga' ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa / stobs dang / mi @167a * //
translated: The domain of the Tathagata is the inconceivable,🔽the immeasurable good qualities of the powers,

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dag gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa dag gis brgyan pa /
translated: the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ste /
translated: A pure buddhafield is called the domain of the Tathagata.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las /
translated: This is taught in the noble Sutra on the Buddha-field.

original: phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad kyi bkod pa dang ldan par bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad kyi bkod pa dang ldan par bstan pa nyid de /
translated: It is taught there that it is endowed with an array of eighteen excellences.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Sutra on the Buddha-field and elsewhere,

original: gzhal med khang chen po rin po che sna bdun du 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po rin po che sna bdun du 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said that the great palace is arrayed with the blazing jewels of the seven precious substances.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The domain of the Tathagata is as follows:🔽It is the transformation of the five elements in every way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du khams lnga po dag bye brag tu gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du khams lnga po dag bye brag tu gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the second explanation of the domain of the Tathagata.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: grangs mdor bstan pa dang / grangs mdor smos pa bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor bstan pa dang / grangs mdor smos pa bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa ste /
translated: The brief presentation of the number and the detailed explanation of the number as it has been presented.

original: 'di ni grangs mdor bstan pa'o//
analyzed: 'di ni grangs mdor bstan pa'o//
translated: This is the brief presentation of the number.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sems can gyi khams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs mdor smos pa bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs mdor smos pa bzhin du rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: The realm of sentient beings, the realm of worlds, the realm of doctrine, the realm of those to be trained, and the realm of methods of training. This is the second, the detailed explanation of the number as it has been presented.

original: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: These five immeasurables should be understood as they are presented in the Yogācārabhūmi.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise says:

original: de la sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The immeasurable realm of sentient beings is as follows.

original: sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po de dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs drug cu rtsa bzhi po de dag yin pa ste /
translated: It is the sixty-four types of sentient beings.

original: sngar yid kyi sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar yid kyi sa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as it was presented in the chapter on the level of mind.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The world-realms are infinite,

original: phyogs bcu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dpag tu med cing ming yang dpag tu med de /
translated: because the ten directions are infinite and the names of the world-realms are infinite.

original: dper na 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed de /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed de /
translated: For example, this world-realm is called “Endurance”

original: de'i ming las mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ming las mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and its lord is called “Brahma.”

original: chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The element of mental objects is infinite,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: because the mental objects are infinite, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or undefined.

original: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mental objects are infinite in number because of the variety of their categories.

original: gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The element of those to be trained is infinite,

original: sems can thams cad gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gdul ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gdul ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: because all sentient beings are to be trained.

original: gdul ba'i khams rnam pa gnyis kyang yod de /
analyzed: gdul ba'i khams rnam pa gnyis kyang yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of those to be trained:

original: 'ching ba mtha' @167b dag dang ldan pa dang / 'ching ba mtha' dag dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' @167b dag dang ldan pa dang / 'ching ba mtha' dag dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: those who are bound by all the bonds, and those who are bound by only a few bonds.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa bdun yod pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa bdun yod pa nas /
translated: In the same way, there are seven kinds of those to be trained,🔽up to those who are bound by only one bond.

original: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga yod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga yod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to fifty-five types of consciousness are distinguished by way of their aspects.

original: rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It should be understood that they are limitless by way of their continuum.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, the same text says:

original: de la sems kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la sems kyi khams dang / gdul ba'i khams la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the element of mind and the element of those to be trained?

original: smras pa / rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad ni sems can gyi khams su bye brag med do //
analyzed: smras pa / rigs la gnas pa dang / rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad ni sems can gyi khams su bye brag med do //
translated: It is said: All sentient beings, whether they are abiding in the lineage or not abiding in the lineage, are not distinguished in terms of the element of sentient beings.

original: rigs la gnas pa gnas skabs de dang de dag la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa gnas skabs de dang de dag la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gdul ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are abiding in the lineage and are abiding in this or that state are called the element of those to be trained.

original: de la gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams dpag tu med pa ni sngar ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams dpag tu med pa ni sngar ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The element of the means of training should be understood as previously explained.

original: de yang rnam pa'i dbye bas ni dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa'i dbye bas ni dpag tu med do //
translated: It is limitless because it is distinguished by its aspects.

original: ci'i phyir dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni go rims de ltar bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ni go rims de ltar bstan ce na /
translated: Why are these five immeasurables taught in this order?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams nan tan brtson 'grus kyis sems can gyi don la spyod pas de'i phyir dang por sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams nan tan brtson 'grus kyis sems can gyi don la spyod pas de'i phyir dang por sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to //
translated: It is said: Because bodhisattvas engage in the welfare of sentient beings through the practice of perseverance, therefore the realm of sentient beings is first taught as immeasurable.

original: sems can de dag gang la gnas pa yang dmigs pa las gdul bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sems can de dag gang la gnas pa yang dmigs pa las gdul bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Since those sentient beings are to be guided by means of objects,

original: de'i phyir gnyis pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis pa 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to ;
translated: therefore the second, the immeasurable world systems, is taught.

original: / sems can de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag na chos gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag kyang dmigs pas /
analyzed: / sems can de dag 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag na chos gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bye brag kyang dmigs pas /
translated: Since those sentient beings in those world systems are observed to have the specific distinctions of defilement and purification by means of phenomena,

original: de'i phyir gsum pa chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum pa chos kyi khams dpag tu med pa bstan to //
translated: therefore the third, the immeasurable realm of phenomena, is taught.

original: sems can de dag gi nang nas sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi nang nas sems can gang dag skal ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: From among those sentient beings, those sentient beings who have good fortune

original: gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par thar bar byed pa yang mthong bas de'i phyir bzhi pa'i gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa ston to //
analyzed: gtan du sdug bsngal las rnam par thar bar byed pa yang mthong bas de'i phyir bzhi pa'i gdul ba'i khams dpag tu med pa ston to //
translated: and they see that they will be liberated from suffering forever. Therefore, the fourth is the teaching that the element to be trained has no measure.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dag gis sems can rnams gtan du rnam par thar par byed par 'gyur bas de'i phyir lnga pa gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams dpag tu med pa ston to ;
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dag gis sems can rnams gtan du rnam par thar par byed par 'gyur bas de'i phyir lnga pa gdul ba'i thabs kyi khams dpag tu med pa ston to ;
translated: By means of those skillful means, they will liberate sentient beings forever. Therefore, the fifth is the teaching that the element of the means of training has no measure.

original: / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa lnga po de dag ni thams cad la mkhas pa byed par 'gyur ba'i zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dpag tu med pa lnga po de dag ni thams cad la mkhas pa byed par 'gyur ba'i zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the five immeasurables of the bodhisattvas are the causes for becoming skilled in all.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang / sa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'phags pa legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to//
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang / sa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'phags pa legs pa'i tshul khrims bstan pa'i mdo las kyang de skad du ston to//
translated: This is taught in the treatises, in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras, in the chapter on the levels, and in the Sutra Teaching the Noble One’s Conduct.🔽Those are called the two types of distinctions.

original: @168a * // de dag ni rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: @168a * // de dag ni rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdus pa'o /
translated: This is the conclusion of the second chapter.

original: // / bam po bdun cu lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun cu lnga pa /

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par byang chub pa gang lags pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang lags pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gang lags pa rnam pa gsum po de dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bur rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sogs pa la gsum po dag
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par byang chub pa gang lags pa dang / yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gang lags pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po gang lags pa rnam pa gsum po de dag gi mtshan nyid ji lta bur rig par bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la sogs pa la gsum po dag
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī also addressed the Bhagavān as follows:🔽“Bhagavān, how should one understand the characteristics of those three—the tathāgata’s manifest complete enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of the true Dharma, and the great parinirvāṇa?”

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here onward, up to “The characteristic of nonduality,” it teaches the third, the nonduality of manifest complete enlightenment and so on.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This also has four parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang brtag pa dang / rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa dang brtag pa dang / rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: the request, the reply, the analysis, and the explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po rnam pa gsum po de dag so so nas mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig dang ldan zhes zhu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rnam pa gsum po de dag so so nas mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig dang ldan zhes zhu ba'o //
translated: This is the first question, which is about the individual characteristics of those three aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu gsum po de dag ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gsum po de dag ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: “Son of noble family, you should know that those three are characterized by non-duality.”

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This shows the second part, the Tathāgata’s true answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: lan mdor bstan pa dang / lan rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lan mdor bstan pa dang / lan rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: the brief teaching of the answer and the detailed explanation of the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po gsum po de dag gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes lan mdor gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po gsum po de dag gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes lan mdor gsungs so //
translated: This is the brief teaching of the answer, saying “Those three are characterized by non-duality.”

original: 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang ma yin yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang ma yin yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that there is no perfect enlightenment, nor is it the case that there is no turning of the wheel of the true Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor ba yang ma yin yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo mi bskor ba yang ma yin yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yang ma yin /
translated: It is not the turning of the wheel of the true Dharma, nor is it the great parinirvāṇa.🔽It is not the nonexistence of the great parinirvāṇa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second explanation, the detailed explanation.

original: rnam pa gsum po dag ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po dag ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang ma yin //
translated: Since these three aspects have the characteristic of nonduality, they are not full awakening,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang ma yin /
translated: they are not the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and they are not parinirvāṇa.

original: rnam pa gsum med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not the nonexistence of the three aspects,

original: tshig tha dad kyang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tha dad kyang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the words are different but the meaning is the same.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /🔽byang chub thob pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni / byang chub thob pa yang ma yin /
translated: In the Sūtra Unraveling the Profound Hidden Meaning,🔽it says,🔽“It is not the attainment of awakening,

original: byang chub mi thob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung @168b ngo ;
analyzed: byang chub mi thob pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung @168b ngo ;
translated: and it is not the nonattainment of awakening.”

original: / dpe gzhan gnyis las kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig tu 'byung bas /
analyzed: / dpe gzhan gnyis las kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig tu 'byung bas /
translated: The phrase not from another is also found in the other two examples.

original: de'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gis ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the word not indicates the characteristic of non-duality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Why is that? is the third, the explanation of the reason.

original: gnyis su med pa zhes gsungs kyang /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa zhes gsungs kyang /
translated: Although it is said non-dual,

original: rnam par ma bshad pas /
analyzed: rnam par ma bshad pas /
translated: it has not been explained,

original: de'i phyir brtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtag pa yin no //
translated: so it is being investigated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni gtan du yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku ni rtag tu kun du stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni gtan du yongs su dag pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku ni rtag tu kun du stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the explanation: Because the dharmakāya of the Tathāgatas is eternally pure, and because the emanation body of the Tathāgatas is always empty.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid gsum po de dag med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan nyid gsum po de dag med la /
translated: Thus, the dharmakāya of suchness is devoid of those three characteristics because it is extremely pure.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni dbang po ji lta ba bzhin du kun du ston pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gsum po dag med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The emanation body is not devoid of the three realities, because it manifests in accordance with the faculties of those to be trained.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: This accords with what is said in the sutra.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intent says:

original: sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku kun du ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba ni /
translated: Because it manifests as the emanation body.

original: sprul pa'i sku nyid la sprul pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku nyid la sprul pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The emanation body itself is called an emanation.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, the noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Letter teaches:

original: sprul pa yang dag sangs rgyas min //🔽chos bstan pa yang de ma yin //
analyzed: sprul pa yang dag sangs rgyas min // chos bstan pa yang de ma yin //
translated: Emanations are not perfect buddhas.

original: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The teachings of the doctrine are not that.

original: bdag dang gzhan longs spyod pa'i sku mtshan nyid 'di gsum dang ldan nam zhe na /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan longs spyod pa'i sku mtshan nyid 'di gsum dang ldan nam zhe na /
translated: Do the bodies that enjoy the doctrine for themselves and others have these three characteristics?

original: smras pa / nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni nges par mtshan nyid gcig dang ldan pas /
analyzed: smras pa / nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni nges par mtshan nyid gcig dang ldan pas /
translated: The Enjoyment Body of the Buddha definitely has one characteristic.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: mngon par byang chub pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa nyid do //
translated: It is the attainment of manifest enlightenment.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan gnyis la ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do /🔽kha cig na re chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad /🔽yongs su mya ngan las kyang mi 'da' ste /🔽sa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis mi mthong /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan gnyis la ni bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod do / kha cig na re chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi mdzad / yongs su mya ngan las kyang mi 'da' ste / sa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis mi mthong /
translated: The other two bodies have two explanations of their characteristics.

original: mi thob pa'i phyir dang / sku 'gags nas lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mdzad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: mi thob pa'i phyir dang / sku 'gags nas lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du mdzad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say: They do not turn the wheel of Dharma and do not pass into parinirvāṇa because bodhisattvas abiding on the great grounds do not see them and do not attain them and because they do not manifest nirvāṇa without remainder after the cessation of their bodies.

original: kha cig na re mtshan nyid gnyis dang ldan te mthong ba'i chos dang bde ba'i ched du chos ston pa'i phyir dang / sku 'gags pa ma yin yang 'gog pa mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re mtshan nyid gnyis dang ldan te mthong ba'i chos dang bde ba'i ched du chos ston pa'i phyir dang / sku 'gags pa ma yin yang 'gog pa mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Some say: They have two characteristics because they teach Dharma for the sake of the happiness of this life and because they manifest cessation even though their bodies do not cease.

original: gzhan yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par bshad kyang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par bshad kyang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Moreover, there is no contradiction in explaining that the enjoyment body has three characteristics.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' @169a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' @169a * //
translated: The Buddha Amitābha is fully enlightened, passes into parinirvāṇa, and the bodhisattva

original: spyan ras gzigs de'i rgyal tshab yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs de'i rgyal tshab yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Avalokiteśvara is his regent.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive classification should be understood according to what appears in the teachings on full enlightenment through eight characteristics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ni sprul pa'i sku la lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsnyen bkur bgyis pa'i bsod nams skye bar 'gyur lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ni sprul pa'i sku la lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsnyen bkur bgyis pa'i bsod nams skye bar 'gyur lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if sentient beings generate merit by seeing, hearing, and serving the emanation body,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang de dag tu rgyu dang rkyen ci zhig mchis lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa mdzad pa'i bye brag ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang de dag tu rgyu dang rkyen ci zhig mchis lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa mdzad pa'i bye brag ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with What are the causes and conditions for the Tathagatas to be the objects of observation of sentient beings? shows the fourth, the particular way the Tathagatas are the objects of observation of sentient beings.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This also shows the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the question.

original: zhu ba gsol ba'i dngos po yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba'i dngos po yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: The things that are asked about are explained separately and are not consistent.

original: kha cig na re 'dir ni sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can dag la rkyen rnam pa bzhi las rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad nas bsod nams skyed par mdzad pa lags zhes zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir ni sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pas gdul bar bya ba'i sems can dag la rkyen rnam pa bzhi las rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad nas bsod nams skyed par mdzad pa lags zhes zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Here the question is, What are the causes and conditions for the Tathagatas, who are emanation bodies, to generate merit by performing some action for sentient beings who are to be guided from among the four conditions?

original: kha cig na re 'di ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad ces zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad ces zhu ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: This asks, “What are the causes and conditions of the emanation body of the Tathāgata, which is the third of the two bodies, the Dharma body and the enjoyment body?”

original: kha cig na re 'di ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdul bar bya ba'i sems can dag la rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad nas yon tan rnams skyed par bgyid ces zhu ba yin no zhes zer
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdul bar bya ba'i sems can dag la rgyu dang rkyen gang zhig mdzad nas yon tan rnams skyed par bgyid ces zhu ba yin no zhes zer
translated: Some say: This asks, “What are the causes and conditions for the Tathāgata, who is the third of the two bodies, the Dharma body and the enjoyment body, to generate qualities in sentient beings who are to be trained?”

original: te / 'og nas lan du gsungs pa'i tshig dang sbyar na dgongs pa rnam pa 'di gsum yod do //
analyzed: te / 'og nas lan du gsungs pa'i tshig dang sbyar na dgongs pa rnam pa 'di gsum yod do //
translated: Because the answer given below is consistent with these three intentions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi de dag gi lhag par bya ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i sku de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi de dag gi lhag par bya ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i sku de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This second reply that the tathāgata actually gave is explained as follows.

original: lan du gsungs pa 'di bshad pa yang gong du zhu ba gsol ba la rnam pa gsum du bshad pa dang sbyar na go rims bzhin du 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: lan du gsungs pa 'di bshad pa yang gong du zhu ba gsol ba la rnam pa gsum du bshad pa dang sbyar na go rims bzhin du 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: If this explanation of the reply is applied to the three aspects of the request explained above, then there are three explanations here in the same order.

original: kha cig na re sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can de @169b dag la rkyen rnam pa gnyis po bdag po'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen mdzad do //
analyzed: kha cig na re sprul pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can de @169b dag la rkyen rnam pa gnyis po bdag po'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen mdzad do //
translated: Some say: The emanation tathāgata acts as two conditions for those sentient beings: the dominant condition and the observed object condition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can rnams ni sprul pa'i sku bdag po'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen mdzad nas bsod nams skye bar 'gyur bas so /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni sprul pa'i sku bdag po'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen mdzad nas bsod nams skye bar 'gyur bas so /
translated: Because sentient beings generate merit by acting as the dominant condition and the observed object condition for the emanation body.

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the causal condition or the immediately preceding condition.

original: lus tha dad pa dag phan tshun ltos na rgyu'i rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skal pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi sems la sogs pa dus mtshungs par skye ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus tha dad pa dag phan tshun ltos na rgyu'i rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skal pa mtshungs pa rnams kyi sems la sogs pa dus mtshungs par skye ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, when different bodies mutually rely on each other, they are not the causal condition, and because the minds and so on of those of similar status arise at the same time, they are not similar and immediately preceding conditions.🔽That emanation body is also the transformation of the Tathāgata.

original: sprul pa'i sku de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku la sems can gyi bsod nams bskyed par bzlas te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku la sems can gyi bsod nams bskyed par bzlas te bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the repetition that the merit of sentient beings generates the emanation body.

original: des na sku rnam pa gnyis kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir bsod nams bskyed pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: des na sku rnam pa gnyis kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir bsod nams bskyed pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is the transformation of the two kinds of bodies, it generates merit.

original: kha cig na re lan du gsungs pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sprul pa'i sku de la ltos na chos kyi sku'i dbang dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin gyi /🔽rkyen gnyis po dag ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re lan du gsungs pa 'di'i dgongs pa ni chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sprul pa'i sku de la ltos na chos kyi sku'i dbang dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis yin gyi / rkyen gnyis po dag ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The intention of this statement is that the dharmakāya and the sambhogakāya are the dominant condition of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: sprul pa ni sems can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: sprul pa ni sems can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: The nirmāṇakāya is not the condition of those two because emanations are not sentient beings.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar te /
translated: This is explained in the following.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad de chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag gi bdag po'i rkyen gyis bsdus pas sprul pa'i rgyu dang rkyen yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di bshad de chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag gi bdag po'i rkyen gyis bsdus pas sprul pa'i rgyu dang rkyen yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata who is the two kāyas, the dharmakāya and the sambhogakāya, is the cause and condition of the nirmāṇakāya because he is subsumed by the dominant condition of those two.

original: sku rnam pa gnyis po de dag gi dbang gis sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sprul pa'i sku la don de bzhin gshegs pa de gnyis kyi byin gyi rlabs yin pa'i phyir sku rnam pa gnyis po de dag ni sprul pa'i sku de dag gis bskyed pa'i rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sku rnam pa gnyis po de dag gi dbang gis sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sprul pa'i sku la don de bzhin gshegs pa de gnyis kyi byin gyi rlabs yin pa'i phyir sku rnam pa gnyis po de dag ni sprul pa'i sku de dag gis bskyed pa'i rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: and the emanation body arises by the power of those two bodies, and also the emanation body is the blessing of those two thusnesses.

original: de la rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ba ni nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir don gyi rgyu dang rkyen zhes gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i rgyu rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya ba ni nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir don gyi rgyu dang rkyen zhes gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i rgyu rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: Therein, cause and condition are stated as the meaning of cause and condition because they are the proximate generators, but they are not the real cause and condition.

original: kha cig na re chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can de dag ni dbang po dang ; dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir bsod nams bskyed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can de dag ni dbang po dang ; dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir bsod nams bskyed de /
translated: Some say: The two thusnesses of the Dharma body and the beatific body are the cause and condition of the emanation body because the sentient beings to be trained are the two conditions of the faculties and the objective condition.

original: ring ba'i rkyen 'di'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa gnyis sems can rnams kyi bsod nams bskyed pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ring ba'i rkyen 'di'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa gnyis sems can rnams kyi bsod nams bskyed pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Because of this distant condition, it is taught that the two kinds of Tathāgatas generate the merit of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang sprul pa'i sku de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis po dag gi mthus byin @170a * //🔽gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sprul pa'i sku de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis po dag gi mthus byin @170a * // gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Moreover, those transformation bodies are empowered by the power of those two Tathāgatas.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Thus, although there are three explanations, the third is correct.

original: mdo'i tshig dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it accords with the words of the sūtra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī also said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das mngon par 'du bgyi bam mchis par 'dra lags na rgyu dang rkyen gang gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku kho na las ni sems can rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan dpag tu med
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mngon par 'du bgyi bam mchis par 'dra lags na rgyu dang rkyen gang gi slad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku kho na las ni sems can rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan dpag tu med
translated: Bhagavān, if they are the same in not being produced, by what causes and conditions does the great light of wisdom arise for sentient beings from the Tathāgata's Dharma body alone, and does an immeasurable🔽transformation body appear?

original: pa dag kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: pa dag kyang 'byung la /
translated: and the other qualities of a Buddha arise.🔽But in the body of liberation of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, these things do not arise.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus la ni dngos po 'di dag mi 'byung lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus la ni dngos po 'di dag mi 'byung lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi bye brag bstan to //
translated: From here on, the fifth, the distinction between the Dharma Body of the Tathagata and the body of liberation of the two vehicles, is taught.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the question.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus mngon par 'du bgyi ba dang / rnam par grol ba yid la bgyi ba ma mchis pa 'dra lags na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas la chos kyi sku dang / theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus mngon par 'du bgyi ba dang / rnam par grol ba yid la bgyi ba ma mchis pa 'dra lags na /
translated: Since the Dharma Body of the Buddha and the body of liberation of the two vehicles are the same in being unconditioned and in being the object of mental attention of liberation,

original: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku las ni ye shes bzhi'i snang ba chen po dang / sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan dag 'byung la /
analyzed: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku las ni ye shes bzhi'i snang ba chen po dang / sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan dag 'byung la /
translated: why is it that from the Dharma Body of the Tathagata there arises the great light of the four knowledges and the reflection of the emanation body,

original: theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus las ni dngos po 'di dag mi 'byung lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus las ni dngos po 'di dag mi 'byung lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: These things do not occur in the body of liberation of the two vehicles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu dper na mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'dra yang nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi chu shel dang me shel rnam pa gnyis ni snang ba chen po 'byung la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'dra yang nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi chu shel dang me shel rnam pa gnyis ni snang ba chen po 'byung la /
translated: “Son of good family, for example, although they are similar in being without manifest activity, the two types of water crystal and fire crystal in the orbs of the sun and moon produce great light,🔽but not from other water crystals.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i chu shel dag las ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chu shel dag las ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: This and so on teaches

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: the second, the Tathāgata’s reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the illustration by analogy and the application of the analogy to the meaning.

original: dpes nye bar mtshon pa yang dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa nyid las rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dpes nye bar mtshon pa yang dpe rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan pa nyid las rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The illustration by analogy is taught by two analogies, which are divided into two parts.

original: 'di ni dpe dang po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dpe dang po bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first example.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first example is twofold:

original: nyi ma dang zla ba las snang ba chen po 'byung bar bstan pa dang / de gnyis kyi rgyu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba las snang ba chen po 'byung bar bstan pa dang / de gnyis kyi rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching that a great light arises from the sun and moon, and the teaching of the cause of those two.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //🔽nyi ma dang zla ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o // nyi ma dang zla ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: This is the first.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las ji skad du /
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of the sun and moon is as it appears in the Abhidharmakośa:

original: nyi ma zla ba ri rab phyed //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba ri rab phyed //
translated: The sun and moon are half of Meru,

original: dpag tshad lnga bcu lnga bcu gcig / ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: dpag tshad lnga bcu lnga bcu gcig / ces 'byung ste /
translated: fifty and fifty-one yojanas.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary to this says:

original: nyi @170b ma dang zla ba la dpag tshad du yod ce na /
analyzed: nyi @170b ma dang zla ba la dpag tshad du yod ce na /
translated: “What is the size of the sun and moon?”

original: nyi ma ni lnga bcu gcig go //
analyzed: nyi ma ni lnga bcu gcig go //
translated: The sun is fifty-one yojanas.

original: zla ba ni lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: zla ba ni lnga bcu'o //
translated: The moon is fifty yojanas.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che me shel las mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che me shel las mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: The lower side of the sun’s maṇḍala is formed from precious fire crystal.

original: tsha zhing gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tsha zhing gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is hot and illuminating.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che chu shel las mngon par grub pa ste bsil zhing gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi ngos ni rin po che chu shel las mngon par grub pa ste bsil zhing gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The side of the moon facing down is made of water crystal, which is cool and luminous.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gzhal med khang der sems can ji lta bu dag gnas she na /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gzhal med khang der sems can ji lta bu dag gnas she na /
translated: What kind of sentient beings live in the palaces of the sun and so on?

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i rigs su gtogs pa'i lha rnams so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i rigs su gtogs pa'i lha rnams so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: They are gods belonging to the class of the Four Great Kings.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du'o //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang rjes su mthun pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise following correct reasoning also explains in accordance with the explanation in the Abhidharmakośa.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las nyi ma dang zla ba ni dpag tshad lnga bcu lnga bcu zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las nyi ma dang zla ba ni dpag tshad lnga bcu lnga bcu zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, it is explained that the sun and moon are fifty yojanas.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is as follows:

original: rin po che chu shel la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang /
analyzed: rin po che chu shel la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang /
translated: Even though water crystal and so on have no thought,

original: nyi ma dang zla ba las snang ba chen po 'byung ste //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba las snang ba chen po 'byung ste //
translated: a great light arises from the sun and moon.

original: rin po che gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rin po che gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not from any other jewel.

original: 'di ltar sems can mthu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyi phyir dang / sems can gyi las kyi dbang gi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can mthu chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyi phyir dang / sems can gyi las kyi dbang gi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the power of the blessing of the powerful sentient beings and because of the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second explanation of the two causes.

original: 'di ltar nyi ma dang zla ba'i rin po che las snang ba chen po 'byung ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyi ma dang zla ba'i rin po che las snang ba chen po 'byung ba ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: Thus, the great light that arises from the sun and moon jewels is due to two causes.

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa lha'i bu nyi ma dang zla bas phyin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa lha'i bu nyi ma dang zla bas phyin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of the blessing of the powerful celestial sons of the sun and moon and because of the power of the karma common to all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du chos sku yang de bzhin gshegs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba'i las thun mong las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung gi rin po che gzhan dag ni mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag gis byin gyis brlabs
analyzed: de bzhin du chos sku yang de bzhin gshegs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang sems can sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba'i las thun mong las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ye shes kyi snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung gi rin po che gzhan dag ni mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag gis byin gyis brlabs
translated: Likewise, the dharmakāya is the source of the great light of pristine wisdom and the source of the reflection of the emanation body because it is empowered by the Tathāgata who possesses great power and because it is the common karma of sentient beings to see the Buddha.

original: pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang las mngon par grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang brgya chen po gtong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang las mngon par grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang brgya chen po gtong bar mi nus so //
translated: Other jewels are not the source of the great light because they are not empowered by those who possess great power and they are not the source of the great light because they are not the common karma of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sku'i gzugs brnyan ston par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa gnyis kyi rnam par grol ba'i lus kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pa dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang ba chen po 'byung zhing sku'i gzugs brnyan ston par mi nus so //
translated: Likewise, the bodies of the two vehicles’ liberation are not able to produce a great light and display a body image, because they are not blessed by the great power of the Tathāgatas, and because they are not established by the power of the common karma of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang @171a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @171a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: nor bu rin po che las byi dor legs par byas pa de dag las ni rgyu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung la /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che las byi dor legs par byas pa de dag las ni rgyu'i gzugs brnyan 'byung la /
translated: from those precious jewels that have been well polished, the reflection of the cause appears,

original: de las gzhan pa'i byi dor ma byas pa dag las ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byi dor ma byas pa dag las ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni dpe gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: but not from those that have not been polished in that way. This is the second example.

original: 'di ltar bzo ba mkhas pas nor bu rin po che byi dor legs par byas pa las ni rgyan gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung gi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzo ba mkhas pas nor bu rin po che byi dor legs par byas pa las ni rgyan gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung gi /
translated: Thus, from a precious jewel that has been well polished by a skilled artisan, the reflection of an ornament appears,

original: de las gzhan pa'i byi dor ma byas pa dag ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i byi dor ma byas pa dag ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but not from those that have not been polished in that way.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa'i thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas shin tu sbyang ba byas pa las yang dag par grub pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku las ye shes kyi snang ba chen po dang sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa'i thabs dang shes rab bsgoms pas shin tu sbyang ba byas pa las yang dag par grub pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku las ye shes kyi snang ba chen po dang sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan
translated: Likewise, the great appearance of intuition and the immeasurable reflected images of emanations arise from the reality-body of the Tathāgata, which is perfectly accomplished from the thorough cultivation of the meditation on the means and insight that have the immeasurable reality realm as their object.

original: dpag tu med pa dag 'byung gi / rnam par grol ba'i lus 'ba' zhig las ni dngos po de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa dag 'byung gi / rnam par grol ba'i lus 'ba' zhig las ni dngos po de dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: But those things do not exist from the liberated body alone. This is the second application of the example to the meaning.

original: chos kyi dbyings dpag tu med pa dag la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni chos dpag tu med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dpag tu med pa dag la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku ni chos dpag tu med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase “having the immeasurable reality realm as their object” means that the reality-body of suchness is called the “reality realm” because it is the cause of immeasurable qualities.

original: thabs dang shes rab ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i shes pas dge ba bsgoms te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ces bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i shes pas dge ba bsgoms te /
translated: The phrase “the means and insight” means that the meditation on virtue is cultivated by the intuition that has the reality realm as its object.

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu bsal nas chos kyi sku gsal bar byed pa'i phyir thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu bsal nas chos kyi sku gsal bar byed pa'i phyir thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it clears away the afflictions and illuminates the Dharma Body, it is called the “means.”

original: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i thabs dang / shes rab kyis shin tu legs par nyon mongs pa sbyangs te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i thabs dang / shes rab kyis shin tu legs par nyon mongs pa sbyangs te /
translated: This means that, by means of the means that has the suchness objective support and the wisdom that has thoroughly purified the afflictions,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug brtsams pa las ni chos kyi sku mngon par grub la /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug brtsams pa las ni chos kyi sku mngon par grub la /
translated: the Dharma Body is accomplished from the beginning of the practice of the six perfections.

original: chos kyi sku las ni ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi sku las ni ye shes kyi snang ba 'byung zhing /
translated: From the Dharma Body, the appearance of wisdom arises,

original: sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the appearance of emanations is displayed.

original: gang zag stong pa nyid du lta ba'i shes pa rnam par grol ba'i lus las ni snang ba chen po gtong ba dang / sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag stong pa nyid du lta ba'i shes pa rnam par grol ba'i lus las ni snang ba chen po gtong ba dang / sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan ston par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: But from the body of the knowledge of the emptiness of the person, the great light is not emitted and the appearance of emanations is not displayed.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rnam par grol ba'i lus las dngos po 'di lta bu yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni rnam par grol ba'i lus las dngos po 'di lta bu yod pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it says that such things do not exist in the body of liberation.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:🔽🔽

original: rnam par grol ba'i lus las dngos po 'di lta bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lus las dngos po 'di lta bu 'byung ba ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The body of liberation does not produce such things.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Mañjuśrī said to the Bhagavān:🔽“

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: Bhagavān, you have said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi'i lus phun sum tshogs pa rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams dang / 'dod pa'i @171b khams kyi lha dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can rnams 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi'i lus phun sum tshogs pa rgyal rigs dang bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bu rnams dang / 'dod pa'i @171b khams kyi lha dang /
translated: ‘Through the power of the blessings of the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas, the bodies of humans in the desire realm who are perfect in human bodies—those of the warrior and brahman castes who are like great śāla trees—and the bodies of the gods of the desire realm,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha'i lus phun sum tshogs pa thams cad snang ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha'i lus phun sum tshogs pa thams cad snang ngo zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: and all the perfect bodies of the gods of the form and formless realms appear.’
