original: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa lta bu zhig mchis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus sems can gyi lus yongs su 'dzin pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa lta bu zhig mchis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus sems can gyi lus yongs su 'dzin pa ston to //
translated: The Blessed One has a thought like this: By the power of the bodhisattva's blessing, sentient beings take on a body.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the question and answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the question itself.

original: zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / theg pa gsum gyi bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs pas gang gis bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa dag ni lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / theg pa gsum gyi bsgrub pa la sogs pa gsungs pas gang gis bstan pa bzhin du bsgrub pa dag ni lus dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs par 'gyur la /
translated: The intention of the question is that the Thus-Gone One has taught the path of the ten virtues, the practice of the three vehicles, and so forth. Those who practice in accordance with the teachings will attain perfection of body and enjoyments.

original: gang dag bstan pa dang 'gal bar byas pa dag ni lus yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar thob pa dang ldan yang nyams pa dang ldan no zhes bka' stsal ba'i rigs pa las lus phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig kho na gsungs kyi
analyzed: gang dag bstan pa dang 'gal bar byas pa dag ni lus yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar thob pa dang ldan yang nyams pa dang ldan no zhes bka' stsal ba'i rigs pa las lus phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang ldan pa'i phyogs gcig kho na gsungs kyi
translated: Those who act contrary to the teaching obtain a body that is impaired, but it is said that they obtain a body that is perfect.

original: / nyams par 'gyur ba ma gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci mchis zhes zhu ba yin no //
analyzed: / nyams par 'gyur ba ma gsungs pa la dgongs pa ci mchis zhes zhu ba yin no //
translated: Why did the Buddha not speak of the impairment of those who obtain a body that is perfect?

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na ci tsam du sems dang bcas pa dag ni rang gi las kyi dbang gis lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na ci tsam du sems dang bcas pa dag ni rang gi las kyi dbang gis lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If those who have minds obtain a perfect body through the power of their karma,

original: mdo dag las ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gyi lus phun sum tshogs par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: mdo dag las ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gyi lus phun sum tshogs par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
translated: why did the Buddha say in the sutras that the Tathagata and bodhisattvas create a perfect body for sentient beings through the power of their higher cognitions?

original: des dgongs pa ji lta bu zhig ces khong du ma chud nas zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: des dgongs pa ji lta bu zhig ces khong du ma chud nas zhus pa yin no //
translated: Not understanding the Buddha's intention, they asked this question.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthus byin gyis brlabs nas lam gang dang bsgrub pa gang gis thams cad du sems can rnams lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dag ci rigs par de dag la lam de dang bsgrub pa de yang dag par bstan pa zhes bya
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthus byin gyis brlabs nas lam gang dang bsgrub pa gang gis thams cad du sems can rnams lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dag ci rigs par de dag la lam de dang bsgrub pa de yang dag par bstan pa zhes bya
translated: “Son of noble family, through the blessing of the Tathāgata and the power of the bodhisattvas, whatever path and practice will cause sentient beings to attain a perfect body in all circumstances, that path and practice are taught to them as appropriate.”

original: ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: This and so on

original: gnyis po de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis po de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: demonstrates the second, the Tathāgata’s true reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the conclusion.

original: rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The explanation also has two parts:

original: dgongs pa'i bstan pa smos pa dang / gang dag ces bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa'i rjes su grub pa dang 'gal bar byed pas smos nas dgongs pa de yang dag par bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //🔽'di ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dge ba bcu'i las kyi @172a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i bstan pa smos pa dang / gang dag ces bya ba man chad kyis bstan pa'i rjes su grub pa dang 'gal bar byed pas smos nas dgongs pa de yang dag par bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o // 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dge ba bcu'i las kyi @172a * //
translated: The first is the explanation of the teaching of the intention, and the explanation of the intention itself, beginning with “those who…” since they contradict the teaching and the establishment of the teaching.

original: lam dang ; theg pa gsum gyi spyod pa gsungs pas khams gsum gyi sems can rnams lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dag la lam de dang bsgrub pa de bstan par mdzad kyang bstan pa dang 'gal bar byed pa med pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam dang ; theg pa gsum gyi spyod pa gsungs pas khams gsum gyi sems can rnams lus phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ba dag la lam de dang bsgrub pa de bstan par mdzad kyang bstan pa dang 'gal bar byed pa med pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, by the blessing of the great compassion of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, the paths of the ten virtues and the practices of the three vehicles are taught, and sentient beings of the three realms attain the perfection of the body. Although the teaching and the practice of that path are taught, it is not the case that there is no contradiction with the teaching.

original: ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa mngon par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldem por dgongs te gsungs pa mngon par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is taught with an ulterior purpose. This is the meaning.

original: gang dag lam de dang bsgrub pa de yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dag ni thams cad du lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: gang dag lam de dang bsgrub pa de yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dag ni thams cad du lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Those who practice that path and that practice correctly will have a perfect body in all lives.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa dang / 'gal bar byed pa smos nas dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa dang / 'gal bar byed pa smos nas dgongs pa yang dag par bstan pa ston to //
translated: The second, the teaching of the correct intention after mentioning the practice and the opposition, is as follows.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: bstan pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang / bstan pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rjes su bsgrub pa'i phan yon bstan pa dang / bstan pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the benefits of practicing in accordance with the teaching and the teaching of the faults of opposing the teaching.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: It is merely a matter of communicating this very sutra.

original: sems can gang dag lam de dang bsgrub pa de'i phyir spong zhing mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / nga la yang kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems bskyed nas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dag ni thams cad du lus dman pa thob par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag lam de dang bsgrub pa de'i phyir spong zhing mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / nga la yang kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems bskyed nas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dag ni thams cad du lus dman pa thob par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bstan pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: Those sentient beings who abandon that path and that practice, who speak unpleasantly about it, who generate a hostile mind and an angry mind toward me, and who die with those states will all obtain an inferior body.

original: sems can gang dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rgyab kyis phyogs shing theg pa gsum gyi bsgrub pa dag la mi snyan par brjod pa dang lhas byin bzhin du sangs rgyas la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems bskyed pa dang / sor mo'i phreng ba ltar sangs rgyas la khong khro ba'i sems bskyed pa dag ni /
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rgyab kyis phyogs shing theg pa gsum gyi bsgrub pa dag la mi snyan par brjod pa dang lhas byin bzhin du sangs rgyas la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems bskyed pa dang / sor mo'i phreng ba ltar sangs rgyas la khong khro ba'i sems bskyed pa dag ni /
translated: Those sentient beings who turn their backs on the path of the ten virtuous actions and speak unpleasantly about the practices of the three vehicles, who generate a hostile mind toward the Buddha like Devadatta, and who generate an angry mind toward the Buddha like Aṅgulimāla,

original: skye ba thams cad du lus phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du lus phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: will obtain an inferior body in all their lives.

original: 'jam dpal rgyu dang rkyen des na de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthus byin gyis brlabs nas lus phun sum tshogs pa 'ba' zhig tu byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal rgyu dang rkyen des na de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthus byin gyis brlabs nas lus phun sum tshogs pa 'ba' zhig tu byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, for that reason, through the power and blessing of the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, the body is not made only perfect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus ni sems can gyi lus dman par byed par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus ni sems can gyi lus dman par byed par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: It should be understood that through the power and blessing of the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas, the body of sentient beings is also made inferior.🔽This is the second summary, a summary of the benefits of subsequent practice and the objects of meditation for countering the discordances.

original: 'di yang rjes su mthun par bsgrub pa'i phan yon dang 'gal ba'i nye dmigs bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te /🔽mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: 'di yang rjes su mthun par bsgrub pa'i phan yon dang 'gal ba'i nye dmigs bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin te / mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is also a summary of the benefits of subsequent practice and the objects of meditation for countering the discordances.

original: byang chub sems dpal 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpal 'jam dpal gyis yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī then said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhing yongs su dag pa na dngos po gang ni mdo pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhing yongs su dag pa na dngos po gang ni mdo pa lags /
translated: “Lord, what are the things in a pure buddhafield?

original: dngos po gang ni dka' ba lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bdun pa zhing yongs su dag pa dang zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag na gang @172b dag rnyed par dka' ba dang / gang dag mod pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: dngos po gang ni dka' ba lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bdun pa zhing yongs su dag pa dang zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag na gang @172b dag rnyed par dka' ba dang / gang dag mod pa'i mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: From What things are difficult? up to here is the seventh, teaching the characteristics of what is difficult to obtain and what is easy to obtain in pure and impure fields.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: This is also shown by the request and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po zhing yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa dag na dngos po gang dkon pa dang mod pa cig car zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhing yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa dag na dngos po gang dkon pa dang mod pa cig car zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first request, asking at once what things are rare and what are easy to obtain in pure and impure fields.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu zhing yongs su dag pa dag na dngos po brgyad ni mod la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhing yongs su dag pa dag na dngos po brgyad ni mod la /
translated: Son of good family, in pure fields, eight things are easy,🔽and two things are rare.

original: dngos po gnyis ni dkon no zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis ni dkon no zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: From here down is the second, the Tathāgata's true answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the entities of impure fields, and the teaching on the entities of pure fields.

original: zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhing yongs su ma dag pa dag gi dngos po bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The teaching on the entities of impure fields is also twofold:

original: grangs smos nas lan mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs smos nas lan mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste bshad pa ste /
translated: the brief answer after mentioning the number, and the detailed explanation.

original: 'di'i lan mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lan mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief answer.

original: dngos po mod pa brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: dngos po mod pa brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: The question What are the eight entities? and so on introduces the second part, the detailed explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: dngos po brgyad rnyed sla bar bstan pa dang / dngos po gnyis rnyed dka' bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po brgyad rnyed sla bar bstan pa dang / dngos po gnyis rnyed dka' bar bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching on the ease of attaining the eight entities, and the teaching on the difficulty of attaining the two entities.

original: 'di ni dngos po brgyad sla bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po brgyad sla bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the ease of attaining the eight entities.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught through the question and answer.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: mu stegs can rnams dang sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams dang rigs dang / rus dang cho rigs 'byor pa dang / rgyud pa tha dad pa rnams dang / nyes pa spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / tshul khrims ral ba rnams dang / ngan song rnams dang /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams dang sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams dang rigs dang / rus dang cho rigs 'byor pa dang / rgyud pa tha dad pa rnams dang / nyes pa spyad pa spyod pa rnams dang / tshul khrims ral ba rnams dang / ngan song rnams dang /
translated: the tīrthikas, suffering sentient beings, those of different castes, families, clans, and lineages, those who engage in negative actions, those with damaged ethics, those in the lower realms,🔽those of the Lesser Vehicle, and bodhisattvas with inferior intentions and practices.

original: theg pa dman pa rnams dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba dman pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas dngos po brgyad rnyed sla ba'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa rnams dang / bsam pa dang sbyor ba dman pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas dngos po brgyad rnyed sla ba'i lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: These are the second set of eight things that are easy to obtain, as explained by the Tathāgata in response to the question.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sdom pa yang dag par ma blangs pa'i gang zag nyes byas pa gang yin pa de ni nyes par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sdom pa yang dag par ma blangs pa'i gang zag nyes byas pa gang yin pa de ni nyes par spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are as follows:🔽For individuals who have not taken up the vows, any transgression is called “misconduct.”

original: sdom pa blangs pa gang yin pa des mtshams las 'das pa ni tshul khrims ral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa blangs pa gang yin pa des mtshams las 'das pa ni tshul khrims ral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For those who have taken the vows, any transgression beyond the boundary is called “damaged ethics.”

original: sa'i mdun rol pa dang po sems bskyed pa zhan pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa dman pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol pa dang po sems bskyed pa zhan pa gang yin pa de ni bsam pa dman pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first stage of the bodhisattva is called the stage of joy.

original: tshig gzhan ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gzhan ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The rest of the passage is self-evident.

original: dngos po dkon pa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: dngos po dkon pa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: What are the two things that are rare?

original: gnyis pa dngos po gnyis rnyed par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dngos po gnyis rnyed par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The second verse shows the difficulty of obtaining the two things.

original: 'di yang bstan pa dang lan du gsungs par ston te 'di brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bstan pa dang lan du gsungs par ston te 'di brtag pa'o //
translated: This is also taught in terms of the teaching and the reply.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dang / sbyor ba mchog dang ldan pa rnams kyi spyod pa dang rnam par rgyu zhing 'du ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas @173a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa dang / sbyor ba mchog dang ldan pa rnams kyi spyod pa dang rnam par rgyu zhing 'du ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni / gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas @173a * //
translated: The conduct of the bodhisattvas who have the highest intention and application, the assembly of their followers, and the appearance of the Tathagata in the world.

original: yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The second verse shows the reply of the Tathagata.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rgyu zhing 'du ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par 'jig rten du 'byung ba shin tu dka' bas so //
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rgyu zhing 'du ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par 'jig rten du 'byung ba shin tu dka' bas so //
translated: Because it is difficult for bodhisattvas to move and gather on the first bodhisattva stage and above, and because it is difficult for a tathagata to always appear in the world.

original: 'jam dpal zhing yongs su dag pa dag na ni gong ma las bzlog pa dngos po brgyad ni dkon la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal zhing yongs su dag pa dag na ni gong ma las bzlog pa dngos po brgyad ni dkon la /
translated: In the completely pure lands of Manjushri, the opposite of the above is true and the eight things are rare.

original: dngos po gnyis ni mdo bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnyis pa zhing yongs su dag pa dag na dngos po brgyad ni dkon la /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis ni mdo bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gnyis pa zhing yongs su dag pa dag na dngos po brgyad ni dkon la /
translated: The two things are easy to find, as should be understood from the sutra.🔽In the completely pure lands, the opposite of the above is true and the eight things are rare.

original: dngos po gnyis ni rnyed sla bar bstan pa yang gong ma las bzlog pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis ni rnyed sla bar bstan pa yang gong ma las bzlog pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The two things are easy to find.

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is explained by the sutra itself.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning and the Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna also state in accordance with this sutra.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa rnams khams gsum gyis bsdus sam zhe na /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa rnams khams gsum gyis bsdus sam zhe na /
translated: Are the completely pure lands included in the three realms?

original: smras pa / khams gsum gyis bsdus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / khams gsum gyis bsdus pa ma yin te /
translated: He replied: It is not included in the three realms.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di nyid las 'jig rten las 'das pa de'i bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this very sūtra says that it arises from the roots of virtue that transcend the world.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ;
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ;
translated: Moreover, in the commentary to the noble Perfection of Wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu skyes pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu skyes pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa zhig yin nam /
translated: it says: Are those born in the buddha-fields included in the desire realm?

original: 'on te 'dod pa'i khams sum gtogs pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa'i khams sum gtogs pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Or are they not included in the desire realm?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gang sna tshogs 'dres shing yongs su ma dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan gang sna tshogs 'dres shing yongs su ma dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: He replied: Those other buddha-fields that are mixed and impure are called the desire realm.

original: yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni ngan song gsum dang ; dug gsum gyi ming dang / theg pa gnyis kyi ming dang / skyes pa dang bud med ces bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni ngan song gsum dang ; dug gsum gyi ming dang / theg pa gnyis kyi ming dang / skyes pa dang bud med ces bya ba yang med la /
translated: Those that are pure do not have the names of the three lower realms, the three poisons, the two vehicles, or male and female.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing 'od dpag tu med pas 'jig rten gyis khams snang bar byed pa dang / skad cig ma gcig la lus tshad med par sprul nas 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du byin nas sems can grangs med pa snyed yongs su bzlas te slar rang gi gnas su phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing 'od dpag tu med pas 'jig rten gyis khams snang bar byed pa dang / skad cig ma gcig la lus tshad med par sprul nas 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du byin nas sems can grangs med pa snyed yongs su bzlas te slar rang gi gnas su phyin pa'o //
translated: He has the thirty-two marks, and his immeasurable light illuminates the world systems. In one instant he emanates immeasurable bodies and gives them to as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges river, he completely liberates countless sentient beings, and then he returns to his own place.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de lta bu de ni sa la mi gnas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de lta bu de ni sa la mi gnas pa'i phyir gzugs kyi khams zhes mi bya'o //
translated: That world system is not called the form realm because it does not exist on the level of the form realm.

original: 'dod chags med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams zhes mi bya'o //
translated: It is not called the desire realm because it is free of attachment.

original: gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams zhes mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams zhes mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is not called the formless realm because it possesses form.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i las /
translated: Also, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says:

original: sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa lnga gsungs pa de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam pa yin nam /🔽'on te bye brag yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa la sogs pa dpag tu med pa lnga gsungs pa de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad mtshungs shing mnyam pa yin nam / 'on te bye brag yod par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Are all world systems the same and equal?🔽Or should one say that they are different?

original: smras pa / bye brag yod par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag yod par brjod par bya'o //
translated: They are different.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They are of two types:

original: yongs su @173b dag pa dang ; yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su @173b dag pa dang ; yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: pure and impure.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa dag na ni sems can dmyal ba dag kyang med /🔽dud 'gro rnams kyang med /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa dag na ni sems can dmyal ba dag kyang med / dud 'gro rnams kyang med /
translated: In the pure world systems, there are no hells,🔽no animals,

original: yi dags rnams kyang med /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyang med /
translated: no hungry ghosts,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyang med /🔽gzugs kyi khams kyang med /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyang med / gzugs kyi khams kyang med /
translated: no desire realm,🔽no form realm,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyang med /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyang med /
translated: and no formless realm.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med la de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun 'ba' zhig gnas pas na de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de dag yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med la de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun 'ba' zhig gnas pas na de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de dag yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they are devoid of the feeling of suffering and since the bodhisattva saṅgha alone dwells there, those world systems are called pure.

original: de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum bar chad pa rnams smon lam gyi dbang gis skye'i /🔽de dag na so so'i skye bo'am /
analyzed: de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum bar chad pa rnams smon lam gyi dbang gis skye'i / de dag na so so'i skye bo'am /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have been interrupted on the three levels are born there through the power of their aspirations.🔽The births of ordinary beings and

original: so so'i skye bo ma yin pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi skye ba rnams skye ba med do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ma yin pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi skye ba rnams skye ba med do //
translated: of non-ordinary beings, the listeners, do not occur there.

original: gal te de dag na so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / so so'i skye bo ma yin pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi skye ba med na /
analyzed: gal te de dag na so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / so so'i skye bo ma yin pa'i nyan thos rnams kyi skye ba med na /
translated: If the births of ordinary beings, bodhisattvas and non-ordinary beings, listeners, do not occur there,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams smra ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams smra ba na /
translated: why do the bodhisattvas say:

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang su dag de dag tu yid kyis smon par byed pa de dag thams cad ni de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ci'i phyir smra zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang su dag de dag tu yid kyis smon par byed pa de dag thams cad ni de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ci'i phyir smra zhe na /
translated: “All those who mentally aspire to be born there will be born there”?

original: smras pa / gdul ba'i le lo dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can dge ba'i rtsa bam bsags pa rnams la bsams nas smras pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gdul ba'i le lo dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can dge ba'i rtsa bam bsags pa rnams la bsams nas smras pa yin te /
translated: He replied: I said this considering those who are naturally lazy in subduing their minds and who have not accumulated roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di dag ltar de dag spro bar gyur na le lo spangs te /
analyzed: 'di dag ltar de dag spro bar gyur na le lo spangs te /
translated: If they are inspired, they abandon laziness

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson par byed cing der rim gyis de dag tu skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la brtson par byed cing der rim gyis de dag tu skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: and strive in virtuous dharmas and gradually they will obtain the good fortune of being born there.

original: de ltar na de la bsams pa ni de yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na de la bsams pa ni de yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That is the thought behind my statement.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa dag nang na song yang med na /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa dag nang na song yang med na /
translated: If there are no pure fields,

original: ji ltar lha dang klu la sogs pa srid ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar lha dang klu la sogs pa srid ce na /
translated: how can gods, nagas and so on exist?

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The Arya Buddha land reply commentary states:

original: 'di'i dris tshig dang / lan dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i dris tshig dang / lan dag 'byung ste /
translated: Questions and answers appear there.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin na ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin na ni /
translated: If the domain of the Buddha transcends the three realms,

original: lha la sogs pa mi srid de ;
analyzed: lha la sogs pa mi srid de ;
translated: then gods and so on are impossible.

original: de dag ni khams gsum pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de dag ni khams gsum pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because they are active in the three realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rig pa de lta bu'i rnam par snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rig pa de lta bu'i rnam par snang ste /
translated: The Tathāgatas are aware of such manifestations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyan pa'i phyir dang / sems can yongs su smin bar bya ba'i phyir dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams klu la sogs pa dag tu sprul nas mchod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yang bdag nyid de lta bur sprul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgyan pa'i phyir dang / sems can yongs su smin bar bya ba'i phyir dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams klu la sogs pa dag tu sprul nas mchod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yang bdag nyid de lta bur sprul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: because they are the adornment of the Buddha-land, because they are the development of living beings, because the Bodhisattvas, having emanated as Nāgas, etc., make offerings, and because they themselves emanate in that way and serve the Tathāgatas.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the same text.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa dang / lang gi che bsgyur ba las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa dang / lang gi che bsgyur ba las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: The treatise Mahāyāna-saṃgraha-śāstra, composed by Asvabhāva, and the commentary on it by Līnayi, also teach this.

original: gal te zhing yongs su dag pa dag na theg pa dman pa med na /
analyzed: gal te zhing yongs su dag pa dag na theg pa dman pa med na /
translated: If there is no Hīnayāna in the Pure Lands,

original: 'phags pa shes @174a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes @174a * //
translated: then how is it that the noble

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa ji ltar go zhing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa ji ltar go zhing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: How should one understand and explain the teaching of the commentary on the perfection of wisdom?

original: de las ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yod de dgra bcom pa la sogs pa yang der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de las ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa yod de dgra bcom pa la sogs pa yang der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: It says that a buddhafield is completely transcendent to the three realms, and arhats and so on are born there.

original: smras pa / 'di ni rigs ma nges pa'i nyan thos mi slob pa theg pa chen por sems bsgyur ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i lus len pa dbang 'byor ba'i gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni rigs ma nges pa'i nyan thos mi slob pa theg pa chen por sems bsgyur ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i lus len pa dbang 'byor ba'i gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa yin te /
translated: We reply: This is a bodhisattva who is a true arhat, a nonlearner of the unfixed gotra of sravakas who has changed his attitude to the Mahayana and who takes on a body of transformation and dwells in the palace of mastery.

original: dang po'i gzhi nyid las dgongs nas dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i zhing yongs su dag par skye zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dang po'i gzhi nyid las dgongs nas dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i zhing yongs su dag par skye zhes bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: With this first ground in mind, it was taught that arhats and so on are born in a pure land.

original: yang dag par de na theg pa gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par de na theg pa gnyis yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the two vehicles are present there.

original: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ci'i phyir 'od dpag tu med pa'i mdo las /
translated: If that is so, why does the Aparimitayus Sutra say:

original: nyan thos kyi slob ma tshad med pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi slob ma tshad med pa /
translated: He had countless disciples who were sravakas.🔽

original: mtha' med pa thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa sha stag go zhes gsungs /
analyzed: mtha' med pa thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa sha stag go zhes gsungs /
translated: All of the limitless, countless disciples of the śrāvakas are arhats.

original: gzhan yang bsgom pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgom pa bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Sutra Teaching the Cultivation of an Attitude of Kindness states:

original: gang zag 'bring rnam pa gsum ni zhing der gdod 'bras bu bzhi thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang zag 'bring rnam pa gsum ni zhing der gdod 'bras bu bzhi thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs she na /
translated: The three types of middling persons will attain the four results in that realm for the first time.

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: We reply: The completely pure realm of the Buddha Amitābha is of two types:

original: gzhan longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i zhing ngo //
analyzed: gzhan longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i zhing ngo //
translated: the enjoyment realm and the emanation realm.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas states:

original: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i zhing khams na 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i zhing khams na 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa yod de /
translated: In the realm of the Buddha Śākyamuni there is a completely pure world system.

original: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing yongs su dag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing yongs su dag pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the completely pure realm of the Buddha Amitābha.

original: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing khams na yang 'jig rten gyi khams bkod pa yongs su dag pa yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi zhing khams na yang 'jig rten gyi khams bkod pa yongs su dag pa yod de /
translated: In the realm of the Buddha Amitābha there is a completely pure world system called Array.

original: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Buddha's Pure Land is like that of the Buddha Shakyamuni.

original: mdo 'di las ni gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing gi dbang du mdzad nas theg pa dman pa med ces gsungs pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang mdo 'di las brtsams nas /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing gi dbang du mdzad nas theg pa dman pa med ces gsungs pa yin no // gzhan yang mdo 'di las brtsams nas /
translated: This sutra states that the Pure Land is for the enjoyment of others, and that it is devoid of the Hinayana.

original: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa las /
translated: In the treatise called The Teaching on Being Reborn in a Pure Buddha Land,

original: theg pa gnyis kyi rigs can dag mi skye zhes bstan la /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyi rigs can dag mi skye zhes bstan la /
translated: it is taught that those of the two vehicles are not reborn there.

original: 'od dpag med kyi mdo la sogs pa las ni sprul pa'i zhing la dgongs nas nyan thos yod par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'od dpag med kyi mdo la sogs pa las ni sprul pa'i zhing la dgongs nas nyan thos yod par gsungs te /
translated: In the Amitabha Sutra and other sutras, it is taught that the Pure Land is a manifestation land, and that shravakas are present there.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the shravakas are there by the power of the Tathagata's former aspirations.🔽In the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom Sutra,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: it says:

original: gal te de lta na sangs rgyas 'od dpag med dang / sangs rgyas mi g-yo ba la sogs pa snyigs ma lnga'i dus su 'byung ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na sangs rgyas 'od dpag med dang / sangs rgyas mi g-yo ba la sogs pa snyigs ma lnga'i dus su 'byung ba ma yin na /
translated: If that is so, then if the Buddha Amitābha and the Buddha Akṣobhya and so on do not appear in the age of the five degenerations,

original: ci'i phyir theg pa gsum yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir theg pa gsum yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why would the three vehicles exist?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas dang po thugs bskyed pa'i tshe /🔽sangs rgyas rnams theg pa gsum gyis /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas dang po thugs bskyed pa'i tshe / sangs rgyas rnams theg pa gsum gyis /
translated: We reply: When the Buddha first generated the mind of awakening,

original: @174b sems can sgrol bar gzigs pas 'di skad du /
analyzed: @174b sems can sgrol bar gzigs pas 'di skad du /
translated: he saw that the buddhas liberate sentient beings by means of the three vehicles.🔽Therefore, he made the aspiration prayer, “May I too liberate sentient beings by means of the three vehicles.”

original: bdag kyang theg pa gsum gyis sems can sgrol bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa'i lung dang / rigs pa des na sprul pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa dag na yang theg pa gsum yod par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang theg pa gsum gyis sems can sgrol bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab pa'i lung dang / rigs pa des na sprul pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa dag na yang theg pa gsum yod par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the case, the three vehicles exist even in the pure emanated fields.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī said to the Bhagavat:

original: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: “Bhagavat, what is the name of this Dharma discourse that teaches the definitive meaning of the profound intention?

original: bdag gis ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa bka' bzhin du spyod pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ston to /
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa bka' bzhin du spyod pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba ston to /
translated: The passage beginning with How should I hold it? teaches the second part, the section on practicing in accordance with the teaching.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This passage of the sutra has two explanations.

original: kha cig na re mdo 'di la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo 'di la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Some say that this sutra has two parts:

original: gleng gzhi'i phyogs dang / 'phags pa'i gsung rab yang dag par bstan pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i phyogs dang / 'phags pa'i gsung rab yang dag par bstan pa'i phyogs te /
translated: the part on the introduction and the part on teaching the noble scriptures.

original: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni med do zhes zer te /
translated: There is no part on practicing in accordance with the teaching.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na le'u brgyad pa 'di la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na le'u brgyad pa 'di la phyogs rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: If we apply this explanation, this eighth chapter has two parts:

original: zhu ba dang lan dag gis yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs dang / bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: zhu ba dang lan dag gis yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs dang / bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs so //
translated: the part that is the correct explanation through questions and answers and the part on practicing in accordance with the teaching.

original: de yan chad du zhu ba dang / lan dag gis yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs bshad zin nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du zhu ba dang / lan dag gis yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs bshad zin nas /
translated: Up to this point the part that is the correct explanation through questions and answers has been explained.

original: 'di man chad gnyis pa bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyogs ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad gnyis pa bka' bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyogs ston to //
translated: From here on, the second part is the teaching on practice in accordance with the scriptures.

original: kha cig na re mdo 'di las phyogs rnam pa gsum yod de ;
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo 'di las phyogs rnam pa gsum yod de ;
translated: Some say that this sutra has three parts:

original: le'u dang po gcig ni bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le'u dang po gcig ni bstan pa 'byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The first chapter is called the part on the causes and conditions for the arising of the teaching.

original: le'u gzhan bdun po dag ni 'phags pa'i bstan pa yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le'u gzhan bdun po dag ni 'phags pa'i bstan pa yang dag par bshad pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The other seven chapters are called the part on the correct explanation of the noble teaching.

original: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni le'u bzhi po dag gi mjug tu bstan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni le'u bzhi po dag gi mjug tu bstan pa dag yin te /
translated: The third part on practice in accordance with the scriptures is taught at the end of the four chapters,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely:

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u dang / rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i le'u dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i le'u te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi le'u dang / rnal 'byor rnam par 'byed pa'i le'u dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i le'u te /
translated: The chapter on the characteristics of intrinsic nature, the chapter on the analysis of yoga, the chapter on the stages and perfections, and the chapter on accomplishing the activities of the Tathagata.

original: de yan chad du le'u snga ma gsum po dag las 'byung ba'i bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni bstan nas /
analyzed: de yan chad du le'u snga ma gsum po dag las 'byung ba'i bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni bstan nas /
translated: The first three chapters have already taught the side of correct practice in accordance with the teachings.

original: 'dir ni bzhi po de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya bsgrub pa'i bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bzhi po de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya bsgrub pa'i bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Here, the fourth teaches the side of correct practice in accordance with the teachings of the Tathagata's deeds.

original: kha cig na re phyogs dang po gnyis ni bshad pa snga ma gnyis dang mthun no //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyogs dang po gnyis ni bshad pa snga ma gnyis dang mthun no //
translated: Some say that the first two sides are consistent with the previous two explanations.

original: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni logs na yod de /
analyzed: gsum pa bka' bzhin du yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyogs ni logs na yod de /
translated: The third, the side of correct practice in accordance with the teachings, is elsewhere.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ji skad du byang chub sems dpa' @175a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ji skad du byang chub sems dpa' @175a * //
translated: As the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says,

original: sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal chos kyi rgyal po dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'khor thams cad rab tu dga'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal chos kyi rgyal po dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang bcas pa'i 'khor thams cad rab tu dga'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahasattva Manjushri, the Dharma King, and the entire retinue of gods, humans, demigods and so forth were delighted.

original: mdo gzhan dag las tshig mi 'byung ba ni rgya gar gyi dpe nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las tshig mi 'byung ba ni rgya gar gyi dpe nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason why the words do not appear in other sūtras is that the Indian texts themselves are not in agreement.

original: yang na lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang na lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: Or else, it is said that this is because the translators had different ideas.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang 'dir ni re zhig gnyis pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang 'dir ni re zhig gnyis pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Although there are explanations in three parts, here it is applied to the second part.

original: phyogs 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This section is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi mtshan dang bka' bzhin bsgrub pa'i chos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po 'phags pa'i gsung rab kyi mtshan dang bka' bzhin bsgrub pa'i chos zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the request for the name of the noble scriptures and the Dharma to be practiced as taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa nges pa'i don bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Son of good family, this is called the definitive meaning teaching that accomplishes the activities of the Tathāgatas.

original: khyod kyis yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis yongs su gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: You should uphold it. And so forth.

original: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: The second shows the Tathāgata’s reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: gsung rab kyi mtshan smos nas 'khor rnams de bzhin du bsgrub par bskul ba dang / bstan pa thos pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste 'di na dang po'o //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi mtshan smos nas 'khor rnams de bzhin du bsgrub par bskul ba dang / bstan pa thos pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste 'di na dang po'o //
translated: encouraging the retinue to practice in that way by mentioning the title of the teaching and teaching the benefits of hearing the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba bsgrub pa'i nges pa'i don bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this teaching on the definitive meaning of accomplishing the Tathāgata’s activities was explained,

original: 'khor 'dus pa de las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdun khri lnga stong gis chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so so yang dag pa'i rig pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khor 'dus pa de las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdun khri lnga stong gis chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa so so yang dag pa'i rig pa thob par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: from that gathered retinue, seventy-five thousand bodhisattva mahāsattvas attained the realization of the perfect realization of the dharmakāya.

original: gnyis pa bstan pa thob pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan pa thob pa'i phan yon ston to //
translated: This shows the benefits of attaining the teaching.

original: 'di ltar 'khor 'dus pa de las byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis bstan pa thos pas sa bcu pa rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku thob nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor 'dus pa de las byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis bstan pa thos pas sa bcu pa rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku thob nas /
translated: In this way, from that gathered retinue, seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained the dharmakāya, the perfection of the cause of the tenth bhūmi, by hearing the teaching.

original: da dung gya nom par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku ma thob pa yin te /
analyzed: da dung gya nom par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i chos kyi sku ma thob pa yin te /
translated: Still, they have not attained the Dharma Body of perfect result, because they have not attained manifest complete Buddhahood.

original: gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other places are not the place of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: dpe gzhan gnyis las byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa thob par gyur to zhes 'byung ngo //🔽'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa rgya'i slob dpon wang tshig gis mdzad pa rdzogs sto /
analyzed: dpe gzhan gnyis las byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa thob par gyur to zhes 'byung ngo // 'phags pa dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel ba'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa rgya'i slob dpon wang tshig gis mdzad pa rdzogs sto /
translated: In the other two examples, it is said that seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained the perfect Dharma Body.🔽The commentary on the noble sutra of the profound interpretation of the thought, composed by the Chinese master Wang Xizhi, is complete.

original: // / dpal lha btsan po'i bka' lung gis zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong 'gos chos grub kyis rgya'i dpe las bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / dpal lha btsan po'i bka' lung gis zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong 'gos chos grub kyis rgya'i dpe las bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: By the command of the glorious divine king, the great translator-monk Chö-drup of Shuchen translated, edited, and finalized it from a Chinese text.
